description:
The peach mule if  fuzzy & snaps back. 

I was told that in SanFran a must have is the bread bowl clam chowder, and it do not disappoint!
author: Kristina K.

description:
We stopped in here two nights as we were staying at the Argonaut Hotel.  Hotel is great, but unfortunately this restaurant is not.

First night we ate dinner - it was only 1/3 full at prime time on Friday night which should have been our clue.  We both had the crab and corn chowder - Taste was good but soup was served lukewarm.  My partner had crab cakes and was not impressed - I had fish and chips with garlic fries which were okay but not memorable.

Food was 3 stars and service was 1 star - our waiter went through the motions but rarely checked in with us and obviously didn't care.

Second night we just had a drink in the bar - service again was just lacking and bartender checked out.
author: Lynn A.

description:
Let me say that based on just customer service, then this restaurant would deserve 5, even 6 stars. Everyone who we interacted with was above and beyond polite and impeccable in their service. The food came out quickly and their portions were great for the price paid.

I give it three stars, however, because this is a restaurant and their food was just alright. It wasn't bad but it wasn't delicious either. It just was. It was food and I was hungry, so it provided me sustenance. 

The atmosphere is nice and their outdoor seating area is lovely. It's also in a nice area with great ambience. So I still suggest you give this place a shot because maybe my tastes would just differ than yours. I will say at least that even if not entirely flavorful, their clam chowder certainly was full of "chow", chopped tiny, just the way I like it!
author: Michelle E.

description: Ate there on 9/18. My friend and I ordered the New England style clam chowder bread bowl and I ordered a Manhattan style clam chowder cup with half salad. Both plates were delicious, although I got to add that the New England clam chowder did taste better than the Manhattan. The Manhattan is more for chili bowl lovers, as it has the tomato soup base to it. It was still good though. This is the perfect spot for grabbing something quick but yet still in a fashionable decore restaurant. It's perfect for those windy chilly moments down at the Wharf.
author: Georgina E.

description:
We were on the hunt for some good old clam chowder.  Perhaps something that was served in a sourdough bread bowl.  Since the weather was beautiful last Sunday we wanted to sit outside.  A sign said to wait there and wait for the host/hostess.  We noticed two tables were already seated.  One of the tables looked like they just wanted drinks while the other table had food.

We waited and waited.  Waited some more. Then waited even longer than that.  Along came a brown headed kid who I assume was a host.  When I say kid, he looked no more than 21 or 22 years old and he was a cocky son of a bitch too.  He cocked his head up and said something like "hey" and stood there staring at us.  Good thing our interaction was a full 30 seconds before we were seated.

We scoured the menu since we wanted a snack to hold us over until dinner time.  We waited and waited.  Waited some more. Then waited even longer than that. See a reoccurring theme here?  This isn't an Edgar Allan Poe story or anything and not nearly as entertaining.

No one came with water or offered drinks.  No one checked in on us.  Nothing happened so after about 15 minutes or so we left.  The food here sounds good but I guess we'll never know.
author: Alex L.

description:
Seafood for the win here! It's fresh and they make the flavor of the sauce swell! 

The kale and romaine salad is very dressy! 

Mussels were delightful!  I drenched the garlic toasted bread that they served with the shrimp linguine, with the shrimp and mussels entree!  It was savory on every bite. 

Crab chowder instead of clam was homely. 

Standard bar restaurant decor.  Conveniently close to the park and pier!
author: Tiffany D.

description: We had the corn chowder and the New England clam chowder. Both are absolutely amazing and they have very good sourdough bread. Their prices are great for being right on the Bay. Our waitress went above and beyond anything we needed. Ask for Holly.
author: Sabrina R.

description: Came here around 11am one day and it wasn't too busy. A very nice looking restaurant and good service. I tried the crab and corn chowder in a bread bowl and it was very good. The bread was fresh, crispy on outside and soft on the inside. The soup had huge chunks of seafood. Overall a very filling and delicious meal.
author: David T.

description: We really enjoy this place, I don't know why they only have 3 stars and half, they have the best chowder, our waitress was friendly and recommended couple of wines to combine our food which she did great; overall, oysters, food, wine and desserts were just perfect
author: Andrea M.

description:
Stopped here while passing through the area but should have known better since it is definitely the tourist area. Just an overall average experience with a higher price point.

Service was marginal. I believe our first server went off shift partway through our meal and was not picked up by anyone. Drinks were not refilled and was slow getting our bill for payment.

Food - nothing special. Garlic fries were not very crispy and seemed slightly under cooked. The fish was ok but the batter was pretty bland.
author: Mike P.

description:
Stopped in around 4pm and nobody was in the restaurant.  Of the many choices in fisherman's warf for clam chowder, we picked the blue mermaid purely based on the name. We did not like the clam chowder because it lacked the main event-- CLAMS! We didn't really like the flavor. We also ordered the crab dip, I didn't like the flavor or consistency. Our server changed between 3 different people who were "taking over" for each other. 

I really wanted to like this place :( maybe I will give it a second chance at the bar, that looked pretty cool!
author: Janelle J.

description:
Recently stayed at the Argonaut Hotel; which made this place convenient to eat at due to its location right in the lobby. 

My mother had been raving about this place as she had gone down there for drinks the past few nights and loved the ambiance. Therefore when she suggested we try it for dinner, I was looking forward to it.

We entered through the outdoor courtyard and saw there were not many people. First thought...this should be great service! It stops right about there. Once we finally were seated we were greeted by Brian. 

Pros:
-Love the ambiance, especially if you get a seat right by the fire pit
-They have ONE vegetarian option

Cons:
-We were told at 6:00 pm they were out of the crab dip my mother had her heart set on
-Service was awful, extremely slow and took forever to get anything. While Brian was a nice gentleman and was trying; the place seemed understaffed as managers were helping assist with drinks and taking orders (as it appeared). He was taking on far too many tables obviously....
-The vegetarian option was spicy, it has a kick! Must be the garlic?
-My garlic toast never came out with my entrée
-One of our entree's did not come out with the rest of the food 
-Unsure if bread is complimentary or not? Some tables had a basket of bread while we did not

Overall food was mediocre at best, service was not great, pricing and location is overrated for what you receive. 

Not sure if I would come back to give this place a 2nd shot....however my mother really still desires to try that crab dip.
author: Sara-Marie F.

description:
We were excited for some clam chowder and ahi tuna tacos so we waited outside by the sign that said a hostess would be with us shortly. So we waited.....and waited....and waited. A guy came out and said something that sounded like "Sup?" (surely this isn't what he said??) and we told him we were waiting because of the sign. He looked as if he had never seen the sign, sat us begrudgingly then left. 

And guess what? We waited.....and waited....and waited. The whole time we didn't see a server so we ended up just leaving. Adios Blue Mermaid!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
We stayed at the Argonaut hotel and received four $10 dollar coupons to use at the Blue Mermaid restaurant. The bread bowl soups are good, the kale Caesar salad was tasty, and the grilled asparagus was well charred. The service was good, and we were able to use two of the four $10 coupons, because there is a limit to one $10 coupon per room. We had two rooms.

The restaurant staff were nice and helpful.
author: Angela C.

description:
After a long day walking in the museum and union square. We decided to come to this restaurant to have some food (friend's mon really love their chowder but they sold out :/).  We ordered a seafood special tower that was offered on the menu for Saturday's special. Then I ordered the kale salad with chicken, friends ordered something else and I don't recall what they've ordered lol... As for beverages, we ordered 2 glasses of white wine, one glass of whiskey on the rock, and a bloody marry.

Personally, I think the salad was pretty fresh and the chicken was well executed. The chicken was tender and still can taste the sweetness of the vegetables. I know white wine doesn't really go with the dish. But wth I want some white wine lol....

The only downside is the seafood tower and the whiskey. The whiskey was not on the rock as we requested. But rather shoved with multiple small pieces of icecube. For whiskey lover, this is a big no-no. But then it was served. As for the seafood tower, the crab, mussel, shrimp were great. But then the oyster has a fishy taste. Not as fresh as it should be. Overall, the service and the food was okay. Nothing much to complaint about.
author: Jeff H.

description: Very friendly staff and center of touristy areas, but two star is from the extremely limited selection of foods. Mainly full dishes and breakfast menus, would be great if they had some appetizers and snack options for people just want to take a break between lunch and dinner.
author: Kimberly H.

description: The crab and corn chowder was delicious!! My dad said it was the best soup he had ever had. The bartender was also very nice and helped me with my yelp offer with a smile on his face. We will definitely be grabbing more chowder before this vaca is over!
author: Sarah L.

description: If you're looking for CRAB AND CORN chowder, this is your place - especially on a cooler day. Stop in and have a quick bowl or cup, it will make your day.
author: Elyse G.

description: The ahi tuna tacos and the boil were amazing. I'd visit this place again when I return to SF
author: Tory A.

description:
There are many places to get clam chowder around Fisherman's Wharf. Their's was really good and I would go back for more. 

We went in at 11:00am on a Saturday. They did inform us that they were only serving chowder and salad while they were setting up for lunch. This was fine with us because we came for the chowder!

I got New England in a sourdough bowl and my boyfriend got the crab and corn chowder. We were both very happy with our food, our beer, and our really friendly waiter.
author: Amy L.

description:
While there is almost no notion of clam in their chowder, the salad with fish topping is awesome.  My favorite 2 are the ceaser with crab cake and peach salad with salmon.

For tourist spot this has got to be one of my favorite salad place in fisherman wharf area.
author: David H.

description:
Some of the best clam chowder around!
The staff could be more aware of their timing and welcoming of guests.
author: Sharon O.

description: Hear me out, amazing  service and the location is beautiful too. However the meals were expensive for what they were. From the small plates/appetizers section the baked crab dip is delicious and a good amount of food for the price. My mom got the cocktail shrimp and this is where I found myself shocked. There were 5 shrimps and hardly any cocktail sauce. Not worth $16 at all but I guess I can't complain too much. Be aware that almost everything on the menu was $20-$30 which seems pricey to me, but I understand that it's a touristy area and that should be expected. Worth going just be ready for steep prices.
author: Cara H.

description:
A fancy restaurant in the front. When you walk to the next room for the bathroom, it's a fancy bar lounge where there are patio benches that you can sit and imagine you're on an ocean liner. There are sails at the bar to give you the feel. In the bathroom, it's designed like you're in the ocean liner. Mirrors are the portholes. Clean and lightly dim. 

For late lunch, I ordered clam chowder bread bowl to hit the spot from walking around in the windy cold weather of San Francisco. Food was great and customer service was pleasant. It's both casual and romantic.
author: Miriam T.

description: I wanted to like this place for their casual and inviting atmosphere. I just saw a waitress see something floating in a wine glass, ask the bartender what it was, and then she pulled out a straw and had another waiter help her remove it from a glass...
author: Maritza Y.

description:
Dining at the blue mermaid was a pretty good experience! It was in Fisherman's Wharf so it was almost all seafood.

I ordered the clam chowder and the Dungeness crab cakes and while they were good, I have definitely had better. There are probably many other better tasting option nearby. The portions were not too big or heavy so it was definitely on the healthier side and it is great if that is what you are looking for.

The service was good and the food came extremely fast. I have never had food brought to me that quickly before! The presentation of the food was great and the ambiance was nice but very dimly lit. The food was decent and the service was great.
author: Preetha V.

description: We walked out after 18 minutes. No waiter.  No water served.  It wasnt busy. Arrived at 1143am. Left at 12 noon. We asked the hostess to find the server.  Still another 7 minutes.  After we returned from the washroom on our way out, she caught us. We told her we were unhappy and she just had lots of excuses.  She was quite aggressive.
author: Marjorie M.

description: Don't waist your money. We were staying at the Argonaut hotel and they gave us a $10.00 off or meal or drinks card. So we thought "why not?". Let me tell you why...the food has absolutely no flavor! We had asparagus with balsamic, Farro risotto, peach and farro salad and the crab corn chowder. The only thing that was good was the chowder. It was amazing how little flavor there food has ( and I am not one of those people that adds salt).
author: Robin R.

description: Lunch - sat outside and Listened to the steel band playing island tunes. Very nice at 56' it was warmer in Maine today than SFO! Had a couple of local beers that were very good along with a glass of wine. Fish and chips was very good with garlic fries. Not too heavy not too light. The Kale salad with salmon was large and filling and could be and was a meal. Service good. Worth a visit!
author: Kb D.

description:
I consider this to be a nice little gem in the super touristy haven that is Fisherman's Wharf. It's nice because it's near all the sights of the Wharf, but it's a little off the beaten path and doesn't have the inauthentic touristy vibes that many places on the main drag reek of. 
I've never had the clam chowder, but the crab and corn chowder is DELICIOUS. It's the reason why I've never tried the clam chowder... I know it's good and see no reason to divert from it. I'd recommend getting it in a bread bowl, of course. 
Additionally, the cocktails are great. I've always encountered super personable bartenders who can make great cocktails and great conversation, and they've got a nice bourbon selection. Thumbs up!
author: Traci A.

description:
We had a 10 off coupon while staying at the Argonaut so we decided to have breakfast one morning . They never brought our toast and they served us burnt pancakes. I'm sure this restaurant has good potential but they need to
Have a cook that pays better attention to cooking. Service was ok
author: Michelle W.

description:
If you want some good crab go to Blue Mermaid!

I had clam chowder, baked crab dip, and crab cakes. They were all very good and highly recommended. Yet the serving sizes are very small and blue Mermaid Restaurant is expensive. I wish they had given a bigger portion.

Except for the portion sizes Blue Mermaid was great!
author: Ajay V.

description:
We enjoyed out stay at The Argonaut Hotel. We received a $10 credit at the connected restaurant The Blue Mermaid. We went in and sat at the bar. We sat down about 12:30 on Sunday 04/14. The restaurant was half full, same with the patio and no one at the bar except my wife and I. It was over 10 minutes before anyone even acknowledged us. The most frustrating part was several employees went behind the bar (the server from the patio a young lady with glasses, the manager a lady with a vest and the other ended up being the bartender) and not only didn't say anything but didn't even make eye contact. 

I would expect at least a "Hello, someone will be right with you". Even McDonald's does that. I would expect a restaurant in the Argonaut Hotel to provide better service than that. I thought, well maybe it's busy and employees are overwhelmed but I observed a gathering of employees and manager standing around joking and having conversation. 

When the bartender finally showed up (looks like he was stocking up and getting ready to make a big batch of bloody mary mix) it was still several minutes before he even spoke to us....UNBELIEVABLE!

He finally just looked at me but didn't say anything and that's when I lost it and said "Well, I didn't know if I was ever going to be served as everyone ignored me". Still he smirked and didn't say anything. We ordered a couple of beers and some food and it was fine from there, but I still had a real bad taste in my mouth from being ignored. 

To add to my poor experience I noticed the next two parties that sat at the bar and they were treated totally different. Eye contact, and a pleasant greeting. Even gave one guy a taste of different wines before pouring a glass. I'm not sure what we did wrong. All we did was walk in and sit at the bar. 

I really hate to go this way, but I have to say perhaps it's because I'm African-American? What else could it be? My wife and I did not deserve to be treated this way. We didn't do anything wrong.  I will never eat there again even it was for free!
author: Byron J.

description: The fish tacos I ordered have a beer flavour on its breading.  The green salad that came with it has a very large portion of fresh green variety.  I used the Yelp free appetizer offer if you order a meal, and they gave me a choice on what to get from the small plate menu - I chose the crab dip and it is a meal in itself.  The dip is filled with chunks of crab.  I tasted some garlic fries from my friend's plate and they were tasty.  Overall, everyone was satisfied with the large portion and taste of the food they got.  The waitress was very accommodating and courteous.  She comes up often asking how we are doing and constantly filling our water.  The prices are very reasonable especially at a location that is considered a tourist trap.  I would come back to this restaurant.
author: Anson K.

description:
I was expecting way more.

Everything was mediocre. I came in craving clam chowder. I ordered a.m bread bowl of New England clam chowder and there was hardly any clams and it tasted like pickles. There was so many chopped up pickles in it.

The waitress only checked on us once so we waited longer than I liked for the bill. There was hardly anyone there so I felt like she just didn't really care to serve us. 

Not coming bk. There are way better places to eat in Fishermans wharf.
author: Wendi J.

description:
Great rainy day place and it wasn't too touristy.  Attached to the Argonaut hotel in the Cannery, we came in for a late lunch.  There is something to be said for  a bowl of clam chowder in sourdough bread at the Wharf in San Francisco!  Even this jaded San Francisco native who avoids tourists like the plague comes down here to soak up the atmosphere!

I don't get this way often but when I do get here I enjoy the clam chowder in the bread bowl and the Ahi BLT which are perfect representatives of San Francisco cuisine twists.  They also have some nice cocktails but this was a business lunch with work still to be done.

My 3-star rating has nothing to do with food or service, but rather that they left the door open on a cold and windy day.  This also allowed two pigeons to wander in and it freaked us out when one wandered under our table and touched my lunch companions foot!

Nobody said anything and nobody even seemed to care about shooing the pigeon away!
author: Erik H.

description: We visited The Blue Mermaid last month. We had a great lunch and great Service. Sat outside, so much better than some of the honky tonk places across the street. Highly recommend
author: Laura R.

description: Just got a clam chowder to go.  It was creamy and hearty, chock full of potatoes, onions, celery and bits of bacon.  But it was missing something...what is it... Oh, I know - clams.  Sorry, no clams in the clam chowder.
author: Alex L.

description:
We have breakfast at the Blue Mermaid basically because we got a coupon from the hotel and it's convenient.
My wife wanted two eggs combo it was just average food.
I ordered a yogurt parfait and toast.
They served me my yogurt then a little while after my wife got served her two egg breakfast they forgot my toast.
Just an average place with average food.
And probably below-average service
author: Veronica R.

description: Stopped in here for a quick beer while bar hopping. It was a little crowded and I'm sure that's why the service is a little slow- totally to be expected! The wait staff was hustling big time and trying to keep everyone happy. Cudos to them! My satisfaction was reflected by my tip! Great job guys I will return!
author: Jamie S.

description: Awful experience we waited for 15 min.for drinks and no one came. Finally we asked the hostess as several staff were standing around she sent someone over to ask if we needed menus because he couldn't take our drink order! We left! Horrible hostess and wait staff. Other reviews on Google and yelp echo the same experience as we had. I generally give 5 stars but can't even get past one for the blue mermaid,
author: Pam G.

description: Being a native San Franciscan, we learned that we have many hidden gems here in the city. One of those jams is the blue mermaid restaurant. If you're in the wharf this is a must stop and eat locations. One of the best chowder in the world but I highly recommend just do the hamburger or cheeseburger. Their menu contains many delicacies so it's up to you to choose. Eat outside by the fire pits and take you and want to San Francisco's true gems
author: Michael B.

description:
I had a really lovely dinner here out on the patio while traveling for business!

I was sight-seeing on Fisherman's Wharf, as I suppose most patrons are, and wanted seafood sans kitsch. Blue Mermaid delivered that. They aren't right on the water (in fact, they're tucked away at the end of the street), but that didn't mean I couldn't sit outside and enjoy the weather. My server was attentive, but not overbearing (which is nice, since I was eating alone.) 

I had a nice glass of wine, some delicious oysters, and an amazing chowder in a sourdough bread bowl for what I thought was a reasonable price. You're in a touristy area and it isn't as though this is a no-frills spot. I would happily be back, if I return to the Bay Area.
author: Ali S.

description: Its a touristy area so parking is hard. I saw someone at the front I assumed hostess wanted to order chowders to go. She told me to talk to bartender to order. I ordered 3 small cups of chowder and the wait time felt long more than a couple of minutes. I assumed it wouldn't take that long since probably soups are made already and amount small. Since I was ordering to go I would think assume it would be a bit quicker than eating there. There was only 2 customers at the bar and no else at the restaurant but wait was just long. The orginal clam chowder I preferred over the others.
author: J L.

description:
Worst food and worst service ever!
If you want your Moule Frites lumped together in a bowl served soggy this is where you should come!
author: Peter D.

description: Very nice restaurant,  great food and service.   I wouldn't recommend this place for younger kids, but a great place for couples or friends.   A little upscale,  recommend nice casual attire.  When available,  the cioppino is the best I've had.  I hate brussel sprouts,  however,  theirs are like vegetable candy.
author: Joel S.

description: Amazing chowder and tuna tacos but neither compares to how amazing Mackenzie our bartender was. Despite her having bad taste in football teams she's incredible and great cocktails. Will be back next time we are in town.
author: David F.

description:
I was more disappointed in this place then less. It wasn't spectacular and their menu was highly priced. The clam chowder was yummy but I've had better. 

I was excited to try their crab cakes but they were pushing $38 so I skipped. 

It's fun for the atmosphere and if I did come back it would be for cocktails and appetizers. Not my favorite by far.
author: Desiree C.

description: Was referred to this place by Les the entertainer. So I came with my friends to get some chowder. When we got there, there was about 4 tables occupied and like 5 servers standing around. We finally got sat. Once we where sat we ordered it took a while. All but one person got there food. We all ate while my friend waited for her soup. We had to get up to ask where the order of soup was. The staff looked at me like I was an idiot. We still didn't get soup everyone else finished there food. The server was non attentive. She never asked how we where doing. I would never go back.  The service was awful.
author: Alexandra R.

description: Seafood is very good at this place. Was recommended by the Hop on Hop of bus tour guide. My friend thought that the restaurant probably told the tour guide to say that but I thought I give it a try. I had the clam chowder bowl and my friend and the shrimp plate. Place did not disappoint the chowder was thick and full of not fishy clams. I have eaten at a few places around the wharf for chowder and I got to say this is one of the better places. The ambiance is nice as well. I highly recommend.
author: Robert C.

description: Visited Blue Mermaid 2x while staying at the Hotel  Argonaut. Beautiful place  - mahogany bar, nautical inspired art. I had the risotto and asparagus side dishes. WOW! Delicious. Literally, the  best risotto I have ever eaten. For desert I had the panna cotta which was also very good. The location is lovely too Right in Fisherman's wharf. Outdoor seating available. Only reason I did not give 5 stars is the wine list was lacking. For such a unique dining experience the wines were uninspired.
author: caroline c.

description: My husband and I love coming here. We frequent SF and end up staying here and cozying up to some creamy Corn Chowder. Don't forget the hot sauce! It's friendly service, casual and the patio is lovely! My only suggestion is to turn the temp down on the chowder. It's mouth burning hot.
author: Amy D.

description: What you would expect for a tourist spot across from Fisherman's wharf.  Food was good, service was slow.
author: Jason H.

description: We stayed at Argonaut and loved the fact that the restaurant was attached to hotel. The location is prime, the patio with fire pits and heaters was the spot. We had dinner and drinks both nights we were there and just drinks by fire pit on 3rd night. Food was excellent! Best crab dip I've had! The pasta was very good as well. Everything we had was delicious! Brian was friendly and nice as well as the manager (didn't get her name), but all staff was very friendly. I will definitely come back again!
author: Gabriela A.

description: Great location, however food and service was not the best. I got bad clam chowder and it made me sick. My daughter got the kids shells and cheese, and my niece got a kids hamburger slider. The meat on the slider was so hard, my niece couldn't eat it. We got the Dunganesse crab boil. The crab was over cooked and the potatoes in the boil were too hard and undercooked. Our waitress gave us attitude when we Asked for drinks and silverware (after she had forgotten to provide us with any at all). I will not be going back. It is a very beautiful restaurant with "okay" food. We spent $176 and left very unsatisfied.
author: Amy G.

description: My boyfriend and I decided on this place because we were staying at the adjoining hotel and we were both very pleased.  The only bad thing for me was that they were out of my favorite wine and I had to choose the more expensive brand of the same type. We started with the crab dip and brussel sprouts which were delicious and then both ordered the NY steak for our entrees. The steaks were both cooked perfectly and the veggies were very well seasoned. I absolutely loved the fingerling potato gratin that came with our steaks. They were cooked perfectly and the sauce was amazing. Over all a great dinner in a great atmosphere.
author: Hillary R.

description: Brunch was amazing. Phenomenal food and great bloody Mary's. Eggs Benedict are highly recommended as is the Egg white Omlette. Jaime was our waiter at the bar and he is amazing! Great guy!
author: Trevor J.

description: My girlfriend and I were looking for a nice place to sit outside for a quick snack and we stumbled upon the Blue Mermaid. It was Sunday afternoon and there was a decent amount of people on the patio. The host provided a warm welcome and quickly walked us to a table on the patio. Our server was just as friendly and welcoming. My girlfriend ordered a bowl of New England Clam Chowder and I added a beef slider to go with my bowl. The slider was an excellent combo with the chowder. She liked the proportionate amount of clams and potatoes in the bowl. We were both grateful for the kind and speedy service that our server provided us with on that day. 5 stars for both the service and the food. We'll definitely be back for more.
author: Patrick A.

description: This place is a tourist trap and a big hairy mess. I ordered the ahi tacos. The were edible. I followed with the grilled asparagus wrapped with prosciutto. I don't know when the grilled them but they were ice cold. I did not chance it on the entree so I left. I should have read the other reviews before coming here. Awful.
author: Kevin M.

description:
So I haven't been overly impressed with the restaurants in Fisherman's Wharf and this place is no exception.   I don't enjoy paying $28 for an overcooked piece of fish. My wife is a vegetarian, ordered a few sides and they were nothing special.  Moscow Mule she ordered was do bad we sent it back ($11 drink).  Best part of the meal was my kids chicken fingers.

I had to walk through the hotel to visit the bathroom during my meal and saw a family staying at the hotel eating In 'n Out burgers at a table in the lobby....and I was jealous of their meal....enough said!
author: Jeff H.

description: Good food and service. They allowed us to order our chowder even though we showed up during their transition out of the breakfast menu. Bread bowl was well made and the chowder was everything I expected. My only qualm is that the price is much higher than it should be, and many nearby competitors offer the same chowder bowl for half the price. I imagine the rest of the menu is what you should be getting because the quality is there, just not the price.
author: Eric F.

description: This place has something for everyone- great appetizers & cocktails for adults and a nice menu with a good variety for the whole family.
author: Kristi W.

description: We stopped in on a chilly day in San Francisco for a soup bread bowl. Service was a bit spotty at first but the crab & corn chowder in a bread bowl was amazing!   Excellent value for a restaurant in a touristy location. Will definitely be back!
author: The Travel C.

description:
A lot of waiting without interaction 
Sign front said they'll be right with us so we waited & waited. Husband finally walk in & was greeted. Restaurant looked pretty empty but was told about 20 minute wait for inside. Fire pit & heat lamps were outside so we went with that option. We waited. Finally a server came  & ordered food. Then we waited & waited. Food came. Pretty much left alone after that. Missing food, needed drink refills, but we waited. Ordered clam chowder not really sure what I received fish taco was a breaded filet put in a shell. Side order came as we were done. Asked for check and received bit of attitude that that's was it.  Seriously? We were ignored.  Only thing this place had was a nice outside eating area. But forget it if you want to be served or have good food.
author: Lisa R.

description: Looks inviting, but life is too short for bad food, and the halibut at the Blue Mermaid is pretty bad.
author: Cape M.

description: This food was delicious. When I ordered my food they got it wrong,fixed it and gave complimentary soup. 5 stars
author: Aidan R.

description:
Ate here three days while staying at the attached Argonaut Hotel. Good food as far as hotel restaurants go and seemed to have locals eating as well as hotel guests. 

Highly recommend the Mexican omelette. The chorizo, pepper, onion filling was the best part of it and made the dish as good as it was. It was so good I ordered it all three morning in a row.

Average service, nothing special but nothing bad about it either. Hotel guests can also charge the bills to their room. Seemed like they had decent dinner specials as well each night, but only dined for breakfast myself.
author: Chris W.

description: Why did I want to go in this place?  The sign of course.  Who can resist that cool, retro mermaid sign?  The outside area was cute too.  It had a fire tower for warmth.  We opted to go inside.  We only had drinks here since we were killing time.  The drinks were fine.  Sorry, I can't comment on food, but if I am ever in the area again, I'll test out the food and let you know.
author: Shevon R.

description: We stumbled across the Blue Mermaid while trying to get away from the crowds at Fisherman's Wharf.  It's a beautiful place.  We only wanted drinks, so we were told our options were the bar or the fire pit outside, where you have to go get your own drinks at the bar.  We would have preferred an outdoor table, and almost all were empty, so the drinks only policy doesn't make sense -- especially when the drinks are so pricey. Nice place though.
author: Fern S.

description: We are staying at the Argonaut Hotel and this is the associated restuarant.  Great food and a great place to begin your day.  Made it a point to try the Crab Corn Chowder.  Oh my. Outstanding.  They do stop serving between 1045 and 1130 to transition the kitchen.  Only chowders are available during 1045 and 1130.  Yes, that was  disappointing to hear.  Other than that. It's a great place.
author: Vincent A.

description: Best lunch deal at the wharf. 16 bucks for a panini and salad and you get linen napkins and top notch service. Off the beaten path a bit but well worth it. Terrific value.
author: JoAnne P.

description: Menu looked great so I decided to go in and sit by the fireplace for a nice meal. Waited for 30 minutes but no one came to serve me, place seemed very understaffed. Terrible service
author: Othman G.

description: We came here for lunch yesterday when my sister and her friends were visiting. We sat outside on their patio and it was wonderful. They have fire pits and with nice weather, it's a great scene. However, I did take note that we were seated with no cutlery or napkins. When they took our drink orders and I requested them, they were not brought for at least 15 minutes. Beyond that the rest of the service was fine. Everyone enjoyed their food. I got the chicken sandwich and garlic fries. Chicken was a little dry but fries were good once a little salt was added. Overall, it was okay. Not sure if I'd go back since, it is at fisherman's wharf and there are a ton more overpriced OK restaurants.
author: Katlyn H.

description: We tried to have afternoon drinks on the patio here but after chasing down a wait staff twice we finally gave up after the first round. I don't get it- they were not very busy but acted like we were such a bother.
author: Paige R.

description: Worst place I have EVER been to! The service was terrible. We sat down at 10am and were given breakfast menus. We finally received our food at 11:30am and were told we couldn't get our burrito because there were no more and it's after breakfast! It should never take that long to get food and everyone else around us got there after us, ordered, ate, and left before we even got our food! 30 minutes to even order drinks is ridiculous! My French toast was mostly batter, and the Oscar Benedict's were cold. We kept being told they were busy, but when you looked inside hey definitely were not very busy! I will never come back here!
author: JamieLynn S.

description: Terrible. I was actually SHOCKED by how terrible it was. After waiting a half hour before anyone even talked to us, we ordered our breakfast and waited another HOUR before the server brought food to the rest of the table and informed me that they were no longer making my order because it was now lunch time. Basically "Sorry. You get nothing." I was literally there for an hour and a half and did not get anything to eat, while I watched my friends eat their (cold) breakfasts. Nothing else was offered to me except "Sorry about that." Absolutely ridiculous.
author: Colleen B.

description:
This was our second time coming here after participating in the Special Olympics 5k Dash and Polar Plunge. It was quite chilly today so we were looking forward to some clam chowder.

I like the location, it's not in a sketchy area and its amongst other restaurants that seem pretty busy as well. 

All of the clam chowders have pork in them except for the Manhattan, which is what I ordered and it contains mostly red bell peppers, shrimp,clams, and other veggies. Some chowders could actually be made gluten free as well for those on certain diets. My family and I also ordered calamari for an appetizer and it was very good! The marinara sauce was surprisingly spicy which we enjoyed. My brother's Caesar salad was way too fishy in my opinion... But we enjoy this place and will probably be back next year after we take the Plunge! ;)
author: Jaclyn M.

description: We came in here on New Year's Day 2018 for clam chowder. After all it's what they advertise on their site. It wasn't until we were seated and ordering that we were informed "we ran out of clam chowder."  She suggested a crab and corn chowder which although it tasted OK, was not what we were looking for.  It was a bland corn chowder and I couldn't taste any crab.  The clam chowder at Half Moon Bays Sams Chowder House was literally 90% better!
author: Maria M.

description: Nice outdoor patio with fire pits. Clam chowder was good. Fish and chips were okay. Service was slow. Poor beer selection.
author: Cassi P.

description: We had a simple breakfast before hitting black Friday's sales super service and very enjoyable!
author: Jerry P.

description: Amazing food. Amazing server, her name is McLaren and she totally took care of us. I had the Challah French Toast. Awesome raisin bread that they used and berry butter. Best ever, will definitely be back for this or try something else.
author: Tommy M.

description: We were staying at the Argonaut and decided to check out this restaurant because we had the $10 coupon. We were very pleased with every aspect of our dinner - the fish & chips were great, the atmosphere was nice and the service was friendly and fast!  A very nice experience all around.
author: Lori W.

description:
The Ahi tuna taco appetizer rocked my world. They were served in these crispy wonton shells that somehow didn't crumble into a million pieces when I bit in - magical!

The bartender told me they were famous for their chowder, so I had to try it. It was good but I wasn't blown away by it. I prefer chunks of crab to the shredded form. And it was a little too fishy tasting for me. 

Bartender was great. I liked the atmosphere. Overall good experience.
author: Michelle S.

description: Stopped in for bk was too late! Bartender McKenzie offered us a seat at her bar.  She was friendly , fun and outgoing.  She also takes great pics . Makes a mean espresso and a damn good Bloody Mary ! Stop by you will enjoy  she can handle a crowd.
author: Holly S.

description: Crab and corn chowder good. Clam chowder good. The soups were a good portion. Service was slow and took a while to find someone to seat us but after some persistent asking of the staff, it happened. Great vibe and atmosphere. Someone in our party ordered the salad and it was a large portion.
author: Kim H.

description: The food was good, but it wasn't spectacular or anything. We had the seafood tower which is the Saturday special. The food was super fresh, but it was all very basic. We ordered the crab dip as an appetizer, and it was a bit heavy on the celery. I couldn't see the outside seating area, but the inside wasn't too crowded. The waitress tried to be attentive, but she was just too busy for the most part of our visit. I understand that a price tag comes with seafood, especially on the wharf... but I just don't think it was worth the money. The tower, the app, and 2 drinks cost us around a hundred dollars. I feel like they just need to add a bit of pizzazz to their food and maybe overall presentation. There's def room for growth here. Also, one waitress claimed the "new" recipe they use for the crab dip is spicy?? It's for sure not. It's a bit dull honestly.
author: Anna H.

description: We stopped in for lunch on a weekday. The restaurant has great ambiance and a nice outdoor seating area with heaters to keep you warm on a cold summer day in San Francisco.  The host was very helpful and friendly, but the wait staff were a little slow to come take our drink orders. We were happy with the food. It didn't blow us away, but it was good for the price.
author: Brandon S.

description: Great restaurant/bar with an amazing bartender whose name is McKenzie. She was nonstop and made great drinks. The crab chowder was amazing!
author: L H.

description: Service is mediocre but the corn  chowder is the bomb! I also had the fish tacos they where okay but next time I order the chowder and maybe just a salad.
author: Tippy T.

description:
Food:  Corn and crab chowder and fish and chips were good. The Parmesan garlic fries were done right.  The kid's grilled salmon was good and so was the fresh fruit. The sourdough bread was okay but the calamari had no taste and the dip was awful. I dipped it into my husband's cocktail sauce instead. The side of Mexican rice also had no flavor. The kid's lemonade was not good either. 

Service: the hostess seated us right away. She was friendly. The waiter was nice enough but he kind of disappeared towards the end. He also never asked us how we liked our food and he never came by to offer dessert. 

Ambience: Nice decor and comfortable seating at the booth
author: Cheyenne P.

description: Best cioppino in San Francisco!!! Highly recommend! The wedge salad is great as well! We sat outside and it was great people watching!
author: Echols J.

description:
Took a friend here after showing her the Fisherman's Wharf tourist area.  

The service was tops.  The wine was very good.  The crab and corn chowder was truly amazing and among the best I have ever had.  The rest of our dishes were also fantastic.  Outdoor dining at night with the heaters made for a very enjoyable experience.
author: Flint W.

description:
Very good HH specials. Homemade chowders are good; my favorite is the California chowder which is like New England but more veggies.

Much better eating here than the other places at Fishermans Wharf so walk the extra blocks for better food and prices.
author: Ana W.

description:
I've eaten in a lot of Italian restaurants since pasta is my favorite food, but the meal I had was just "ok". 

I first started with a cup of the crab and corn chowder soup. It had a bit of kick in the flavor, which was different, and had, what looked to be, bits of bacon in it and green onions or jalapeño. Next I ordered the Linguini and Manila Clams with garlic, tomato, basil, marinara sauce and garlic toast. The clams were nicely steamed but there wasn't a separate plate given to put the shells. Also, the noodles were all clumped together and didn't seem like it was rinsed with cool water to separate the noodles. 

A friend of mine had ordered the Bone-In NY steak and the house salad with vinaigrette salad dressing on the side. 

Beware contacting the "restaurant". You may get the Hotel Argonaut in Seattle.  I tried to tell the restaurant that I had a reservation and that I would be a little late.  The "girl" on the phone didn't know what I was talking about nor did she have any clue how to get in touch with the restaurant. She forwarded me to a guy who gave me the same number I just called to reach the girl I originally spoke to.

Food is "ok" but not worth the drive all the way down to the wharf.  There's other restaurants in the area worth your dollar towards a better meal and service.
author: O ..

description:
Soup was good, but otherwise save your time and go somewhere else. 

I stopped in with a group of 6 for lunch on a Sunday and wanted to eat outside. They didn't have a table big enough so we sat inside. Then they only had a limited  brunch menu, and aside from a salad the only gluten free option was a hamburger without a bun.  Complete let down for a restaurant 20 steps from the Bay. 

The fried fish tacos only included two tacos and it was served with a salad (neither mentioned on the menu). The fish really didn't have much flavor and was definitely not worth the $20 they were charging. 

Others in the group tried the two clam chowders and crab and corn soups which were good.  Fish and chips were okay, so was the turkey club. 

I typically love a place that has a narrow and focused menu, but I feel this place missed the mark.
author: Phillip H.

description: Worst eating experience of my life. No host upon arrival and took at least 20 minutes for any attention from nonexistent server. When server did come over she attended another group that sat down after us. Then they said the kitchen was closed because we arrived between breakfast and lunch so we had to wait to get food. When it arrived it mediocre at best. This visit almost ruined my whole trip to San Francisco! Never go here!
author: Noel D.

description:
Vesta and I used to go to Houlihan's for popcorn shrimp every time we went to the Wharf. The atmosphere is nice, the servers friendly and it was like a tradition with us.

However, since coming back to America after a decade on the sea, Vesta and I decided to try the Blue Mermaid, cuz a guy at the In and Out said their popcorn shrimp was to die for and sailors and ex sailors alike just got a thing for mermaids. So a good recommendation combined with a place called the Blue Mermaid, we had to go.

And it's good that we did. We spent quite a bit of time there. The popcorn shrimp really was to die for and we had wine too. Then some more wine, then we decided to stay for dinner and we had fish and chips.

And remember, I told you we lived on the ocean for ten years? We've had fish and chips in a lotta places, including all over England and the last time I had fish and chips this good, that Vesta didn't make, was in a place on the wharf in Auckland that served 'em in newspaper.

So, will we go back to the Blue Mermaid? You bet your bottom dollar, your top one too.

And yes, it is a bit pricy. But, you know, you don't gotta stay and eat if you don't like the prices. I would never, never ever, downgrade a restaurant's rating, just cuz it was expensive. However, as far this place is concerned, the fare was worth every cent.
author: Ken D.

description: Went gear for early dinner. Was looking forward to sitting down having a great appetizer and some clam chowder in a bread bowl. The restaurant didn't have any appetizers. The chowder came to the table barely warm and tasting like it came from a can. Kinda disappointing for San Francisco. My daughters friend ordered the grilled chicken sandwich which looked amazing and was good. The waitress was awesome and nice. She exchanged the clam chowder for their lobster corn chowder which was hot and not too bad in tasting. If it hadn't been for the waitress the experience would haven been way worse.
author: Jessica C.

description:
By far the worst experience in San Francisco, who manages this place??
Service is so bad!!
author: Gerry R.

description:
The tour guide we had pointed out this place as a great place to have chowder - but we didn't have a spare moment to come here until breakfast on our last day. 

They didn't serve the chowder, but we did have some delicious French toast with strawberry butter. We also ordered the black Irish coffees which were delicious.
author: Mallory E.

description:
Visiting SF and randomly chose this place for dinner. My server was very friendly (and offered advice on a few things I asked about in terms of SF neighborhoods and such) and he was very attentive. Food was good and I noticed that all of their draft beers seemed to be made in CA! 

This is also a restaurant that participates in the Healthy SF program (which I had to Google) so there was a small tax on my bill but I don't mind. Everyone deserves healthcare and the service industry rarely offers positions with benefits. So, major kudos to CA (and Blue Mermaid) for that one.
author: Brit L.

description: Though Blue Mermaid and Argonaut Hotel are a "pair", Mermaid still works hard to make their own name. All the food we had, from Crab dip to oysters to clam chowder and that totally yummy polenta, were top notch. And hotel guests get $10 off to boot!
author: MIchael W.

description: More tasty than you'd expect a restaurant to be at ground zero for touristville. The tuna sashimi tacos on the appetizer menu are awesome. The crab cakes were excellent. We even ate breakfast there and it was perfectly acceptable. If you stay at the Argonaut, they'll give you $10 coupons making the Blue Mermaid prices downright reasonable. Service was OK to marginal. Ambiance... the building is awesome, decor is pretty acceptable, but not inspiring.  The place is certainly clean & tidy.
author: John And Lorene R.

description:
n  Chowderrrrr

Came here for lunch and it was fantastic~ We wanted to order the clam chowder but the waiter insisted that we won't regret ordering the crab and corn chowder, GREAT DECISION! 

The chowder tastes amazing with a lot of ingredients inside and it is extremely rich and creamy. I personally didn't like the sourdough bread bowl but I guess it has to be sourdough to hold the chowder.
author: Jess K.

description: I had the New England clam chowder (this is the milk based one) in a bread bowl. This place is a little more reasonably priced on their food than other places near the area. It was good.
author: Ana A.

description: Breakfast was excellent.  Cinnamon raisin French toast was the best.  Potatoes and bacon also good.  Coffee was good too, which isn't often the case in restaurants.
author: J M.

description:
Went to this place during my recent trip to SF. I heard so many great things about it being one of the best for its chowders. Let me tell you, was not disappointed at all. I either have good luck in having people recommending good places to eat or I have good taste. Its located near Fishermans Wharf so its a great place to eat when you're a tourist because its next to many things to see. We went on a weekday so it wasn't crowded and we got in right before they closed for dinner. The staff was very attentive and friendly as well sine they knew we were tourists.

We went solely for the purpose of the legendary chowders. We tried the sampler trio and each one was delicious that we ended up ordering a bowl of the Manhattan clam. They do provide fresh bread to accompany your soup which was a nice bonus. Overall satisfied.

If you're ever in this area, it is a must go to!
author: Michelle M.

description: Fantastic day until we arrived at the Blue Mermaid. Hostess Bella,  absolutely no personality or people skills. Employees tell you one thing and then another will come and tell you something completely different. NEVER NERVER EVER WILL I COME HERE AGAIN... Do yourself a favor and go the other way hint hint 39 that way.
author: Tricia L.

description:
We came here for lunch on a Saturday and sat out on the patio for an early lunch. The weather was nice and the patio is well heated.

I had the grilled ahi tuna BLT. The tuna was of good quality and just nicely seared on the outside and good and raw on the inside with good ratios of lettuce and bacon. I will say that the tomato was a bit meager for me. The sandwich was reasonably priced considering the proximity to Fisherman's Wharf.

Service was friendly and attentive.
author: John P.

description: Took my family here last year for a lunch on Fisherman's Wharf, honestly didn't expect much, but I definitely left very satisfied. My niece and nephew never had a bread bowl with clam chowder and they were amazed. Overall great experience, from delicious food and drinks, to friendly staff. We sat outside on the patio which made it even better in a sunny San Francisco day.
author: Davor B.

description:
My wife really wanted a bread bowl of clam chowder and this is the place we walked into. The server was very nice and mindful we were in a bit of a rush. We ended up getting the chowder and oysters and were very pleased with the quality of it. The oysters came with a pink, oniony sauce that was really tasty. 

Very good and nice patio. Solid.
author: Crawford J.

description: Steak and potatoes were good.  I ordered well, they delivered medium.  The waiting times just too long.  Too long to be asked for drinks.  Too long from calamari and chowder to steak dinner.
author: Daniel P.

description: Waited at the front for 5 minutes. Place was empty. Couldn't get anyone's attention to get seated. Another fine example of how San Francisco business owners rest on their laurels and charge way too much for far too little. Couldn't tell you how the food was but the experience was poor.
author: Jim L.

description:
Extremely disappointed in this restaurant within a 5* Hotel.

2 out of 4 mornings the restaurant was out of common breakfast items.

Food overall is good but service is terrible. First my underage niece was told to leave the restaurant because she brought an ice cream in where the staff said she had to go because it's the law. You can't bring in food items from outside. Next, we figured it was just bad service one off incident, but when eventually we were allowed to enter and order our food it took over an hour to get our food and it wasn't even busy. While my husband ordered clams they gave him a full sized fork rather than a clam fork, which was very surprising as this is supposed to be a seafood restaurant and any server should know a full sized fork does not fit into a clam.

Anyone is way better off going outside the hotel to fisherman's Wharf rather than eating at this place.
author: Samantha J.

description: Wedge was good. Clam chowder bread bowl not as good as pier 39 restaurant. Noisy electric guitar across the street took away from experience. Server great.
author: Jenny T.

description: Wonderful setting outside. Peter did a great job recommending wines and soups. Very nice evening
author: Damien R.

description: We were going in for a appetizer and a drink. The place seemed pretty empty, but it was a hot day. More people were on the patio. I think the restaurant was too dark. I couldn't read my menu. I ordered a guiness beer. They said they had it a can. OK no problems. They must of grabbed it off a shelf cause it was weird tasting a fowl smell. Left in the heat I guess.  Once the waiter came back we decided not to order anything and get a refund for the beer. They comp my beer when the server smelt it he was like nope thats not it. My husband was going to tey the world famed chowder but it was too hot.
author: Colleen D.

description: Staying at the hotel attached to the restaurant.  We went for happy hour and sat waiting in the cocktail area with no service.  I finally asked the busser if we could get a server.  He was amazing but that is where it ends.  The crab dip was just ok and the clam chowder tasted burned.  The server was just going through the motions.  We decided that later in the evening we would give the restaurant another chance...boy was that a mistake.  We walked in and asked the hostess if we could sit in the bar area for an appetizer and a couple drinks.  She walked us to our table and that was where we sat for over 10 minutes with no service once again.  So we left and went down the street....we will not be wasting our time at this restaurant anymore.  Very disappointing since we have four more days in San Francisco.
author: Brandy V.

description: Received great service from McLaren on the patio, even when we used complimentary coupons from adjoining Argonaut Hotel for some of our drinks.  Great patio with comfortable seating and firepits.  When it became cold on the patio, she assisted us in moving to a table inside the restaurant and continued as our server through dinner, offering great suggestions. My husband has had a lot of clam chowder, but swears this was the best he has ever had!
author: Chris M.

description: Service was ok, but their corn and crab chowder is the best I've ever had. Also, they half shell oysters were fresh and tasty. The other food was ok, I wouldn't say it was bad or great , just good. But, again, crab and corn chowder!!! Must have it
author: Yana M.

description: Great chowder! Their service was really weird so I had to take off a star. When we first walked in no one helped us and after a minute we were helped and seated them no one came around for a while and we had to grab a buss boy to grab our server. Once we did get our server everything was great! I don't remember his name but the waiter was so kind and went out of his way to make sure we were happy!
author: Taylor L.

description: Nothing exciting here. Stayed at the connecting Argonaut Hotel and had to pay an extra fee giving us a $10 daily credit to use at the restaurant. We went for Breakfast. The menu was quite limited. We ordered the burrito which was listed under the section which included potatoes and toast...which it doesn't come with. Service was very slow with a fairly empty restaurant on a Saturday morning.  The food was good once it came. Suggest not wasting your time unless you really want to use your hotel issued daily credit.
author: Preston P.

description: Chowder was really good. It's in a nice location and has a nice outside seating area. The beer was cold and service was friendly. I'll come back to have chowder and beer.  I really enjoyed the outside sitting area.
author: Douglas F.

description: Everywhere for breakfast had a line around the corner...started walking towards the wharf and stopped here for corned beef hash and Bellinis... Had a gorgeous breakfast by the fire pit and didn't have to wait or sit elbow to elbow. Didn't get to try their crab corn chowder...maybe next time. The corned beef hash was spectacular and the eggs were perfect! Service was ok... Had to ask for water 3 times and my friend's omelet was lacking in cheese but otherwise this was a great alternative for a hungry group and the ambiance was great. Perfect location to eat before walking the wharf/pier.
author: Allison W.

description: Manager updated.   I went ahead and emailed him.   Hotel is great- location, cleanliness and staff.   Restaurant has gone down the tubes in the last two years.    No consistency.  Even the bartenders are all over the place.       Let's see if there is any improvement the next time we're in the City and decide to try once again...
author: Bill F.

description:
Our hotel concierge told us to come here for their award winning corn and crab chowder so we checked it out.

We weren't up for anything super heavy for dinner so we settled on the cold seafood platter that included clams, mussels, lobster claws, oysters and shrimp.  It was pretty solid.  

The chowders that we ordered were a trio including: Manhattan, New England and the Crab & corn.   New England was by far my favorite of these.  The crab & corn was nothing special.  I'm a little surprised that it was award winning actually... The Manhattan was something different and almost had the feel of a vegetable soup.  New experience for the boyfriend and I.

Overall, the bartender was nice but it seemed like we were more of an inconvenience.  The food was just okay.  We probably had our hopes set higher than we should have for chowder.
author: Cindy R.

description: This is a fun place to sit on a patio and relax with a cup of clam chowder and an adult beverage. The daytime menu is pretty limited so be warned. It fits in with my San Francisco tourist strategy which is: walk around and look at things; eat and drink somewhere that has its own restroom. The clam chowder is a good enough reason to stop in even if it's not your primary destination.
author: Laura B.

description:
The service here was so incredibly awful I'm in awe. 

The main problem: our waiter placed the wrong order for the main course. Didn't offer a free drink or dessert, or even ask if we wanted the meal accidentally delivered to us. Service 101: do everything you can to fix the problem, including continual apologies if you want to keep a decent tip. 

My own problem: I didn't enjoy the popcorn shrimp that everyone else seems to rave home about down here but that's just me I guess. 

Never coming back after that service though.
author: Marissa J.

description:
My friend and I were making our way to the other end of Fisherman's Wharf and to Pier 39 when we spotted the restaurant sign for Blue Mermaid and the words "chowder" in the headline. It was a sight for weary travelers like us! We were by the bay, so a nautical themed, and mermaid loving place that beckoned us for some warm chowder really appealed to us.

We ordered our meal, and it was served to us within minutes. I ordered mine in a bread bowl, and it was probably the best dish I had all day. There were morsels of crab in every bite, some sausage, corn, and other creamy soupy goodness in every spoonful.

I will definitely be back, and this is a new SF fave for me.
author: Hanh T.

description:
My husband and I had dinner here. At first glance, the prices seemed high. The music was very loud and the selection wasn't very diverse. He ordered the fish n chips...$19. Not worth the price. Thee tiny pieces of fish and under seasoned garlic fries. I had the chowder trio. Although the New England was nothing like a traditional New England chowder...too watery and not enough clams. The California chowder was my favorite and the corn and crab was second.

I would only come back for the chowder.
author: Emilie G.

description:
Terrible service -- and over priced .. Food is average. Ordered clams they had no taste and Cesar salad , dressing was right out of the Kroger bottle no anchovies and both were recommendation of our waitress -- obvious clueless .. Under new owner/ managers because we dined here 2 years ago and it was pretty good!

I asked to move to a different  table for view and shade at 3:00pm as there were 4 empty tables that seated four and manager would not allow us to move -- what a joke. When I walked in his attitude was crappy from my hello .. Sorta felt like I was interrupting his day. SumOver priced food and liquor , crappy selection of wines and no copper mugs for a mule . Don't waste your time or money here.
author: DR W.

description: Wow. Wow. Wow. Best clam chowder I've tasted in my 33 yrs of life.  So many flavors exploding in my mouth. Will come back here again and again
author: Jonathan L.

description: Wonderful food,  decor and service. Very yummy Crab Louis salad. My favorite was the California Clam Chowder (got the trio Sampler with crab/corn and sausage clam). Elote was not a good choice for me.
author: Wai Y.

description: Looking for something besides that typical San Fran Clam Chowder? This is the place! A nice location just off of Fishermans Wharf with a small patio away from the touristy high traffic areas. The crab and corn chowder here was excellent (the only thing I had)!! I also really enjoyed their non-alcoholic mixed drinks. The service was prompt and courteous.
author: Andrew D.

description: I came because I wanted to have some dinner here, I haven't tried this place. But to begin with the waiter was rude, I went to the bathroom and I over hears him talking about about my husband and I. I felt very uncomfortable here, I'm not coming back here no more!!
author: Jane B.

description: We're just here for a couple of drinks but, my goodness, I've never seen a less interested wait staff.  Plenty of employees, not too crowded, no one moving...haven't had a waiter say hello during the two drinks I ordered from the bartender on the phone.
author: Todd W.

description: For the last two years a big group of us has been coming here after a road race that we run in San Francisco.  When I say "big group"  I'm talking about 15 people with kids ranging in age from 1 year to 12 and all of their adults.  The Blue Mermaid has been nothing more than accommodating to our large group each year.  The manager has bent over backwards to make sure that we are getting full service.  They keep the food and drinks coming and do it all with a smile.   Seriously, this is a great spot and we will continue to come here in years to come   :-)
author: Julie Z.

description: I went to Blue Mermaid for the first time and I'd say it's a fancy place. There are beautiful candles on the tables, a clean bar, seatings are nice, etc. I love that I could come here without feeling overdressed when I want to dress nicely. The chowder was the bomb but it filled me up so quickly. I think the menus should be updated; they should add non-alcoholic drinks so customers don't think alcohol is the only thing they serve.
author: Sandy D.

description:
Their selection of chowders was worth the trip
to touristy Fisherman's Wharf.

Mind you,
I did have to brave a bevy of people
who, for whatever reason, do not know
or are unaware of what the purpose
of a crosswalk is.

Then,
there was the parking.

Well, I actually lucked on parking
so no complaints there.

In fact, no more complaints.

Blue Mermaid is a warm and cozy 
spot in the Argonaut hotel
(by the way, I heart Kimpton hotels)
and the food they serves
is super fitting of their location near the Wharf.

Their seafood is fine,
but again, their chowdah is the real treat.

They have a variety
I have never heard of before,
and they also offer
a chowdah sampler.

It was
good.


Oh, their blondie for dessert
comes a close second.

So be sure it's someone's
birthday *wink, wink* to get this amazing
complimentary dessert
and make sure to tip
a little extra for them being so nice!
author: Dan B.

description: We had a wonderful experience! Our service was awesome, food was delicious, and the weather was warm enough to sit outside! I would definitely recommend the crab/corn chowder in the bread bowl and the Brussel sprouts! Can't wait to go back
author: Chrissy P.

description: Ok, super touristy- if your staying at the argonaut hotel it's a perfect place for a snack and a drink before exploring fisherman's wharf.
author: Kevin J.

description: Stayed at the hotel attached to this restaurant and had breakfast here. The food was ok. My husband had the eggs Benedict that he enjoyed I had the steel cut oats and a side of bacon. Bacon was pretty undercooked. I ordered a Bloody Mary (that is listed on the menu) and our server told m my hey didn't have the stuff to make it. As the meal went on we realized he didn't really feel like working that day. When we asked for ketchup he nearly slammed on the table as he walked by. This is really a take it or leave it place. With all the other great places within walking distance I will be leaving it from now on.
author: Lori M.

description: A VERY WELL DESERVED 5 star for this place!! First off, the customer service is absolutely awesome. We have stayed at the Hotel ( Argonaut Hotel SF) many many times since 2007 due to being pet friendly, but the Blue Mermaid wasn't, thusly we never spent any time here. Now they accept pets on the patio, very gracious in that respect. The patio has awesome fire pits and warmers for those chilly evenings, with awesome commercial deep house groovy music to chill to. The staff is some of the best I have encountered, had a blast just talking and relaxing with them, Brian our waiter was on top of it! And had a great sense of humor. The bartender Makenzie was awesome as well, remembered our drinks from a few nights ago, and very friendly. Food is great and the price is very reasonable, my NY Steak was amazing and coked perfectly, and the fish tacos were delicious according to my wife. Could give this place six stars very easily.
author: Stevie W.

description: Great meal last night.  New Englanders who said it's some of the best chowder outside if the N.E.
author: Josie C.

description: Great location. The clam chowder and cran and corn chowder were the best we have ever had. The popcorn shrimp was great,  cooked perfectly,  and a pretty large basket. The price was just right for what you receive. The service was good, not great.
author: Gina L.

description: Good chowder, apparently award winning chowder and lovely salad was had at this location in the afternoon outside.  Inside dining in the evening.
author: cm g.

description: Disappointed. I've been planning to eat here for two weeks because of reviews. We had the crab cakes which were delicious, lovely arugula salad next to it was a great palate cleanser. Also ordered the New England Clam Chowder and it was just 'ok'. Maybe I should have tried the Corn & Crab. Not bad but not great. Most disappointing thing - my husband ordered the Fish N Chips and the Fish batter literally had NO seasoning. No salt, no spice, nothing. That is such a basic mistake - can't forgive it. For the money you pay there, EVERYTHING should be top notch. Might give it a second chance, but probably not.
author: Leslie C.

description: Incredibly delicious, creamy New England Clam Chowder. Awesome crab cakes. Attentive and friendly server. Wonderful place to sit outside and enjoy eating at Fisherman's Wharf!
author: Laura B.

description: Had drinks and chowder at bar in early afternoon.  Prompt, friendly service with good strong drinks and tasty chowder.
author: Ca A.

description: The hostess suggested the 5 year award winning crab and corn chowder. It was amazing!! So glad I decided to try it. I was worried it was going to be sweet because of the corn but I was thankful it wasn't.
author: Anita K.

description: We had a great lunch here. The steamed clams were wonderful and the garlic bread that came with it was great. The soups were good but not great. Wine was good. Staff was very nice. The patio setting was nice.
author: G M.

description:
This place was delicious with yummy chowder and drinks. I would give it 5 stars if it wasn't so pricey.. But I guess that's expected in the area it's located 

Food- trio of chowder is so good!! My fave was crab and corn, the calamari is good and so is the fish and chips ( fish tastes really fresh )

Drinks - amazing!!! Our waitress was amazing at recommending drinks according to what we not all like. 

Def go here if u r willing to dish out a little
More because of its location,. The food and drinks r def worth it
author: Rachana P.

description: We came for breakfast and were quite disappointed.  Service was spotty at best; when my eggs arrived sunny side up and not scrambled (per my order), the busboy had to take it back for me because our waiter was no where to be found.  He never apologized for the mix up.  The corned beef hash was not really corned beef but instead cubes of ham, and fatty ham at that.  I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Shawn T.

description: Great food, awesome location, excellent service! Cozy soft for a family meal or a date night. The patio is surprisingly warm and cozy with all the fire pits. We were in a bit of a rush and Brian was very attentive.
author: Nikki D.

description: What can I say about the Blue Mermaid. The location is amazing. The hostess was extremely kind and became instant friends with my wife because of there shared red hair. The waiter was persistent but not overly persistent. The atmosphere was amazing with the outside seating and small fires warming everyone all over the patio. The food: I ate the fish and chips and it was perfect, so was the cup of clam chowder I started with. My wife had cod and polenta for a starter. The polenta was so good she couldn't finish her cod, though she said the cod was as good as the polenta. I highly recommend the blue mermaid. For a causal dinner or romantic night out.
author: Matt S.

description: Great bloody Mary's and local craft selection. Awesome place to start the day before sight seeing!
author: Keri T.

description: Well in the past it has been excellent but today was horrible. The bloody Mary was weak and had no substance.. looked like Tomato juice with a dash of alcohol. The waiter  was horrible and messed up orders in our party and then proceeded to argue about it. The food tasted ok but very over priced. Won't be back.
author: Vaughn T.

description: The Argonaut Hotel is amazing and the on-premise restaurant is no different. Terrific cocktails and crab cakes!
author: John G.

description: The highlight is the decor and atmosphere. They make a decent drink, but the food is nothing to write home about. We've eaten there twice. First night we had the crab cakes and the fish and chips. All the potential for a great meal, but No flavor. Second night we had to order there out of convenience because we were staying at the argonaut Hotel and needed some quick food asap. I had a chicken Caesar salad and fish and chips for my fiancé-the fries are actually decent. Garlic Parmesan. The chicken on my salad was actually not bad, fresh and grilled but the "salad" was one of the worst. It was like they ran out of lettuce so they pulled all of the romaine heads from the day out of the garbage and chopped up the bits that nobody wanted and threw it in a box with some dressing for me. Not a single green in sight. Bummer
author: Jen C.

description:
I thought the food was alright being a little pricey and all. Service was fast. Customer service was cool.

I had the chicken rosemary kind of dry. I knew I should have gone with the salmon. It is a seafood blue mermaid kind of place. Lol. 

We also had the crab dip. THAT was good. The best thing was probably the dessert upside down apple turnover with ice cream. Free when you check in!
author: Noe D.

description: Okay! I walked in with a sampler of the finest chocolates available in San Fran. Gave them out to the bartender and patrons. Expecting nothing , just a good will he's tire. I check in with yelp because as 50+ person I have no social media skills at all. And BAM, free wine!?!?! What?!
author: Pat C.

description:
Seems weird to some that I prefer corn chowder over clam chowder, but I just do.

It wouldn't be the first time that I went against popular foods here in SF.

Came in with my buddy who just got married to try their chowder and some shrimp cocktail and some crab salad.

All were good. 

I really thought the corn chowder here was a standout, hence the 4 stars.

Enough spice, not too watery, not too creamy, enough corn and smokey bacon. 

Great!
author: Jack R.

description:
Well don't come at 11 because they'll tell you they've stopped serving breakfast but you can't order lunch yet; the kitchen is switching over. 
So you literally sit and wait. This is absurd.
author: Kat C.

description:
Love this place. The decor is lovely and servers really nice. 
Food is probably a little overpriced probably because of location - rig on the wharf so tourist central (which I am a tourist) - we had great sandwiches here and regularly went in for coffee or beer or wine. 
Sat outside and in - both equally good. Outside is a good people watching spot. 
The restaurant is attached the swanky argonaut hotel so you have to use the restrooms here - very swish.
author: Madison S.

description:
Great tourist spot.  I knew this place, given its location, was going to be a tourist spot. But I wanted to see the Wharf, and wanted food.  We picked this place out of a hat, but it didn't disappoint.  I paid more than I would've liked but I figured that'd happen. It's the Wharf. 
The bartender was very cool, even helped me track down some Pliny the Elder. The fish and chips were good, but nothing overly special. The chowder was very good.  They're famous for their corn chowder, and it was good, but the shrimp and red pepper one was delicious!  Good beer selection, with local options highlighted.  The oyster Rockefeller was also very good. Huge oysters, lots of butter and parm. We were stuffed, and happy.  Try the chowder, and beer, maybe an app, but you can get a better overall meal somewhere else.
author: John F.

description: Service is fine. The food, however, was not. They also ran out of crab. Ran out of corn. The linguine with Manila clams was too salty. The chowder was basic. It's rare I will rate a restaurant this low, but here I am. Everything else we ordered was not good
author: Mary S.

description:
Anywhere but in a Kimpton Hotel you'd probably give a 2 or 3-star rating to the hotel's restaurant.

At this Kimpton property, they've certainly upped the ante, well before the World's Cup splashes across the Bay and Golden Gate summer 2013.

The Dungeness crab omelette, the crab sandwich, the tantalizing bacon and spinach quiche and perfectly delicious coffee, I've had both breakfast and lunch at this Kimpton restaurant.

Service, food - they know what they're doing.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
Get the corn and crab chowder- delicious. 

The fish and chips-fries had parmesan cheese, fish had a great batter, very fresh fish!! 

Must have- upside down Apple pie!! Freaking awesome! Nothing but deliciousness. Crust is different but in an amazing way!!
author: Hollian C.

description: Decided to try out this restaurant for dinner. All the food we had was definitely yummy! We had oysters rockafeller, clam chowder and calamari. Everything tasted very fresh. The 4 stars is for the service. Our server was friendly, however the wait was quite long and the place wasn't busy.
author: Mayra C.

description: Love their mussels and clam chowder. The outdoor seating is great on a summer evening. I appreciate it is away from tourist crowds.
author: Kayla B.

description:
