We went in Friday night 4/29/16. Great atmosphere! Our server BRIAN was attentive, funny and had some awesome recommendations. I tried the crab and corn Chowder which was their award winning chowder. Award winner can't even come close to describing this dish. It was sooo yummy! The flavors were crazy good! All the food we ate was perfection. And the Bloody Mary ? Yep it was  fantastic as well. We almost needed a wheelbarrow to get us out to our car! This restaurant was a recommendation from a new friend who had been there "years" ago and I'm glad they are still there and doing a great business.  The atmosphere like I said was great. They played some great radio music and it wasn't too loud and we could still carry on a conversation. We were asked if we wanted dessert - but goodness not sure where we would have put it as we were so full!

Can't wait to visit San Fran again to have a return trip to this jewel of a restaurant!!!!
author: Terry-Jo L.

description: This place was convenient as we stayed at the Argonaut Hotel, which by the way was an awesome hotel! We went to the restaurant because we were given free drink cards from the hotel so we decided to try it. The bartender there was awesome she was super friendly. However, after we got transferred to a table the server we had was slow and didn't really check on us. We actually decided to give it another chance and eat breakfast there. The food was good, but again the server we had was slow, she didn't offer and refills, and took forever to give us the check and give us our card back. Overall food was ok, but service was not up to par.
author: Mia N.

description:
I have no idea if the food is good or bad here, but we sure had a fun time drinking one morning.  (and yes, I did say morning).  Off a cruise ship and needing to kill time before a tour we landed here since not much else was open yet. We sat at the bar and were glad that they didn't have any silly rules or anything about alcohol being served at 10am, so we enjoyed a couple.

   Great drinks and great service!
author: Lori R.

description: We came across this place by coincidence for lunch. Just looked over the menu outside and decided to try it. The atmosphere is nautical. The service is great and waiters and the bar tender are really friendly. Super clean and perfect for lunch. We liked it so much that we came back the next day for brunch. Try the linguini with clams and the ahi tuna sandwich both are great and super tasty.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Why does this place only have 3.5 stars?
Because people come to a chowder house and order Rosemary Chicken, that's why :p

This place is good! 
And when they say "award winning lobster corn chowder", they mean business!
Not to mention the fish and chips my boyfriend ordered were near perfection.

Friendly service, and a nice getaway from the thousands of people at the pier.
author: Justine B.

description: Great ambience with a maritime theme, superb service and and delicious food.  Good selection of beers and wines.  The corned beef hash was absolutely wonderful, specially when paired with a Speakeasy Big Daddy IPA.  Highly recommended, co-located with the Argonaut Hotel.
author: Wild J.

description: Great restaurant. You can never be sure in a tourist area and attached to a hotel, but this place was tops! Great service from the start. Very busy but very attentive and efficient! We actually ate here twice during our stay. Our waitress Abby was wonderful. Great recommendations from drinks(best Bloody Mary ever), chowders, and Cioppino. She even gave us some fun, history facts! Will definitely eat here again when in the area!
author: Pamela D.

description: As soon as we sat down we ordered popcorn shrimp bread and a drink. I think that's the only reason we received our food at all. It was completely empty when we first arrived and gradually filled to 3/4. Our waiter was very polite and nice, but goodness gracious he was horrible at providing service. I asked for a straw and waited so long I got up and found someone with one. Ok fine no ones perfect. He didn't refill our drinks at all! My husband got up and found someone to give us water. When he finally came back I asked for a dessert menu that never came. I just got up for the third time to find someone to give us the check. The shrimp was really good but we definitely won't be coming back.
author: B Z.

description: This restaurant is located next door to the Argonaut Hotel and hotel has access from the lobby to dine here.  Since we were staying at Argonaut Hotel it was pretty convenient to come here and try their food .  Great ambiance, love the decor, restaurant was kept clean, noise level was a little on the loud side, staff were friendly and efficient.  Our kids ordered food off of their kids menu which was pretty standard like what most restaurants offer... I did try their Crab & Corn Chowder which was delish!  Ordered it on a bread bowl of course!  We also ordered their Fish & Chips, Calamari and Linguini.  All tasted good and we enjoyed our meal.  Pretty good deal for a good tasting meal right by our hotel.
author: Maria M.

description: We went here for a snack and their cream of corn is amazing!!!! :)  Number 1. :P
author: Miss L.

description:
Normally, I don't care for the really touristy restaurants in SF because I'm not a tourist. But my friends and I just happened to be around the wharf area, so we decided to check it out.

They had an outdoor patio with heat lamps, but unfortunately it was not in use. The inside was really nice with nautically themed decor: rope, worn wood, deck chairs, sails, etc. (You should check out their restrooms; gorgeous.)

My friends and I were hungry, but not hungry enough for a full meal, so we got 2 sets of the Trio Sampler that included all 6 of their chowders (Dungeness Crab and Corn, New England Cam, Manhattan Clam, California Clam, Mussel and Sausage, Shrimp and Red Pepper) and Mediterranean Mussels. It was fun to try all the different chowders, but I think my favorite was the Shrimp & Red Pepper and the Crab & Corn chowders. The mussels were top notch and the sauce (white wine, garlic, tomatoes, basil) that went with it was so good that we dumped our oyster crackers in it instead of the chowders. 

The only real complaint I have is that the chowder sampler portions could've been bigger for $12. Other than that, I think it's a good place to try out for tourists and locals alike.
author: Alex Y.

description:
Really liked this place! The bartender was really nice and we actually made it for happy hour, which I would come back for if I'm ever in the area.

I did the sampler (12$) with New England chowder (wanted to play it safe with at least one), mussel and sausage (a little too tomatoe-y for me), and the shrimp and red pepper (really liked it!! The red pepper is just bell pepper, so it wasn't spicy, which was a relief for me. Lol).

I also tried the splash bros (came in a martini glass, PRETTY strong, but still had a nice taste to it. Definitely did it's job. Lol) & the primms cup (came in a mason jar with a handle, super cute! It was really good, maybe because I was already kind of tipsy from the first one. But if you want your money's worth, both were happy hour & were 6$, ask for light ice). Oh, btw, you have to sit at the bar in order to get happy hour (we went on Monday where it's 3 to close).

Nice inside & it wasn't too crowded or loud, which I liked, but maybe that's because it was a Monday.
author: Denise N.

description:
Lovely patio! Enjoyed the garlic crab and highly recommend the Brussel sprouts as a side.  The clam chowder was very good!

They easily sat our group of 5. Service was good!
author: Jessica T.

description: A handy place for breakfast with nice staff. Smokes salmon omelette appeared promptly and tasted good. Server kindly sought out a newspaper for me and was attentive without being annoying!An attractive space and nicely set out with plenty of interest. I shall come here again.
author: Candance N.

description:
Resturant was not closed as of Jume 13th, 2015.  

The Corn and crab chowder was amazing, and the food overall is good.   However, nothing was local in spite of being 50 feet from the water.  Service was decent.

Of note, the clam chowder had little to no clam in either of the two clam chowders we tried.
author: David M.

description: Service very good, corned beef hash yummy, benedict over priced egg mcmuffin with sauce, speaking of Mcdonalds, they must have run out of real potatoes and ran down to McDonald's to get their hash browns to serve.
author: Jim C.

description:
I was up in SF this past weekend and couldn't resist getting in here for their award winning chowder. I personally found it so so delicious! The best I've had. I also had fish and chips and they were good too though I had to add some salt to the fish as it was a little blunt for me. Still the food was delicious and super fresh. Service is really friendly and I will definitely go back next time I'm in town. 

If you purchase a bottle of wine in the winery next door they'll give u a coupon for a free cup of chowder with the purchase of an entree. I used that and got a free glass of wine for checking in with yelp. I was happy, as you can imagine
author: Marcela S.

description:
I very rarely give five star reviews. 

The food here is exactly what you hope for when your parents fly into town. The food is awesome and consistent. The service is fantastic, the waiters and waitresses come exactly the right amount of times. Its also not noisy, which is amazing because it's right on the main drag in fisherman's wharf. 

I got a caesar salad, calamari, the corn and crab soup, and clams. They were all awesome. The soup says award winning and they aren't kidding.
author: Robert B.

description:
I wish my review was based on this places food, but it's on their horrible service.  

My fiancé and I wanted to try out a new place on fisherman's warf Sunday at 1035am, and we're greeted with horrible service.  Upon entering no employee to make us feel welcomed, and upon being seated by the hostess we waited 25 min. For no one to acknowledge us.  We had left to a different resturant after this 70% empty restaurant had disrespected us.
author: Javier V.

description:
We are just leaving and still don't know the server's name. Not sure if serving was an after thought or what.
We enjoyed the food...oysters,  chowder (shrimp was my fave) and the crab cakes...not salty at all.
Cool building and good...appropriate volume music...but service was odd at best.
author: Jill T.

description:
We arrived late at night and were hungry, and thought we should just go for the hotel restaurant. We were recommended the crab and corn chowder and it was delicious. Big portions, and huge glasses of local wine, made me think of old swedish commercials ("everything is big in the US")
Nice place!
author: Lina B.

description: I consider myself quite a connoisseur of chowder and by far the Blue Mermaid's crab chowder is the best I have ever tasted!
author: Rich B.

description: We visited San Francisco this weekend for my birthday. Now that I have two small children (5 and 2) eating out is a bit of a struggle especially in a big city. We ended up at Blue Mermaid because of its location and size. The outside patio was perfect for us and our stroller. The hostess brought crayons and many coloring sheets for my girls and the food and drinks we great. We were very satisfied with our experience and highly recommend this restaurant to familes!
author: Paloma B.

description: Probably not my favorite chowder house... at all. Although service was good, the food was anything but good especially for the price. They were out of crab which we weren't told until we sat down and ordered an app, so we ordered the linguine and clams. Super super salty. Chowder was so so. I defiantly won't be returning.
author: Danielle S.

description: Cioppino, the corn side dish - both great.  Layout is a little weird. Have to walk to the back to be seated. But they seem to work with what they have, outside seating , a bar, connects to the hotel next door.
author: Morgan H.

description: My opinion after a weekend of trying clam chowder and corn chowders I finally found the best place!! The service was so nice and even had me sample the soup before I placed the order! I was not disappointed at all , super glad I heard of the place !!
author: Patricia F.

description:
Wow I spent a week in SF and this is the only place I would die to go back to. The food was amazing! I do not care for seafood but I could eat their California clam chowder and their Crab and Corn chowder all day. There is a reason this place is award winning!

The service was adequate I have had better and worse.
author: Catori D.

description: Would leave zero stars if possible. Actually can't comment on the food or drink as we could not get served. Walked in a about noon on Saturday the 17th and sat at the bar with a friend. A woman walked behind the bar, would not make eye contact and made herself tea as she chatted with what appeared to be a bus boy at the end of the bar. She walked past us at least three times. Another gentlemen came up, walked behind the bar, grabbed something and left. After 15 minutes of no eye contact, no words, no acknowledgement we left. Very disappointed!!!!
author: Alice F.

description: It was Mother's Day and I'd wanted to try their chowder for a while-so we decided why not today?  We saw the outdoor seating and the door in the same area to what we thought was the restaurant-as we approached the door, a waiter yelled: "You can't go in there!" Ok..... so instead of saying "I'm sorry, that entrance is not available right now", "I'm sorry, we're re-modeling right now, but I can offer you a seat out here, or if you'd prefer dining inside, you can go in through the hotel to the temporary pop up restaurant which is around the corner".  We are STANDING THERE for a good 10 seconds, until I finally had to ask-SO is the DOOR TO THE RESTAURANT AROUND THE CORNER?! To which we were THEN told, that the restaurant is being remodeled and that if we wanted to go to the pop up restaurant, it's around the corner.  Geez-we're just STANDING THERE while everyone is looking at us after we've been dressed down for trying to use a door that was NOT blocked off, nor did it have any signs on it--leading you to think that it was a perfectly serviceable door into the restaurant.  Food was just meh-chowder was just ok, not a lot of crab for a crab/corn chowder. I've had better at freaking Disneyland!
author: JP P.

description: The clam chowder was delicious, the Blue Mermaid burger was too, and the beer was cold. We liked the patio seating.
author: Lee H.

description:
Incredible location and the most amazing Crab Chowder ever!

Service was impeccable and the portions were quite generous. Rainbow trout and the Half Chicken were excellent.
author: Leonardo V.

description: Came to SF for the first time and found this spot. Great ambiance, great food and great service. A Lil pricey but  it's expected. Chowder bowl was great, fish and ships was nice and fresh.
author: Andrew C.

description: This place was cool!  Great atmosphere.  Had the corn crab chowder which was sooooo good!  Must get this soup if you come here.  Also had fish and garlic Parmesan fries.  Fish was not greasy and the fries rocked!  Drinks very reasonably priced, with some great choices.  Service was superb.  Would hit this place up again. For sure!!!
author: Debbie M.

description: We stayed at the beautiful Argonaut Hotel for my wife's birthday. We decided to try out the Blue Mermaid for her birthday dinner. The hostess greeted us with a happy birthday but our waiter could not have made our night LESS SPECIAL. No bread when everyone else got some. No refills on water. Not even a simple scoop of ice cream with a candle on it. He didn't even say Happy Birthday to my wife through the entire meal. Only after we left and were on the street did he come running out to say "Happy Birthday by the Way!" As for food, the garlic roasted crab was very good though a bit pricey (55.00). The pan seared salmon was gelatinous and undercooked. What was suppose to be crispy skin, was a soggy mess. If you're staying at the Argonaut, don't bother with this place.
author: Eddie F.

description: We were doing the tourist thing at the Wharf and the day was typical SF weather-cold, misty and grey. The smell of baking sourdough bread was more than whetting our appetites and we stopped at a visitor's center to ask about a good place for lunch. All of the usuals were recited and we decided to keep looking. The Blue Mermaid advertises "the best chowder" and we were definitely in the mood for good chowder. It was delicious!! Lots of corn and crab and some of that fabulous bread that we had been smelling! I rounded off the meal with a roasted beet salad which was perfect! It was an ideal SF lunch.
author: Colleen P.

description: Food was great! Tasty corn/crab chowder, calamari was on point.  Bartender was amazing, even came over and bussed our table of appetizers after we left the bar (this should give you an idea of what's coming....).  Wait staff needed work. A lot of work.  Didn't bus our finished appetizers, didn't offer waters, forgot a request for more dipping sauce.  Main dishes: didn't know which dish they had just delivered. Odd for an otherwise seemingly well established place. Would order out again... Would not eat in the restaurant again
author: Jared S.

description:
My partner and I came here for dinner after finding gluten free options on the menu, which seemed reasonably priced for the area. Unfortunately after eating we both left underwhelmed and a little queasy from our meals. 
My partner had the crab and corn chowder,  which was lovely.  I had the gf option of mussel and sausage which still came out with a side of croutons despite requesting gf. This was nice until I ate the mussel which i can only assume was turning, it was revolting and ruined the dish. 

For mains we had the steak and salmon.  The steak came out well,  however the salmon was overcooked and dry.  

Service was friendly but quite slow.

With so many other great seafood options available nearby I would suggest trying somewhere else.
author: Lauren C.

description: This place pissed me off.  Only because some bartender said it was the best clam chowder in San Francisco. Ahhhh, you were off, way off bro.  So bland. So annoyed I fell for this bait and switch.
author: Joey D.

description: The corn chowder!!!! Loud, busy atmosphere, really fun place to go!!!
author: Colette B.

description: Delicious chowder, fresh seafood, efficient and friendly staff all in a convivial atmosphere with great decor. Pretty great overall just a bit pricey but not unexpected given the location. Less touristy than most of the places and the chowder was outstanding. Good beer selection and the music playing on the sound system was great as well.
author: Larry K.

description:
Stopped here for breakfast. It was fine, pretty standard for a breakfast place really.

Had eggs with bacon. The bacon is good. 

This is a short review because there's not much to say. Pretty average but so many places at Fisherman's Wharf aren't open for breakfast so if you're in a pinch or biking across the Golden Gate Bridge early in the morning, this is a good stop on the way.

You can rent bikes next door and/or park your bike outside.

I really loved their bathroom though. Had this amazing blue mermaid wallpaper. Totes worth the look, it is in the hotel however.
author: Li Z.

description: This was a pretty below average restaurant. after walking down the pier, my family was desperate to find a good restaurant. When we walked in, it was very warm and busy because it was Christmas. We waited for at least 10 minutes to even get seated. many waiters passed by but no luck in meeting the host. We finally sat down in the corner right by the bar. We ordered the fish and chips, clam linguine, fish tacos, and the chowder and salad option. The food came out in a pretty timely manner especially because it was so busy. maybe understaffed because of the holiday? When our food came, we were pleased compared to the customer service. Personally, I had the clam linguine and it had a lot of clams. The ratio of clams to pasta was a little off, and my whole family finished all their food. I was surprised because it was not that filling for me, and our family usually has a lot of leftovers at other restaurants. Overall, the food was amazing but did not satisfy our hunger. Our waiter was nice and open to questions but did not check up on us that often. Food is worth it, but definitely come when it is less busy!
author: Chloe F.

description:
A friend took me here while we walked around Fisherman's Wharf, but it was not as great as I expected. The bartender & service staff were friendly and attentive, probably because there was almost no one in the restaurant. They were good but not memorable. 

As for the food, I've had much better New England clam chowder. The portion size was decent, but it wasn't very hot and there was not much else other than soup in the chowder. Where was my seafood? Sad. Basically, it didn't seem like the chowder or the bread (on the side) was very fresh.

The only great part was the beer, but how can you go wrong with that? For a beautiful area such as Fisherman's Wharf, there are far better places to try if you want to eat clam chowder.
author: Stefanie C.

description:
This is the spot, that hits the spot.
From the service to the food you really cant go wrong. 
The Crab Cakes are beyond what words can describe, I have been coming here for a while and it seems to get better every time. I was overly impressed with the attention to detail and over-all care I received from my server, i cant wait to return and try more menu items.
author: Jay K.

description:
I typically don't encourage going to the Wharf for food, mostly because it's a steel trap for money and time.  That being said, for a Wharf establishment, the Blue Mermaid should really get 3.5 stars, not 3.  In terms of the food, I can't say that it was out of this world.  In terms of service, it gets 4+ stars.  We were seated right away, was served with the right amount of time in between, and they honored the Yelp check-in coupon for a free dessert!  I had made reservations here, but they weren't needed.  That being said, I received a courtesy call from the restaurant asking if we were still going to make our reservations.

Onto the food!  My mom and sister (who were visiting from LA) chose to get the Whole Dungeness Crab and the linguini and clams.  I had the scampi over linguini.  My dish was OK, nothing to write home about, and if I wanted to be really particular, I only got 5 shrimp in my entire dish.  My mom and sister loved their dishes, and together split the two dishes and cleaned it dry.  We had their Sundae for dessert and ate all of it.  Overall, this was definitely one of those situations where I thought the service outweighed the food, and I was pleasantly surprised.  If I'm going to recommend a touristy place for lunch in the Wharf, I'll recommend Blue Mermaid.
author: Lisa I.

description:
A real disappointment when we visited last summer.

My wife and I were expecting a great meal at fisherman's wharf, and found absolutely nothing to rave about here. I am surprised that the yelp reviews were as favorable as they were.

The shellfish appetizer flatly did not taste quite right, the bread was average, the crab meat entrée was dry and tasteless. I know there was much more I did not like about this place, but it's just been too long, and some of it has slipped my mind. Regardless, I won't be returning to this restaurant should I again return to San Francisco.
author: Jeffrey B.

description: The clam chowder and corn and crab chowder were too salty. Also, my clam chowder didn't have any clams.  If it did, they were microscopic.  The manager (I assume) comp'd the clam chowder, which I appreciated very much.  However, I still have to give 1 star because it's just egregious to serve clam chowder w/o clams.
author: Negar A.

description:
The Blue Mermaid Chowder House really put a damper on our staycation. $90 for a Denny's-caliber meal for two without alcohol. We had salmon Cesar salad, crab Louis, Brussels sprouts, and both the Manhattan and crab & corn chowders. I'm sure the bread and croutons came out of a Safeway package, and the salmon was tasteless colorless farm-raised. The so-called award-winning crab & corn chowder was nothing special. The Brussel sprouts were so hard and bitter, they were almost inedible, although my buddy persevered. The deconstructed crab Louis was unorthodox and came with pesto sauce. Ugh. 

An expensive but below average quality meal just leaves a bad taste in one's mouth and can almost spoil a getaway. 

Service was slow but very friendly even tho we were the last to leave on a Sunday night.
author: MJ L.

description:
The corn crab chowder is the bomb, the chicken is super good, the linguine and clams is very tasty!  Hamburger and fries is standard yummy. 
DO NOT GET THE CRAB DIP THOUGH, ITS TUNA!
author: Meagan L.

description:
Pros - lots of gluten free choices.   

Cons - none of the food was very good.  It was all bland and meh.   And the server left out dirty plates in the table in front of us after the meal.   

Won't be coming back.
author: David N.

description: The service is excruciatingly slow, constantly empty waters, under seasoned cioppino and very expensive at that. Wanted this place to great :/
author: Tiffany M.

description: Really delicious crab dip and corn and crab chowder. The sourdough was excellent. A lovely lunch sitting on the patio with my dog.
author: Tracy S.

description: This is a review strictly on the bar experience. We were staying at the Argonaut Hotel which is connected to the restaurant and we decided to have a drink at the Blue Mermaid before we headed out for the night. The cocktail specials were amazing. I usually am not too delighted about girly cocktails but this place had some unique cocktails that is suitable for everyone. I was stuck on 3 different cocktails and I wanted to try them all. The bartender was a really cool chick! She was friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back to the hotel and the restaurant and next time we're trying the food also!
author: Christina K.

description: Can't complain. California Clam Chowder was dope. Rainbow Trout was not so dope but presentation was great. Server was great but forgot the bread. Location is great. Use the check-in for a free desert. Will be back again.
author: Zach B.

description:
I probably should've known better than to come here and expect something that wasn't touristy and bland. I'm a local and this isn't a real seafood restaurant.

The interior should've tipped me off---the decor reminded me of a chain restaurant and the waiters all wore striped nautical shirts (that were a mere $85 if you wanted to take one home). It is attached to the Argonaut hotel, which has a seaside theme. 

The food was just ok. I had the seafood trio (salmon, crab cake and a shrimp skewer). The shrimp was tasty, but the salmon had an odd flavor to it which might have just been the cut of fish, but the crab cake was downright soggy and I couldn't eat more than a few bites. It comes over a bed of spinach and mashed potatoes which were both good, but there was a butter sauce over the entire entree which I could've done without.  I had a wedge side salad that was boring and bland which I didn't finish.  The other people in my party weren't thrilled with their items, either (fish and chips and a crab salad). 

The portions are fair and the price is about average for the area. 

Our server Brian was on top of his game and was really friendly. However, the food runner was rude and seemed miffed that I would need something as simple as a spoon or GASP lemon for my seafood. The others at my table noticed it and made a comment to me. 

We came in for a child's birthday and they gave us a comped dessert (chocolate pot de creme) but they didn't have anymore birthday candles and they didn't sing to our birthday girl. 

All in all, this is a typical slightly overpriced touristy hotel restaurant. I probably wouldn't come back, but the hotel itself looks nice.
author: Bianca U.

description: Use to always come here for special occasions during high school. Very pricey place though. Fortunately, I never had to pay . Love their calamari!
author: Johnny N.

description: Had breakfast here, food was okay could have been warmer. Service was horrible,  no greeting, food was delivered but we were never checked back on to see how we were doing. Ended up asking a different server to refill our coffee.  Server showed up with our check we were still eating.
author: Azalia S.

description: My first time in Frisco and after a long windy walk I had to pee and I wanted Chowder and Blue Mermaid was right there! Not disappointed! Good fish n' chips! Chowder (New England) was aight'!! My only complaint is the bathroom is not closer! Staff is very attentive yet discreet!
author: Beckie C.

description: So good! Had the cioppino and crab corn chowder. There are so many restaurants in that area. This one is defiantly worth a go. Good food and service in a nice location.
author: Guy W.

description: Stopped in for lunch after reading that the crab and corn chowder was delicious....and it sure was. Probably the best lunch I have had in a long time- I also enjoyed the oysters and a cold brew. I sat on the patio on a beautiful California September day and thoroughly enjoyed my experience.
author: Amy F.

description: In the mood for clam chowder and was very happy with the California clam chowder. The atmosphere was quite pleasant with the rustic brick building and lots of birds chirping, but no birds on the patio.
author: Kevin K.

description: The clam chowder was so good and the ahi tuna tatami was so yummy. The cocktail shrimp had some of the shell still on it, and I had to get it out after it was already in my mouth.
author: Denice Arielle M.

description: Went to the bar for a few cocktails, Jason was a great bartender and very knowledgeable. I would reccomend this place to anyone in the area who wants a great environment and great drinks.
author: Tay T.

description: Very nice atmosphere on the patio. We stopped here for brunch and enjoyed both the ruben and their American breakfast. Wait staff were friendly and helpful.
author: Leah L.

description: Most amazingly scrumptious crab cakes ever...enjoyed a bowl of New England clam chowder, paired with a cabernet.  Average service, but beautifully situated in the Old Del monte cannery building.
author: Joan B.

description:
Food was great! We got two sampler trio's and tried every clam chowder (Which now I wish we didn't order the tomato broth ones and just doubled up on new england and the crab and corn chowders). We also got the fish and chips because we were craving it and they were perfect. I don't like heavy batter, and this was the best balance of crunchy, friend, and tender. Plus the tarder sauce was AMAZING!

Why did this place get 3-stars? Our server. He was all over the place. And didn't really talk to us, and seemed like he couldn't handle more than one table at a time. And by the end of our meal, he threw the dessert menu on our table and walked away, instead of asking if we wanted dessert (One of my biggest pet peeves when eating at a restaurant). And since we were really full, we didn't want dessert. But he didn't come back. My boyfriend and I waited for 10 minutes before I finally got up and asked the host for our check. And when I sat down, he came over and asked  if they (Assuming the hostest/host) were taking care of us. Seriously?! It seemed more like I was taking care of us.

So, I would recommend this place, but only if you get it to go.
author: Bre S.

description: Crab & corn chowder 10+ and waiter Stahl was extremely nice!
author: Kaitlyn H.

description: Great atmosphere with outside patio. Stopped for drinks and our waitress, Suzanna, sat and talked with us about Boston. Great time!
author: Andrea B.

description: They have several choices for chowder. Other than clam chowder, you need to try their California chowder and mussel/sausage chowder. Great flavor! Nice service! Also like the unique decor of the restaurant. Place worth to try.
author: Fang L.

description:
Nice lunch...

On a 10 scale:

Drink special "Peaches Christ" (9)
Bloody Mary (9)
Fish and Chips (8)
Crab Corn Chowder in a bread bowl (10 !!)
Dungeness Crab Cakes $29!!! (5.5) very disappointing!!

Atmosphere (8)
Service (7)

All in all very good food. Do not miss the Corn Chowder!
Skip the Crab Cakes.
author: Bruce L.

description:
So thrilled to have stumbled upon this restaurant after searching for a breakfast option in Fisherman's Wharf. By far one of the best restaurants I've been to. The building was lovely, the service was quick, and the food was delicious. Because the restaurant looked so nice and the food was so great, I thought the prices would be higher. However, the prices were the same as a horrible Denny's I had ate at the day before. 

Bottom line: I highly recommend Blue Mermaid.
author: Alli K.

description: My friends and I went there for appetizers and drinks.  We had their margarita, calamari, bowl of their chowder and oysters rockefeller. I loved their oysters rockefeller and margarita. Their chowder was pretty good also. Service was great.  I would recommend this place to others.
author: Tris W.

description: The best clam chowder I have ever had in my life. Service was good. I was a little disappointed that some of the items I chose on the menu were unavailable, as I planned my trip far in advance and even knew exactly what I wanted when I got there. But the chowder made up for any hard feelings! I will definitely be back next time I am in SF!
author: Valerie R.

description: Great chowders!  Unfortunately they lost our Yelp reservations, so we weren't on their list and had to wait, and it's really really pricey, but the chowder was worth it, I recommend the sampler.  Cocktails were good too.  Also the popcorn shrimp was fantastic.
author: Ariel F.

description: I came here a while ago, while I visiting from Chicago. A tour guide recommended this place for their seafood. We ordered the clam chowder in   a bread bowl along with fish and chips. The fish and chips came with garlic parmesan fries, and they were the best fried I have ever had in my life! The clam chowder was also very fresh. The service was good and the food didn't take too long to be made and brought out to us.
author: Michael L.

description: Amazing!!! During a short visit to the Bay Area my friend and I stumbled upon this gem! We tried the chowder flight sampling Manhattan, California, and New England clam chowder. All of them were full of flavor and clams. Next we shared cioppino and linguini with clams. Omg!!!! One word... Phenomenal!! He cioppino was an amazing seafood stew with a tomato base and every single piece of seafood was so fresh and well prepared. First time I tried cioppino and I'm afraid to try it elsewhere cause I'm afraid it won't compare. The linguini was perfectly cooked with a delightful light, yet flavorful sauce and an abundant amount of clams. This was more than enough for 2 people to share after chowder and fresh sourdough bread... Oh and an excellent Bloody Mary! Next time I'm in the area I'll definitely be back! If you're at Fisherman's wharf you'd be silly not to stop by!
author: Libby P.

description:
Dungeness crab and corn chowder was really good. We had it in a bread bowl. 

I recommend trying it. Atmosphere was just fine. Very sea like. Some boats, ropes, etc. 

It's in a touristy area.  But the chowder is worth the stop.
author: Brad H.

description: Thank you for an nice Christmas Eve dinner! Our server McKenzie was the best!! Enjoyed her attentive service and fun personality. Suggestion to the other staff to clear finished plates sooner. A suggestion for Christmas Eve: have live music or some spirited music playing during dinner. Thank you!
author: Suzie H.

description:
We came here to try out their seafood platters.  All three of us got the platter and clam chowder bread bowls.  It was a bit weird that we had an appetizer of seafood as our meal but I really thought there would be more food in the platter but I was wrong.  If you don't eat your seafood fast enough it'll get drowned in the melting ice.  

I've been to better places to eat fresh clams, mussels and half a dungeness crab but the customer service made up for it.
author: Kurt N.

description:
Surprisingly good option in the tourist trap section of the wharf. This is in Ghiradelli square and happened to be the first place we saw after coming out of the parking garage and since we were really hungry, Blue Mermaid it is.

The place has an interesting set up. It is supposed to be look like the inside of a ship with the round windows and other ship paraphernalia and the waiter dressed like sailors. It has a rustic feel with the brick walls and the tables. They have outdoor seating as well which is a ++.

I really liked our waiter. He was a really laid back guy with a chill vibe. The food was above average. My burger was pretty meaty and good. I really liked the Pot De Creme which was free with a Yelp checkin. Nice!
author: Sunil R.

description: Award winning crab and corn chowder says it all. It most definitely is! Add that with great service and you surely will not be disappointed. My Mom and I have made coming here a tradition each time I fly in to visit. Always a delightful time.
author: Kelly H.

description: Here in San Francisco for a convention & took the trolley to the Fishermans Wharf area & heard this place was good. We sat on the patio. Waiter was nice & helpful, calamari was great, oysters on 1/3 shell were fresh.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Surprisingly good given I expected hotel food.
Reasonable prices as well in relation to the surrounding restaurants.
They offer six types of chowder, one being more like a soup, and you can get a three type sampler.
The corn and crab chowder is fantastic, I really enjoyed their sausage and clam chowder, and my wife enjoyed the California chowder which included asparagus and corn along with clams. I thought it tasted a bit much like vegetables rather than seafood, but was different and refreshing.
The outdoor seating is also really nice with propane heaters nearby. The food may not be exquisite, but it is reasonably priced and better than most hotel attached restaurants.
author: Jasomus L.

description: Blue Mermaid was a nice place to enjoy lunch in the Fishermans Wharf. As with most places in San Francisco a place to walk to or use public transportation. We had a chicken club sandwich with fries and also the crab cakes. We sat outside and enjoyed the scenery. Always love to be able to sit outside and enjoy a meal. The waitress was pleasant and provided good service. The Blue Mermaid was a good stop for lunch. Just yelping out!  Follow me @justyelpingout
author: Kirk I.

description: Super yummy Eggs Benny! skip the coffee though...ugh.
author: Yasmin V.

description:
My husband and I ordered the popcorn shrimp, fries, and mussel and sausage chowder.  As a general rule, I like pretty much anything that can be called food, but our experience was pretty ho-hum.

1) The popcorn shrimp and fries were okay.  However, I dug through the chowder and only found two mussels so the chowder was a bust.  It had a ton of potatoes and sausage though.
2) Additionally, our waiter was pretty much non-existent.  We did not see him our entire meal and had to grab him so that we could pay for our meal so that we could leave.  He had to be reminded more than once that we wanted drink refills.

We did not Yelp this business before going and reading this business' replies to other negative reviews is discouraging.  We are not the type of people to complain to management about one person. Especially when the whole experience was a letdown.  Nor do we think this was an issue regarding our seafood "palate."  We do wish we would have read the Yelp reviews before coming here because it does not seem that our experiences were unique to our visit.

Oh well.  We won't be back.
author: Megan V.

description:
Yesterday was my first day at the Winery Collective and this place is just right next door, how convenient!

An associate recommended me to order the Ahi Tuna Salad.
+ I really enjoyed the fennel, coriander and the 2 huuuuuge slabs of Ahi they provide. + The fish is caught and approved by the Monterey Bay Aquarium Seafood Watch standards, which is excellent!
+ Josh hooks it upppp at the bar
+ 2 Huge TVs to watch the game

Conclusion: Seems that there might be certain dishes on the menu that kick ass, and some that are mediocre.
author: Julia D.

description: Ebon is an amazing server- funny and offered good suggestions for our party.  I highly recommend the patio and Ebon with Crispin apple  cider - Yummie combo
author: Diane L.

description: The gap toothed rude disrespectful waiter who ruined my experience here is the reason I will never be back and, in fact, left the restaurant while the manager ran after me begging to come back. After searching for this place for about an hour after a friend recommended it, we finally found it and were happy to sit and enjoy a meal given how cold it was. We sat in a spot where there was a chill by the door and I asked him if it was possible to change locations. The response I received was eye rolling and some huffing and puffing as he walked away to ask the manager. He returned and suggested another spot which was even worse and we stayed where we were. we ordered coffee for my dad, tea for my mom, and a martini for me which I had asked the manager about to ensure they have bleu cheese olives and she said she would have them made. He took the order but then snapped and said they don't have bleu cheese olives and to "order something else". When I let him know of what the manager had said, he snapped back "FINE! I'll ask. what else?" At this point, I was getting annoyed, but kept my cool because I didn't want to go out again searching for yet another place because we were on vacation and I had no clue what another good spot in Fisherman's Wharf was amongst all the new nastiness taking over the area. He came back with 2 coffees and set my dad's down in a way that coffee spilled out. He didn't apologize and when I stopped him and reminded him that my mom ordered tea, he snatched the cup and started mumbling under his breath as he started walking away which is around the time I lost it and asked "Are you going to have this ***tty attitude for the rest of the time or is this gonna end?" He snapped back that he wasn't having an attitude and I said that I would like to see his manager. She came by and apologized and said she'd talk to him, but by then I told her I don't know what kind of person he is and I'm not going to deal with that attitude and the risk of him spitting in our food so we got up to leave. She came after us outside of the restaurant apologized profusely and begged us to come back and said she would talk to him, but by then the damage was done. I refuse to ever visit this establishment again and I don't recommend it to anyone else either because when you are on vacation and are spending good money on a meal, the last thing you want to deal with is some rude person who is probably angry about their own life and lack of accomplishments to then be taking it out on you. The service was so atrocious that I can only imagine that their food is the same. Also, I'm still waiting for that martini! Guess those bleu cheese olives are still being made!
author: Niloo K.

description:
I had been willing to try this place for a long time because of their award-winning clam chowder, but found out that all the hype for this place was not really worth it. As I walked into the restaurant, I was greeted by the hostess, which told me that the bartender was taking to-go orders. The hostess then told the bartender my order, so he could serve it. I walked up to the bar, and patiently waited for the bartender to attend me. There was lots of people at the bar, so I assumed he was busy. 

After a couple of minutes, I saw him talking to the customers and getting tips from them. Now, I knew that he was just flat out ignoring me because he might as well make more money in tips than my order. 

After almost 10 minutes, I became frustrated and told another woman to take my order. She again repeated what the hostess said. I told her that he didn't take my order, and she decided to take my order, which only took about 5 minutes. 

Overall, the clam chowder is amazing. I understand that it is award-winning, which makes me expect that it will be excellent. I would give 5 stars for the food, but because of their horrible customer service, lack of responsibility, and bad organization, I had to give it 3.
author: Celia B.

description:
The Crab & Corn Chowder was amazing!!! We also had the Cioppino which was really really good too. However, the House Special Cocktails were too small for the price. I had a Madame Butterfly for $11, and it was tasty, but it came in a small champagne glass!
The staff was very nice and the service was fast. I would eat there again definitely.
author: Sherri E.

description: Outstanding crab and corn chowder. We've been here for happy hour a few times over the years and found the drinks to be a cut above. Generous pours and a solid menu. Root of All Evil and Hemingway Daiquiris are worth a try. Oysters are fresh and chicken drumettes are a nice change from typical wings. Service has always been friendly and efficient.
author: Heath H.

description:
Took a trip to San Francisco and of course had to try one of the popular bread bowl chowder soup. I really wanted to try a chowder bowl from one of those chowder bowl stands but it was too chilly to eat outside. Strolling through the pier I came across Blue Mermaid Chowder House. Perfect, since it was indoor.

AMBIANCE: Clean, business was slow at that time (did not have to wait to be seated), quiet, and our waiter was a nice lady. Clean bathroom area. 

SERVICE: Awesome, waiter was helpful and checked up on us frequently.

FOOD: Bread Chowder Bowl - very good and tasteful. Ate all my chowder! Onion Rings- oily, didn't really care to much for it . Typical American food.

VALUE: Affordable $15-$20 

I would come back and recommend it to a friend.
author: Rogeline M.

description: Do not go there for clam chowder! There was barely any clams and it was filled with onions! However the chicken club sandwich with garlic fries was tasty.
author: Sarina S.

description: We were staying nearby and wanted an easy dinner spot - Blue Mermaid fit the bill. While it wasn't our favorite meal of our stay in San Fransisco, it was better than average. The chowder was excellent. I'd definitely return and would like to explore more of the menu.
author: Amy A.

description: Came here for the award winning crab/clam chowder- it did not disappoint! My husband was glad to see Anchor Brewing Brekle's on the menu. Just stop in for the chowder and you will like it! You don't need it in a bread bowl, it was meh.
author: Jennifer P.

description: Fish and chips was decent, clam chowder was runny and thin, waiter provided poor service. He did not check back after serving us and the quickest thing he did was bring our bill to us! Disappointing!
author: Mike L.

description: We only ate there once with a light meal.  The Caesar Salad was amazing.  The drinks were good, too.
author: Roseann K.

description: Not super impressed.  Got some crab dip that was just OK and nothing special.  Some oysters that were really small.  The chowder was decent.  My wife liked her tuna and avocado dish.  Overall nice atmosphere but service was lacking.  After waitress sensed we weren't ordering a ton of food she became scarce.  Didn't have water for half the meal due to neglect.  Would definitely try somewhere else next time.
author: Tom M.

description:
Holy mother of crab corn chowder! If you are looking for "that" chowder, the one that is fresh and unique, even by SF standards then this is THAT one. 

It rivals Seattle's Ivar's and the best that Boston, Baltimore and Maine can chalk up! It summons me every time I come to SF!!!

This thing is loaded with fresh meaty crab, lumps of potato, andouille sausage, creamy base and a touch of corn... The float of pesto olive oil tops it off. It is essential to wash it down with an Anchor Steam and clean the bowl with sides of SF fresh sourdough.

Oh yeah, and check in on YELP for a free glass of house Chardonnay :)

The other seafood here is very good as well. The decor is nice and clean with a very trendy nautical theme that fits right in with the attached Kimpton favorite "Argonaut Hotel."

Service is always nice, FAST and friendly. The place sits somewhat "hidden" and serene in contrast to the unknowing tourists passing by outside in a hustle for other attractions.

Quit looking for the dingy ole clam chowder and step up to some of the country's best chowder - period.
author: Gary R.

description: Wonderful food, ambiance and service. Disappointed by $7 cappuccino (double priced) and $3 surcharge for asking for a vegetarian version of American Breakfast.
author: A. A.

description: Crab dip and crab & corn chowder are deliciously filling. We also ordered the crab cakes and Parmesan crusted tilapia as entrées, which were tasty but too much food after the amazing starters. Bottom line, come hungry and get chowder!
author: Lisa R.

description: Great bar food! My girlfriend and I came on a Monday. Popcorn shrimp was small, but great. The clam chowder was delicious. My girlfriend really enjoyed the oysters. We would come back, especially for oysters and during Happy Hour.
author: Anselmo M.

description: The sampler chowder (New England, California, Crab and Corn) $12 for very small but ohh so delicious! Would be five stars if larger portion or cheaper price..
author: J L.

description: Amazing "bar food" as it should not be called as this was some of the best appetizers in the Bay Area. Oysters shucked and popcorn shrimp with crab chowder is amazing. Price is right!
author: Larry M.

description:
This place was a definite highlight on our trip to Fisherman's Wharf. It was late night. There were drunk high-school kids roaming the streets and we needed to find a less rowdy crowd, STAT! 

The decor is very pirate ship-like and the staff was pleasant. The food was amazing. From the soup sampler to the soft-shell crab, to the crab po-boy...it was a blast! We were too full for the dessert but if I could, I would have!

I spotted a few families but mostly that night, it was couples and friends. The place was surrounded by some lively bars and dessert shops, too.
author: Marily S.

description: AMAZING service. They treated us like we had just spent $100 a piece, but it was actually super adorable. The California Clam Chowder was delicious. I highly recommend, especially to touring families.
author: Audrey Z.

description: This place is only getting two stars because the crab and corn chowder is great. The service is so slow and it was a Monday. There is no one here except a few people at the bar for the game. Our server Michael took forever to fill our drinks. We had to flag down a bus boy to fill our waters. Food is decent and reasonably priced for San Francisco near the Wharf but just know the service is below par.
author: Bryan N.

description: had continental breakfast there as a hotel guest - stale dry pastry could not be cut without crumbling ...
author: koko d.

description: Nice lunch. Standard sfo bread bowl. Delicious  chowder.  Very good for a tourist  spot
author: Andrew M.

description: First, is it my responsibility to find the waiter to order? Had to or we would have starved to death. Started with overly salty chowder. The only choice for pepper was the stuff on the table. No option for fresh ground pepper. Then it was a Sunday and they were serving brunch, so ordered the "American Breakfast." Which came with french fries. Um, french fries? I was told that they were out of home fires. This tells me that they are from a giant bag, not made fresh. Apparently the chefs can't cut up a potato.
author: Mark C.

description:
While strolling the wharf, a group of us stopped for clam chowder and Bloody Mary's. It's a scenic location within the Cannery at Del Monte Square. Huge patio with warm sun on a cold day. 

CLAM CHOWDER

The Trio - Select your three favorites! 
1.) Crab & Corn - The menu says award winning and they're not kidding. Strong flavors of chive and pepper.

2.) Mussel & Sausage - Red sauce based chowder that's more like a vegetable based soup with chunks of tomato. 

3.) Shrimp & Red Pepper - I THINK THIS IS THE BEST OF THE THREE. Spicy chowder with pieces of red and yellow pepper. Not very thick, but creamy and yummy.  

The Bowls - I tried a friend's bread bowl and it is soft sourdough heaven. The bowls are 12oz and great of course!
author: Ruben O.

description:
The award winning corn and crab chowder is a must!  The fish and chips are really great as well.  And the staff is super friendly and helpful, in this unique historical old cannery building.

There is outdoor seating in their courtyard (with heat lamps for when the fog rolls in) and they have T.V.s to catch the game at the bar.
author: Olivia D.

description:
I came here just for the award winning crab and corn chowder.  It was good but not what I expected. It was too creamy for me and it seemed to be filled with fillers.  My lukewarm opinion of the chowder is likely  due to my own tastes as I prefer a crab chowder that highlights the crab as the main focus -- not the extras like cream, corn and potatoes. The crab chowder I prefer is only available at the Dead Fish which is outside of the city in a suburb called Crockett.

Because I was at the hotel for a conference that week,  I gave the Blue Mermaid another try.  This time I ordered decaf coffee and the dungeness crab cake.  The decaf coffee was not fresh.  It had a burnt taste obviously left too long without being refreshed.  The crab cake was served with a spring mix salad.  The salad had no dressing and the crab cake was cold.  I sent it back.  The waitress I returned with a warmer crab cake but even that couldn't help the taste--too much filler and not enough crab.  I asked for salad dressing and I received a serving of the red pepper aioli which was the sauce used to drizzle over the crab cake.  I gave up.
author: Deardra M.

description:
I had very high hopes for my first visit to the Blue Mermaid. Started off a bit rough when I asked for a different table not stuffed in a corner, only answer was "that table is for parties of five or more". My problem with this answer was the restaurant was half empty. Not the start I wanted.  

The service was good, not great. Seems like because it is a tourist location they are pretty jaded. 

Both the wife and I opted for the chowder sampler, it was OK. The NE was the best. The kids split a burger, but it came with the wrong cheese and sides, third let down moment. 

The final straw was the bread not good sourdough. We have more than enough signature bakeries in the area. Why settle for a second tier?  

On a good note, the atmosphere and the decor are great. But did not make up for the deficiencies, sorry Kimpton, it's me, not you.
author: Marc R.

description: We got their a little before they opened at noon. A gentleman came out to see what he could do, he may have been the owner or manager, distinguished looking fella. He invited us in to sit and wait for them to open, these days that is a great thing. They were recommended as having the best clam chowder at Fisherman's Wharf and so far I can't dispute that. I ordered the cup of chowder and wish I had a set of bowls this size. It was larger than anything I saw being served a the Wharf. It was exciting to see the large crowds up and down the wharf just like it was when I was a kid. You get allot for the money.
author: Mike Y.

description: Found this place on Thrisllist and the best clam chowder in Frisco. They were dead on! I got the California clam and it was perfect. I had some fish and chips and that was good but the chowder is delicious.
author: Mike V.

description: Great service. Very kid/family friendly. We went family style and ordered popcorn shrimp, cioppino, garlic roasted crab, and fish and chips. Local brews are good as well. Fresh seafood brought in the day you eat. Wear your bibs!
author: Andy P.

description:
I'm on vacation right now and staying at the hotel where this restaurant is located. 

We went here for breakfast yesterday morning. I ordered an omelette with avocado and cheese. It was excellent. The portion was just right and it wasn't greasy. They provided too much butter for the two slices of sourdough bread that I got, but that's no biggie. 

Today we went here for lunch. I ordered the Chicken Club, which was piled high with two of my faves - avocado and tomato. But the bonus was totally unexpected. I had to choose from fries, coleslaw and salad. Since I was in a rush, I defaulted to fries. When it came out, I was expecting regular fries. To my ultimate delight, I got a side of Parmesan Garlic fries. It could've used more garlic (I heart  garlic!), but it wasn't too salty (like the kind I've had at the ballpark). So, it was a pleasant surprise and good too. 

It's a very decent place in a tourist area. It's definitely worth a try!
author: Allyson M.

description:
I had the chowder sampler. It was ok but the samples where tiny.  Thank good I asked for bread or I would have left hungry. 

The service was soooooo slow. Didn't get much attention from our waiter we had to waive him down for our bill. I don't know why they would think I have nothing better to do then to sit in their restaurant for ever, just sitting there till they get good and ready to attend a customer once they finished eating.
author: Grace O.

description: Our food was pretty good, but our service was horrid. We were starving after a full day of travel and asked twice for bread. Finally got it 30 minutes later- when our entrees arrived. Had to flag our waiter down for drink refills and then once again had to wait a ridiculous amount of time. We were finished eating our meals by the time our 2nd glass of wine was delivered. Also had to flag our waiter down to get the side I ordered with my meal. Got that at the end of my meal too. Very frustrating because this place has potential. For a meal in this price range, I would rather spend my money where good service is also part of the experience.
author: Melissa B.

description: As promised, the chowder in a bread bowl was amazing! We tried a few clam chowder place and this place was the best. They had a couple of different clam chowder options, but the corn and potato chowder was the best in our opinion. Cool location too. Totally give this place a try if you're in the fisherman's warf area!
author: Ashley A.

description: I ordered a cup of their dungeness crab and corn chowder, it was good but I'll just stick to San Fran's traditional chowder. I also ordered the Dungeness crab roll with garlic fries. It wasn't great. The crab was cold and tasteless. The ciabatta bread was hard and not warm either. It had no seasoning!  $19 dollars worth, definitely not worth it for the price I paid. The garlic fries were also disappointing, they just sprinkled garlic seasoning and parmesan cheese I think? Their drinks were about the best thing I ordered. I ordered the Dark and Stormy (rum, ginger beer, lime) and the cucumber melon margarita, it was delicious! If you check in on yelp they give you a free dessert. So I ordered the upside down apple pie, which is exactly what it was. Nothing fancy.
author: Kay R.

description:
How does this place stay in business?  I guess unknowing tourists and guests of the attached hotel will eat there once and that keeps them in business.

Our party of three ordered steak, scallops and crab cakes along with salad and their famous corn chowder.  Salads are hard to muck up....but the chowder?  It just did not have the flavor or chunks of crab I would expect from the description.  The steak was fine, the scallops were rubbery and the crab cakes were mediocre.  For dessert we ordered a chocolate mousse.  I SWEAR THEY LEFT THE SUGAR OUT!  I'm good with a dark chocolate that is not overly sweet, but all three of us could not taste any sugar.  HORRIBLE!

A few minutes after we decided not to touch our dessert we were asked to pay and leave...because they had a big group coming and needed our table.  Considering the place was empty, it must have been a private party. ;)  I don't grump much but this place is a MUST AVOID in my opinion...hard to earn that comment from me too!
author: Cindi A.

description: Good service. Fun drink the bloody mermaid.  Real maple syrup on the French toast that comes with berry butter.  The billini was strong (good).  Tasty bunch.
author: Nicole S.

description:
This place was about par with the all the other fisherman's wharf restaurants. We came here our first day to get something quick. I ordered the fried calamari. It was normal for calamari you will get in most restaurants - dry and chewy. The garlic fries were tasty though. It was cold outside and they put us next to the door where the breeze kept coming in. Pigeons would walk in through the door and the guy at the table next to us kept freaking out about it.
We returned another day to try the chowder after a of couple people raved about it. I wasn't impressed with it. It tasted like chowders I have had out of a soup can. I additionally ordered the scallops. They were not the best I have had either. Perhaps scallops are out of season?
Bottom line, eat here if it is convenient. I wouldn't take a cab across town to eat here.
author: Leala V.

description:
Love love love this restaurant!  They have the best chowder in San Francisco! 
My husband and I tried it one day when we saw that they had crab chowder mad it was excellent!  Big chunks of crab, and just enough spice to give it great flavor.  They also have great gourmet iced tea flavors.
We will definitely be returning again.
author: Tiffany I.

description:
Went for lunch, had the chowder, try the California chowder.  It is the best.

Manager was great and attentive to our needs.  Wish I could go back.  Eat here it is good!!!!
author: N G.

description:
Overall mostly positive experience with this restaurant. It was not too packed in the pre-New Year weekend, in spite of the crowds around, and there were empty tables even at the premium dinner time. 
Location: very good (between pier 39 and Girardelli).
Interior design: not bad.
Food: really good especially for clam chowders lovers. You can really see the difference between the one you got here and one you got on the street for $5.
Drinks: limited choice.
Portions size: Good.
Price: Average.
author: Michael P.

description:
Had a great meal here on Saturday (June 28th). The server, James, was knowledgeable about the menu. Had bowls of the New England Clam Chowder and Crab and Corn Chowder. Both were great and so were their drinks from the bar. The service from the hostess though was the best. She went above and beyond by finding trolley times for us and was courteous enough to charge my phone. Both acts which are truly appreciated by tourists who depend on our smart phones to get around town. I believe her name was Brenda. Major thanks to her!
We will definitely be back when we visit SF again.
author: Leo R.

description:
Pros: seated quick,  party of 5.  Drinks and food came out relatively quick,  and our waiter was kind enough to get our order in before the table of 13 next to us.  Mussels were good,  corn and crab chowder were good.   

Cons: been here twice now,  and both times the bartender and waiter tonight stated when asked about recommendations "I haven't eaten the food here."   The food is average, scallops were underwhelming.   Shrimp cocktail comes with small amount of cocktail sauce spread over a pile of shredded lettuce (wtf?).   Impossible to dip,  and when you did get some sauce it was covered in shredded iceberg lettuce.   Had to ask for a seperate cup of cocktail sauce.   On the positive side,  the shrimp was fresh and tasted great. 

Last con,  beer selection is terrible.   No craft selections,  standard bud light,  colors light, stella BS.   Applebee's has a more extensive beer list. 

Would I dine here again?   Not by choice as you can expect to spend $50 pp.
author: Justin M.

description: Went there today and found the atmosphere to be the best thing about the restaurant.  Very calm and cozy.  A nice little spot to stop in to relax.  I had a glass of wine and bread bowl with soup for about $30.  Service was fair.
author: Cheryl B.

description:
5 stars for the crab and corn chowder.
Best in town- service is ok, menu is the norm for around the area but the chowder was EXCELLENT
author: Arizonagirl E.

description: Came for the chowder which is truly exceptional. The service is unfriendly if you are not eating a full meal and only one of 2 drinking.  The lack of service so far out shadows the outstanding food that I would tell you you are better off walking to a food truck!
author: David L.

description:
Wanted to come here for DAT before so when my friend asked to go to dinner around fisherman's wharf I thought we would try this place out...

Service was a bit awkward, personally our server was very nice but the people that would bring our food over or fill up water...or even the manager would just interrupt conversations at all the wrong times.

We tried to order calamari and chowder in a bread bowl..they didn't have either. Are you serious? A restaurant in the  wharf without those both? And mind you they had to come back twice to let us know so it was let down after let down.

We ordered a crab cake..size of half my palm..for 13 bucks. It wasn't that great, waste of money :'(

I probably will never come back to the restaurant so sad!!! :(
author: Selina W.

description:
Note : This review is on their clam chowder only

I like to play tourist and hang out at Wharf/Pier39 on sunny days .One of the things I do there is go on my quest of best clam chowder ever by trying out different restaurants. I've gone through about 1/3 of the restaurants in that area (and I try to start out with ones that have relatively favorable yelp revies), and Blue Mermaid, so far, takes the prize for best clam chowder. 
You can never go back to the canned clam chowders after trying out some of the wonderful clam chowder in the Wharf/Pier39 area (and ironically, they ALL claim they were voted the best...)
This is a little outside of the heaviest tourist areas, but right by the Ghiradelli Square.
author: Christina P.

description:
Feasted on: the California clam chowder (good), calamari (good--nice that it had bits of asparagus), crab roll (good), popcorn shrimp (good), Oysters Rockefeller (good), and Anchor Steam seasonal lager and Lagunitas IPA. Oink. Good service.

Oh, the crab chowder was also good, but the bacon flavor a bit overpowering.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I'm surprised there are not better restaurants down around fisherman's wharf. At least out of what I saw. But I happend to go into the blue mermaid because it was attached to a hotel, the name of which I forget. The interior was nice and clean and spacious. The food was good. I had the New England clam chowder which was good, but a little expensive. I also had to strip steak which was cooked medium rare properly and the asparagus and mushrooms and I'll gratin potato were very good too. The service was good too. I'd recommend this restaurant.
author: Frank K.

description:
My friends came here because we were walking around the city, and started craving clam chowder.  We decided to give this place a try and it was okay.  They have many different kinds of clam chowders, and they also let you sample, so sample away!

I ended up going with the original New English Clam Chowder, since I wanted a creamy based chowder.  The chowder itself was actually a little fishier than normal, wasn't terrible but the taste was stronger than normal.  

My friends got the crab & corn chowder, which is one of their most popular chowder.  It was good but I wouldn't say it's the best chowder ever either.  

Didn't get a chance to try other things on the menu, but maybe next time.
author: Jenny T.

description:
This review was actually done in 2012, however I just realized I failed to post it and it was sitting in my profile waiting on me... The reason I'm saying this is that I'm not sure if it's the same now as it was then.... =)

My husband and I came here since it came highly recommended.  The food was fantastic.  Even one of the Chef's "Brandon" came over and greeted us.  We had the chowder sampler and hands down the crab and corn chowder was the best I've ever had.  My husband had the Mahi Mahi and I had the Trio (salmon, prawns, crabcake), everything was great.  Loved the customer service, the staff were all friendly and accommodating...  Would definitely recommend and can't wait to go back....
author: Sharon J.

description:
EXCELLENT service, great atmosphere, the chowder was amazing & the drinks were on point.

This is a great place to go and grab a drink and get an appetizer. Not too sure if the entree prices are quite worth what you get. 

Be sure to get the upside down apple pie for dessert!
author: Kendall T.

description: Came here on a Saturday evening because a lot of other places were too busy. I wasn't too hungry so only ordered a few things. Got the chowder trio sample with crab and corn, California Clam, and New England. They were decent, but pretty standard. The roasted corn side was not good because the corn was so chewy and hard. The Brussels sprouts side was awful. Never had sour Brussels before. Would not come back. There was also a swarm of flies near our table when we first walked in, not a great first impression.
author: Lillian V.

description:
Came here on a chilly Winter weekday night for dinner. It was pretty quiet inside.

- Reviews of the chowders:
CRAB AND CORN CHOWDER:  Had a fair amount of crab chunks and corn. Despite this being their award-winning chowder, I actually liked the other chowders more. It was in no way bad, I just prefer the tastes of the other chowders more.

MANHATTAN CLAM CHOWDER:  This tomato-based chowder had ample amounts of veggies and potatoes. Really enjoyed the flavor. I would order this again. 

MUSSEL AND SAUSAGE CHOWDER:  Had chunks of sausage but barely any mussels. However, I enjoyed the flavor and would order this again.

SHRIMP AND RED PEPPER CHOWDER:  My favorite chowder..maybe it's my love of shrimps. This had a smoky shrimp flavor and several pieces of shrimp inside. I kept drinking and drinking until there was no chowder left.

CALIFORNIA CLAM CHOWDER:  Why California? Because this chowder has chopped veggies! I enjoyed this.


- Reviews of the entrees & dessert:
CRAB CAKES:  Think fried shredded crab with breading, served with a side of salad and red pepper aioli. Nothing too special here.

PACIFIC LING COD:  It was good, but nothing too memorable.

APPLE ALMOND COBBLER:  Hot, crumbly cobbler crust with a scoop of cold vanilla ice cream and hot, gooey apple filling...I was in heaven. This dessert made the night. I ate every last bite.


Service was quick, and the waitstaff was warm and welcoming. Do I see myself coming back here? Maybe - if I was craving one of their specific chowders or their apple almond cobbler.
author: Christina C.

description:
I am giving this 4 stars for 2 reasons. 1) I had the chowder sampler and while the chowder was very good, it wasn't the best I had ever had.  I was disappointed because this place was touted as having amazing chowder, it was 4 stars at best.  2) The guy at the front who was seating everyone....rude.  He wasn't wearing the same shirt as the rest of the staff so I didn't even know he was an employee.  Then he asked "do you have a reservation or did you just walk in"?  Which was fine until he told us that since we walked in, that it would be a 20 minute wait.  We chose to sit at the bar and got service immediately.  We were there for 1 1/2 hours and there were 3 tables that nobody sat in until 5 minutes before we left.  Every time he walked by us at the bar he just rolled his eyes.  Weird....

The bartender, I didn't catch her name, was fantastic!  She made my mom and I feel very welcome.  I used my Yelp check in to get a glass of the house wine, and I chose the Merlot.  It wasn't great wine, but then again, what do you expect for a free glass of house wine. 
On the other hand, she did recommend the Malbec and the Pinot Gris.  Both fantastic!!!  She had such a playful and joyus banter with us and the rest of the patrons.  She really made our night.

We finished with the Chocolate port de creme.  The only thing that stopped me from licking the pot was social niceties.  

The decor was definitely old time maritime which is very appropriate for the name and place it is located.  If I lived here, I would absolutely come back.
author: Amanda B.

description:
This is *the* place to go if you have food allergies, Celiac or are gluten free. 

As a person with multiple food allergies, my biggest challenge while traveling is finding things to eat. If I can't find a hotel room with a kitchen, I usually have to make due with tuna, nut bars, and rapidly aging leftovers brought from home. As I'm sure you can imagine, I'm excited to find any chef that can safely cook for me. And with my insane collection of food allergies plus gluten intolerance, I'm generally lucky to get a plain piece of meat and steamed vegetables. 

Chef Adrian not only cooked for us, he cooked spectacular, creative, five star meals for us for three nights in a row while we were staying at the attached Argonaut Hotel. And he was excited to do it, too! He told me he enjoyed the challenge. Our meals were so gorgeous, delicious, and beautifully presented that I'm pretty sure the other diners were jealous - and I can tell you I'm certain *that's* an experience I won't be having again soon. 

The whole experience was smooth and beautifully handled from beginning to end. I took my allergy card in the day we arrived in town - a few hours before we hoped to eat - and spoke with Courtney the restaurant manager. She immediately assured us they could handle cooking for me and popped in to the back to fetch Chef Adrian from the kitchen. He came out, reviewed my allergy card, and discussed possible menu options with us. When we arrived at the restaurant that evening the hostess advised our very allergy-aware server that I had food allergies and that Chef Adrian was cooking a specially adapted meal for me. Chef Adrian came out to go over the ingredients before cooking our meals and then delivered our meals personally to the table and walked us through every ingredient.

For our first night he adapted the special so that I could eat it. For the second and third nights he cooked us completely original meals using all of the ingredients on their menus that I *could* eat, plus a few he brought in just for us! Seriously folks - he made me tapas. Tapas! For those of you who have multiple food allergies, you'll understand where I'm coming from here. All those little samplers with mystery ingredients are generally something I avoid like the plague. But here I could eat with complete confidence.

My only regret is I don't live close enough to come here all the time. We're seriously considering another trip to the Bay Area just so we can eat here again. Thanks Chef Adrian! You made our trip.
author: Jo H.

description: I have tried both Happy Hour and Lunch menu items, and I would only ever come for Happy Hour in the future.  The house red and white wines are good, along with the Spicy Chicken Drumettes and shells and cheese.  During lunch, I tried the Grilled Ahi Tuna BLT and the wedge salad.  Both were unremarkable, and nothing I'd bother ordering again, which was disappointing, since I was looking forward to a good wedge salad and sandwich, especially for the price.  On the plus side, the restaurant is great if you prefer a quieter spot in the busy wharf area that is clean and has an outdoor patio.
author: Julie S.

description:
First off... the waiters... (specifically Brian) made us feel at home.. and even gave us the recipes to some of the things we had at dinner that we simply refused to live without.. one of those was the Award Winning Crab & Corn Chowda.. HOLY COW!  it was a cali style chowda complete with a little cilantro on top.. and MAN was it good! the sourdough rivals Boudin's AND im not a fan of calamari.. but theres ROCKED.  
The bar drinks were good. and Everyone at the table was impressed.. 

PS.. try the Mac&Cheese.. it doesn't disappoint!
author: Megan C.

description:
We were craving some clam chowder after a night of clubbing/partying, and decided to eat somewhere walking distance from our hotel. Our party (party of 6) came in, the restaurant wasn't pack or crowded, but it took about 15-20 minutes after being seated before our waitress checked up on us to take our order. 

5 of us ordered the award winning dungeness crab and corn chowder and one ordered a club sandwich. The chowder itself was pretty good. It was nice and creamy with good size bits of bacon.  The added pepper and tabasco is a must!  I wish i could have tasted more of the dungeness crab, but overall the bread bowl was filling, but that's because our group devoured 2 plates of bread in our wait, that took seemingly took forever.

My friend said that his sprite was flat and tasted like it had some soap in it, we got it replaced with iced tea instead. For 5 chowders, a club sandwich, 2 iced teas, and a coffee our bill came out to $113 gratuity included, which seemed a bit too much. There was also a "SF Good Health Fee," wtf is that?!

All in all, it seems like a touristy spot that charge you a premium for what it's really worth. The service was really slow. The good thing about our experience was the chowder and that they have the 49er game playing on the TV's.
author: Kevin C.

description: Huge fan of their location and the ambiance.  Great place to relax and grab some delicious chowder.  The argonaut hotel attached also is a nice place to relax in, and reminds me of a cruise ship interior.
author: John C.

description: Great clam chowder! Friendly staff. I was very impressed all the way around, especially since it's located in tourist trap CA, USA.
author: Deborah B.

description: Great food, nice atmosphere. We wanted to sit outside, but it was a bit chilly out. The hostess found a table for us outside and turned on the lava heat, which kept us comfortable. The waiter was polite and helpful - he gave a good recommendation for crab and corn chowder. My husband had chowder sampler and loved all three types. My seared salmon was delicious and the chef was kind to adjust the recipe for me as I am dairy-intolerant. The food came pretty fast, everything was fresh, hot, and delicious.
author: Nina W.

description:
Touristy, over-priced and the food was adequate. The waitstaff was good and the service was decent.
