We barely made it out under $100 for lunch and a drink each. I'm not complaining - we knew better, but we were so hungry we couldn't help ourselves. 

Locals don't come here accept maybe for happy hour.
author: David M.

description: Decent meal. Stayed at the adjacent hotel (great location by the way) and so this restaurant was convenient to try. Service was very good and food came out quickly. Decent food portions. Ordered the chowder sampler. Definitely don't miss out on this appetizer.
author: Mark H.

description:
As a seafood restaurant, I was surprised at the lack of local flavor.  I had the seafood trio, salmon, prawns and crab cake.  It might have been tasty if they relied on the flavors of the grilled seafood, but it was smothered in a tasteless lemon butter sauce that covered everything, including the bland mashed potatoes.

Crabcake wasn't cooked thru, prawns were overdone, but salmon was cooked appropriately.  For $40, I've experienced better.
author: Jeff B.

description: Was in town for a conference and met up with a friend for lunch.  The place had very nice décor without being too over the top.  The menu was fairly straight forward and didn't disappoint with variety.  When the food arrived, it was Delish!
author: Jang Mi J.

description:
A nautical themed restaurant attached to the Argonaut Hotel. I had breakfast here twice since i was staying at the Argonaut, and it was good both times. They have a great cheese and charcuterie plate, great lox with capers and pickled onions and a very nice Belgium waffle!

The coffee was above standard diner coffee and the service was pretty fast and responsive. There little outdoor seating area looked cute too. I liked that is was laid back, but offered some nice choices instead of just eggs and bacon. 

The atmosphere is very cute too, I felt very sailory...  and I wanted a shirt like the waiters were wearing.. very nautical coco Chanel.. lol
author: Corey Tess T.

description: Very good coppino (sp) with generous servings of crab, mussels and calamari.  Casual brick room with a good San Francisco feel at a tourist location.
author: Robert M.

description:
Went here the other night on our way home from Pacifica and had yet another great dinner.
My scallops were delicious and my son loved his clams and luigini and my husband had the cold shell fish combo .
Great service!
author: stephanie p.

description: The food, Service & ambiance here at the Blue Mermaid was outstanding! Worth the trip from Sacramento,Ca. Michael our server was great! Thanks again!
author: Rosslin D.

description: Terrible service! I try to be pretty lax about service, but when your server actually tells you he "spaced out" while taking your order - then "forgets" about you while others who came later got their food in a timely manner. No refills, food served cold, and we had to ask for all condiments. It was a downer. 2 stars for manager actually handling it in a decent way.
author: Amy R.

description:
California Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder! 

We attend the Great Chowder Cookoff in Newport Rhode Island every year, and it was the best by far. Won 1st place in the creative category. Visited San Francisco to "see a friend" but made sure we stopped at Blue Mermaid for this asap.
author: Mike M.

description:
My family and I were staying at the argonaut hotel so this was a convenient option. My hub and ate here a few years back and remembered it being great. This visit it was just OK. We had dinner and sat outside. Ambiance is nice at night. We ordered the crab bake and then each of us got a bread bowl. Crap bake was really fishy. The bowls of soups were good but not sure how you can screw those up. My kids had the Mac and cheese and I preferred that over the crab bake! Overall ok. 
The next day we came for breakfast. Do not eat breakfast here. Go over to Joanie's which is right up the street. I ordered the egg Benedict ($15) and the eggs were way over cooked. I am pretty simple and never deny food but I didn't even eat a half of one. We got the kiddos the berry pancakes (no kids breakfast menu) and they were very dry and had literally two strawberries cut up on them. My husband got the cinnamon French toast and that was probably the best meal out of the three. Had to ask twice for a high chair and never got a coffee refill. Go to Joanie's for breakfast!
author: Christina P.

description:
Came here at the recommendation of our Segway tour guide, and their chowder is pretty good I have to admit. 

- New England (white), Manhattan (red, tomato based), and Californian (pink twist on Manhattan with asparagus and shrimp?)  -- I love the New England crab and corn chowder, EXCELLENT!

Not cheap though, two bowls of soup (large indeed, and can be shared between two people) plus a beer runs for $30+ during lunch time sitting at the bar. 
Thankfully we had a free dessert coupon that rewarded us a berry tart with a scoop of Vanilla bean ice cream on top!.. 

Good touristy spot.
author: Winifred X.

description: Crab and corn chowder was great! My wife got the clam chowder and we shared calamari. We'll come back if we make it back to San Francisco.
author: Travis B.

description: Tiny portions, not even fresh, overpriced. Complete waste of money.
author: S. A. K.

description:
Their chowders were just as wonderful as all these reviews have said.
Despite our visit on a busy July 4th, service was friendly and fast.

Wait staff was very familiar with the menu and checked back with us often.
We even made a repeat visit another night, which we generally try to avoid, but we really enjoyed it so made the return trip.

Wine pricing very reasonable as well.
author: Beverly K.

description: The staff is friendly.  We sat outside to experience the whole crowd walking by and get the vibe of Frisco.  Well that's about the best part of this place.  I had the Chowder Sampler (New England, California Chowder, and the Crab & Corn Chowder.)  Simply wasn't very good.  The NE Chow was soupy (I know its a soup), but I felt it should have been thicker, the Cali Chow was different just wasn't ready for the Green Beans in my Chowder, and the Crab and Corn I think is just flavored with Crab and Corn because I only saw one kernel of Corn and absolutely no Crab at all.  No reason to go back.
author: Jay B.

description:
You call yourself a bar, yet have only 4 beers on tap. 
Food is overpriced
author: Regina F.

description:
Context is everything, isn't it?  I walked in after a long day at work, exhausted and absolutely alone.  It was 4 p.m. so the place was a ghost town.  My insane hunger totally destroyed any decision making ability, so I left it to the kindly waiter (was he wearing a sailor suit, or was that my famished hallucination?) and kind he was.  "Go for the California Chowder."  Anything you say, Cap'n.  

Cracked open Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix.  Freaking intense.  Adventure (and tragedy!) pairs well with a hot chowder.  Chowder was chock full of veggies, including boatloads of tomato and asparagus.  Devoured it, including the entire bread bowl.  

So why oh why is it three stars?  Service was slow despite the fact that we were at a 1:1 ratio of server to customer.  Had to wait fifteen minutes for my check, and this wasn't a semi-full plate type wait.  I ate the dish my soup came in.  My plate had max two crumbs on it.  There was no ambiguity: I was done.

Les not forget, I'm about the dollar bills. Those clams cost mad clams!  Walked out the door with $16 bucks outta my pocket for a bowl of chowder.  My limit for a bomb chowder is $13, and my socks must be blown off by mad flavor.  This was a solid $10 chowder.  Something I can recommend without hesitation is Harry Potter, the complete collection.
author: Ellen C.

description: I came here with a friend and only ordered appetizers and soup before we decided to leave. We ordered the fried fisherman platter and chose 3 different chowders (New England Chowder, Red Pepper and Shrimp, and the Corn and Crab). The platter came out and all of our food was burnt and the chowder was not hot. The only items that we ate were the New England Chowder and the pepper and shrimp chowder. Overall this place was bad and our waiter did not care (he acted as if this was common). Will not be visiting this place again.
author: Lauryn S.

description:
We stayed at the Argonaught Hotel last weekend and part of the package included breakfast each morning at the Blue Mermaid. The service was great, both days we tried something different: 

Day 1 
Me - Huevos rancheros with homefries. Very good. Eggs cook perfectly which for some reason other restaurants have a really hard time with. 
Hubby - Bacon and avocado scramble with homefries and sourdough toast. Awesome. 

Day 2 
Me - Classic Benedict. YUMMY and again the eggs were cook perfectly. 
Hubby - basic eggs, bacon and homefries. 

All of our meals were completely satisfying. The only reason I didn't give this place 4 stars was the night we arrived we went into the bar to watch the Sharks game ... and boo ... they didn't have versus so we have to go somewhere else.
author: Christie B.

description: Worst service I have ever seen in my life. The management is very poor, the servers were in multiple sections of the restaurant and outside on the patio as well, this means the servers are unable to properly serve the needs of their sections. I witnessed 5 different couples and families leave after being seated and never getting greeted by the server. It was so terrible it was comical that this place is still open. Also my family and I started playing an over-under if the people sat would stay or go and how long it would take for them to get the drinks they ordered. For the number of restaurants on the wharf walk past this overpriced trap.
author: Tim W.

description: this is a total tourist trap.  The "fame" crab & corn chowder is a scam since there were no crabs to be found.  You can get better chowders on Pier 41.  The house green salad was over soured with vinegaret.  It's as if they had chef jr did the cooking.
author: Joseph N.

description: Mediocre at best. The soup was fine. the wait staff told us everything was awesome and he was a bit over zealous so felt like he was paid to be a cheerleader. He must only eat there. All this for $350.
author: Kim M.

description:
Poor service, food bellow average.

At 9 o clock in The morning they were without pastries!

Avoid
author: Daniel c.

description: 4 of us went there for drinks and appetizers on Saturday 8/13/16.  Drinks and the service were great.  The best part was the chowders.  2 of us had the Clam Chowder, 1 had the chowder sampler, and 1 had the Crab & Corn Chowder.  It's tough to say which chowder was the best, but try the Crab & Corn Chowder is my recommendation.
author: Bill H.

description: Pretty good food. Very pricey. Came here from breakfast and lunch two separate days, nothing special there are definitely better places in San Fran to get a better bang for your buck
author: Tim D.

description: Not that I honestly expected much from a themed wharf restaurant with mediocre service but $64 for a glass of wine , bowl of chowder , skimpy house salad and two kids meals? Ummmm no thanks.
author: M S.

description: After leaving McCormick and Kuletos in horrible disappointment, we walked down the street to the blue mermaid. They were open late and had amazing food! Not only that, but we told our kind waiter about our previously disappointing night and he gave us a free dessert!! Great place with great drinks! :)
author: Nick L.

description:
I ate here twice while staying at the Argonaut last weekend. The first time, I stopped by for a quick, small lunch. I was really excited to try the "5-time award winning" crab & corn chowder, as I heard Argonaut staff raving about it to anyone and everyone who checked into the hotel.

It was on this fateful day that I realized I'm a complete and total chowder snob. Being from Seattle, I've been eating delicious chowder all my life, and the crab & corn chowder just didn't live up to the hype. That being said, it was still decent soup. Like, something I wouldn't mind eating as an appetizer before an actual meal.

The second time I went to the Blue Mermaid was for breakfast. It was fine.
author: Devany M.

description:
Great food, ambiance and superb service!!

I really liked this place. They are really nice and accommodating here. They have a good sized dining room, it's nice and spacious. 

I had to try the chowder here. So I got the famous crab and corn. It was really good and really rich. the green green onions on top were a nice touch.

The crab cake was good but not really memorable. I liked that it came with a green salad. It was a good dish.

I was really impressed with the kids meal - they offered salmon with steamed veggies. What a great meal this was. They also offered the usual kid favorites. It's nice to see a kids meal that's actually healthy and I wouldn't mind serving.

I'd definitely return to this place again.
author: Chili B.

description: Stumbled upon this place after walking out of another after no service. Service was friendly, decor was fitting, food was good. My mom ordered the clam chowder but received the corn crab instead. Since it was still good she decided not to ask for the correct meal, but she still didn't think it was crab in it. Over all a fine experience.
author: Hal H.

description:
I came here really quick for a bite with my girl friends before we headed back after food. 

We were starving since we had just had a wine tasting ( effects of alcohol,much?) 

They said that their service was quick which it was, but their prices are high! I got the fried appetizer plate with fried shrimp, oysters, calamari and fish. It comes with tartar sauce and cocktail sauce. Nothing special about it but the presentation was really messy. 

My other friends ordered a chowder bread bowl and crab sandwich. The chowder was good but 12 bucks? Wayyyyy too much! And my friend said her crab sandwich reminded her of Tuna..

We just wanted a quick bite to eat and we didn't really care what it was so I guess we just got what we wanted.
author: Joy L.

description: Worst.Service.Ever. We sat for about 15 minutes and no one came to the table and then I went to find a waiter and he was rude and bothered. Finally, they sent a girl over that was crabby and obviously very rushed even though it wasn't busy. She never came back and our drinks were dry. The food was mediocre at best. I've had better food from street vendors. There's a lot of choices in Fisherman's Wharf. I recommend you choose another.
author: Wendy M.

description:
I've read about Blue Mermaid's Award Winning Crab Chowder upon researching my San Francisco trip. So the shellfish addict in me had to cross that off my list of things to try. 

We ordered the award winning crab chowder in a sour dough bread bowl which just isn't fair since I love, love, love sourdough bread. The chowder was absolutely delicious. Infused with flavor, creamy, without being overbearingly thick. The basil oil drizzled on top was a nice touch , bringing the whole dish together. The crab taste was subtle and I would have preferred more crabbiness. 

The Linguini w. Manila Clams was served in a plate overflowing with little tasty morsels tossed in a light, yet garlicky sauce although the linguini was slightly overcooked for my tastes. The garlic sour dough toasts were great at sopping up the leftover sauce. 

Small Seafood Platter for 2 was nothing fancy but a simple dish allowing the sweetness of the shellfish to shine through. Out came a tray with mussels, half a dungeoness crab, a few oysters,& shrimp accompanied by lemons, mignonette and cocktail sauce. When I questioned the waiter about the types of oysters included in the platter he confidently answered 'West Coast Oysters". Um, no shit? They were fresh, perfectly shucked and appropriately briny nonetheless. 

The Caesar salad was quite large, but the cook was heavy handed with the dressing and Parmesan cheese, making it a bit too salty to finish. 

Although it's touristy location may warrant prejudgment on the taste & quality of food to be found here I was quite surprised with the solid seafood dishes utilizing super fresh ingredients. Prices are fair, given its location. San Francisco is gifted with easy access to seafood making this kind of freshness affordable especially for those from NYC that can only get those luxuries with a hefty price. I wouldn't come here looking for anything new or fancy but come to enjoy some of this city's tasty gifts from the sea.
author: Lizz K.

description: Excellent meal.  A little pricey but comparable to others in the area.  Baked crab dip appetizer was superb.   Wife and daughter had the dungeoness crab cakes, and I had the cioppino.    Wife had brown sugar glazed Brussels sprouts which were actually good since I don't care for Brussels sprouts.  Excellent service.    Great way to start our San Francisco vacation.
author: Brian B.

description: The shrimp and corn chowder served in a sour dough bread bowl was outstanding!  Same for the shrimp dip.  A very enjoyable Saturday afternoon lunch. The house Chardonnay complimented the meal well. Michael provided adequate service.
author: Wade H.

description: I'm giving the venue three stars, because I did not order any food from the menu. I made a stop there during a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf. Rudy, the bartender, was very nice, and prepared two very refreshing drinks (Lemon Drop + Cosmopolitan). And, then, there was the Chilean waitress who made me feel relatively uncomfortable. Her random rant about the germs and 'bad' crowd on the 38 bus was unnecessary. Especially, when my itinerary for the following day included taking the 38 to the Golden Gate Bridge.
author: Odaliz R.

description:
I have eaten here twice.  It seems better than all the other super touristy restaurants along the waterfront around Fisherman's Wharf.   

I had the crab sandwich both times which is large and filling, along with a good side salad.  The food was good and seems fresh.  

During my second visit the people at the table next to us broke a salt shaker.  It smashed all over the floor.  Almost all of the staff noticed it when they stepped on it but no one - from the hostess to the bus boy - bothers to pick up even the large pieces of glass.  It sort of made me wonder about the rest of the restaraunt and the cleanliness and attention to detail, if this was the kind of lazy employees that work there.  Anyway, just a thought...
author: Ryan O.

description: Service was fantastic. Food good.  Nice bar and restaurant area. Convenient. Across from wharf.
author: Troy W.

description:
Service was okay. Food was nothing special. We came here upon local recommendation with the advice that clams are never local in SF, just purchased in cans (makes sense), and that this restaurant was good otherwise.

I had the Grilled Alaskan Salmon. It was a relatively small portion sided with diced sausage, beans, corn, etc. But there's no flavor contrast. They could've used less salt on the entire plate. It didn't wow me for the price. We were a party of five, each paying separately by CC. They give you a slip showing an automatic 19% gratuity. My dinner with tax would've been $32. But here's a tip about the tip: you actually get to add your own tip amount to your subtotal and tax! Nice 19% guideline. LOL

My friend had the Mahi Mahi. And while the fish portions she said was good (or that she was hungry), they were small. She finished it amazingly quick. She didn't touch the black rice. I tried it. It was too flavored but not in a unique way. So again no contrast. Texture was weird, too. Not completely satisfying. Her total was also quoted at $32. Ouch. Hopefully she didn't mistakenly add tip on top of that.

Another friend had the Dungeness Crab Cakes. That's plural, so they give you two cakes, each the size of a child's hand. This was what I wanted originally. It sounds good. It comes drizzled with what looks like thousand island dressing, and the plate had some lettuce and diced tomatoes. Maybe they don't do crab well because he said it was just a salty flavor. The menu says it's $3 more than the Salmon.

So those were off their "Wharf Favorites."

Another friend got a seafood sandwich. Maybe a custom order. I don't know. It looked tough (as opposed to tender) for the type of bread. He took his time eating it. He took a long long time. Nice thing was that the waiter made practically any order possible and easy.

Some of us ordered the Crab Chowder as appetizer. It's $9 for what looks like an 8 fl.oz. dish. I didn't get it. But no raving comments. One friend said the texture was odd and that the chowder taste was common. Another friend got the chowder Sampler. It was three little bowls (cupcake size) of three different chowders. Nothing special he said.

I would conclude that this restaurant has only the prime location to attract tourists. Parking is horrible unless you've already committed elsewhere (for the nearby attractions) or next door (hotel). Decor inside the simple front door is distinctive and powerful, but I would not want to eat here again for dinner.

It's not worth it IMO. Maybe their top chef got the night off. IDK
author: Vectoruser I.

description: This is a great casual place for lunch or dinner!  The crab and corn chowder is the best chowder we've ever eaten!!!  And they even gave us the recipe to try it at home sometime. We also enjoyed the fish and chips - the batter was nice and light. Great service and a great casual ambiance - nice location!
author: Michelle H.

description:
I realize when you eat at the Wharf, you need to lower expectations a bit but...

I brought my son here after a day exploring the ships on Hyde Pier. I ordered him a hot dog, yogurt and veggies. The hot dog was pretty nasty - tasted like cheap meat, not the 100% natural beef dogs you see in SF. The veggies were pretty tasty and still a little firm to the touch (the way we like them). The yogurt was from a store, still in the container.

We did have a very friendly waiter who was attentive and sweet to my son. 

I tried to counterbalance the gross hot dog by ordering a scoop of ice cream to go. I gave it to my son in his car seat. A few minutes into the drive he said "Look mommy!" and pulled a piece of thick plastic out of his mouth and showed it to me. It was from the ice cream. It seemed to be from a piece of a dishwasher or something like that. Not happy. It could have been dangerous if he'd swallowed it. Needless to say we now have a "no eating in the car seat" policy thanks to Blue Mermaid.

I will not come back here though I know the staff is doing the best they can with the gross food they are serving.
author: Christina K.

description: This place was amazing!  Bryan was a super friendly waiter, and was helpful.  The garlic roasted crab was amazing, and the atmosphere was incredible!
author: Ryan P.

description: Friendly quick service and great ambience.  Crab corn chowder in sour dough bowl.  Do it!
author: Debra B.

description: The food was pretty good overall. My husband got the crab and corn chowder which was good, but a little cold. I got the salmon, just so you know, they cook their salmon medium here, which means basically uncooked in the middle. I am not a fan of that and they were more than happy to take it back and cook it longer. Their corn succotash that came with it was awesome, but if you don't like strong cheeses, you may not like this, as it had either goat or blue cheese mixed in. All in all the service was good and the food was really pretty good. I would go back.
author: Megan E.

description:
The corn chowder is good. 
The new England chowder had 3 shells in the soup. 
The atmosphere is a little noisy.
author: Tom M.

description: Holy cow, what the hell do they put I their chowder! It's more addictive than heroin! The ocean animals are having an orgy in my mouth!
author: George B.

description:
Good service, seated quickly and got a free glass of wine for checking in....always a good thing.
Cesar salad was good, standard, hubby had the crab chowder...no complaints.
author: Christina S.

description: Great seafood place for the ultimate fishermans wharf experience! Great ambiance and yummy comfort foods. Chowder sampler is great so you can try all of their award winning chowders, dungenness crab salad is yummy and the upside down apple pie for dessert was to die for (it has a candied pecan crust for starters)...all delicious! Definitely recommend  checking it out.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I get that this place is on the Pier, and I can even understand getting mediocre service... but why the mediocre food? 

A friend and I got one entree and split the crab and corn chowder. Our bill was $50. It's not even the price that bothered me, but that both of us wanted a good seafood meal and ended up thinking... 'what are we paying for again?' We ordered the Sea Bass which was dry, and the mashed potatoes which were 'meh'. Nothing was actually bad, but nothing was great. 

I also really wished the bread was warmed up. 

The plus is that the service was good, and our waitress was attentive and polite.
author: Sumina B.

description:
We came on a Monday night, the place was empty.

We were welcomed by Matthew, one of the cheerful waiters. We checked-in on Yelp and got a free glass of Chardonnay (not bad!).

We had the crab cake: fresh but could be more cooked or solid. The salad coming with and the sauce were just perfect.

Then the chicken club: OK-

And the sea food trio: overcooked salmon, and tasteless shrimp :-/

The ambiance and music were great and the service very prompt and friendly!

3.5/5
author: John D.

description:
Will keep this brief with the pros and cons:

Pro:
*chowder - variety to choose from and all quite tasty
*drinks - a little pricey but strong so worth the cost
*location - close by Ghiradelli Square and Pier 39
*check-in deal - free dessert or glass of house wine if you check-in

Con:
I don't really have much to say in terms of bad for this restaurant, except that I think I chose the wrong dish for myself the night I had dinner - wasn't feeling my fish and chips; I did, however, love the mashed potatoes that came with my friend's Seafood Trio dish, and the salmon in that dish was delicious! Everything else was just alright.

Would recommend to anyone looking for chowder at a sit-down restaurant in SF.
author: Wendy Y.

description: Best popcorn shrimp I've ever had!  Otherwise, food was quick and otherwise unremarkable. Pricey for the quality.
author: Andrea D.

description: The rave reviews about the corn chowder are all spot on. The chowder here is the best I've had, certainly the best in SF and even as good or better than in Cape Cod.  The staff was just incredible. We came in for a late lunch and it was 5 minutes before closing but they welcomed us and didn't hurry us at all and they even checked on the chowder to make sure it was fresh. Make time to stop in and get some.
author: Dave P.

description: I worked at the Argonaut Hotel for a week and spent most of meal time here.  Good food, awesome drinks.  Pretty much all San Fran has the same type of  food by the Wharf. But its pretty good.
author: Twanda B.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night with 3 girlfriends around 9pm. Had made a reservation on Open Table, but it wasn't really necessary since there were plenty of booths and tables available. Plus side the hostess let us know we'd get a free appetizer with the Open Table reservation. Service was impeccable, our waiter was attentive, very informative, and also hilarious. 

Everything we ordered was delicious. At first it seemed like the prices were a bit high for such a casual restaurant, but it was so much food the price was completely reasonable. We should have ordered one less entree between the 4 of us.

The fried calamari was very tasty with a surprisingly spicy kick. The bits of asparagus added a nice complement. The linguine with manila clams was amazing. Pasta was cooked perfectly all dente and the sauce was just lovely with a little bit of spice. The plate was just covered in clams, they did not skimp on that like most places and the texture was just perfect. Cioppino was very good; the tomato broth was more creamy than other places I've had it, but I liked it that way. There was just so much seafood in it, enough to probably feed 3 people! Shrimp was tasty, salmon and halibut were good, clams and mussels cooked perfectly, only the calamari was a bit overcooked in the broth. Weird thing was a garlic bread at the bottom soaked in broth (actually pretty tasty). The pan seared scallops were some of the best I've had in a while. Buttery garlicky goodness, and that forbidden rice was just amazing. 

Loved this place. Next time I will need to order less food so I can have room for dessert! The chocolate pot de crème sounded so good!
author: Vi N.

description: Bartender was very kind the day I went in! We has this beautiful coconut piña colada drink! I wanted a rum punch and the bar tender did not know what it was made if and her went to an app to look it up. I appreciated his efforts and tipped his generously!
author: Chloé E.

description: Service was prompt and courteous. The food was excellent. The clam chowder was as good as anything I've had in Bar Harbor Me or Boston mass.
author: Jared B.

description: Blue mermaid has amazing clam chowders! Also, the non-alcoholic tenderloin cocktail was the single most refreshing drink I've ever had!!
author: Kasia O.

description: Probably the very best chowder I've ever had in my life. Get the Dungeness crab and corn chowder, you'll be amazed at how much better it is than anything you've ever tasted before.  Drinks were also above average in execution. Was quite surprised at the quality here.
author: Jeff M.

description:
We ordered fish and chips. The chips were nothing special, and the portion of the fish was small. The Cesar salad came with bagged croutons. The bread pudding was dry and disappointing.
Not what I expected for this price range!
author: Nir G.

description: My original review had docked off two stars because of mediocre customer service that I had experienced at the restaurant. I'm adding one back for the response message from the owner. I do appreciate the follow-up!
author: Jennifer S.

description: We both had the award winning Chowder which really was delicious! The BF had the dungeness crab and I had the Ciopinno. The entrees were fine, not exactly our most favorite but Im sure they were exactly as advertised. I would definitely come back for the chowder!
author: Chandra M.

description:
I like the idea of the Blue Mermaid. Great name and it is attached to an amazing hotel.  I didn't even mind that there wasn't a view because the old building is so cool. I was not ready for so much fried seafood.  It seems that menu is a carbon copy of every seafood place along on any coast. Calamari, shrimp, clams, and fish doesn't always have to be fried.  

I decided to go with the linguini and clams. It was ok. There were a lot more clams than I expected but linguini was oily and not fully cooked. There are so many ways to make seafood without it tasting like a mouth full of flour and oil. If you are going to have a burger on the menu make it amazing. This is a great place to take kids and the service is fantastic.
author: JJ T.

description: In writing this review, I am wondering if we ate in the same restaurant as everyone else who wrote a review here.  Well, for starters, I told the waiter to bring everything out at once, since we were just eating salads, soup and appetizers.  Yet, the crab dip came out first, followed by the rest of the meal a few minutes later.  Next, they brought me the wrong soup...I ordered the Crab and Corn, and they brought out the Clam Chowder.  That's not the worst of it.   The crab dip ordered by my husband was awful.  No lump crab whatsoever, and there was way too much of some flavor we couldn't identify...possibly lemon?  Yet, without that flavor, it would be absolutely bland.  My soup was also bland and also left a bad taste in my mouth.  Lastly, the Caesar salad ordered by my husband was the worst he ever had...no flavor whatsoever, nothing but the bottoms of the Romaine hearts with no leafy greens, and croutons that obviously came from a bag (small and absolutely no seasoning).  Oh, he had a piece of salmon in the salad that also had no seasoning.  Bottom line is that it was the worst $61 (not including tip) we've ever spent on a meal.  Yes, $61 for salads and appetizers.  Wow.
author: Robin G.

description: Beautiful decorations on the inside! Definitely worth at least stopping to look at it everything inside! Vintage barely covers it! The bartender was super friendly, and knowledgeable about the area, he was more than willing to offer up drink selections (and we weren't disappointed!) and than even offered a suggestion for our next bar to visit on our pub crawl!!! After our disappointing stop at the Cannery, this was a perfect stop!
author: Cassie O.

description: Friends recommended this restaurant and we weren't disappointed. Good service and great chowder! Easy to find as well.
author: Bonnie W.

description: Clam chowder and bread bowl were not that good.  The bread bowl could break a tooth!  Clam chowder had lots of potato in it for filler.  Wine was good.  Service was excellent!  Expensive for quality of food.
author: Misty S.

description:
If you go to Blue Mermaid for breakfast, take it from me and DO NOT order oatmeal.  It's yucky... I coveted my husbands quiche (which was quite the opposite of yucky).  

I'm not a huge fan of fish usually, so most of the items on the menu don't really appeal to me, but I do have to say that the crab and corn chowder is much better than the chowder from Boudin's down the street....
author: Christina S.

description:
Took my family to the Blue Mermaid for breakfast this morning after spending the night at the Argonaut Hotel. The restaurant was moderately busy with several vacant tables when we arrived.  After placing our order, we waited another ten minutes to get glasses of water. Our food was delivered to our table and the waiter turned abruptly and left without offering ketchup or any other sauces. After waiting several
 minutes for him to come back, my daughter had to get up and go across the restaurant, find our waiter, and ask him for ketchup, butter, and jam for our toast. Food was passable, however house potatoes were rather chewy.  Finally, I was able to get a second cup of coffee after being seated approximately 40 minutes. Very disappointing service, especially when this restaurant is connected to a first class establishment, the Argonaut Hotel!
author: Mike D.

description: Supposedly "the best" clam chowder, though of course now that I'm including it in my review it's going to perpetuate this in the search results. It's fine. It's not the authentic New England clam chowder, unless they got my order wrong. But it's good chowder and the atmosphere is very nice. We went during happy hour, so it was $20 for two cups of chowder and two glasses of wine, which is a pretty great deal.
author: Mea H.

description: Had the Tuna BLT and the crab and corn chowder and it was amazing! Good price and nice atmosphere
author: Bruna S.

description:
I enjoyed my cioppino and chowder trio. 

Salmon was greasy. 

Food slightly over priced.

We received terrible and excellent service. We arrived at opening time for dinner. Waited several minutes to be seated even though restaurant empty and plenty of staff around. 

When we were seated, we waited 20 mins... still no service (we had two toddlers too) We ordered our drinks at bar, then politely asked for service. 

Another server came to our rescue. She was apologetic and attentive. A few moments later our actual server arrived to apologize. He explained it was very busy. Umm, no it wasn't. He had previously walked past our table numerous times and never said 'thanks for waiting, I'll be with you in a moment' etc. Perhaps the server was having a bad day. It can happen. 

By end of meal our kids were fractious because they had been waiting so long.
author: S B.

description:
Decent food, horrible service. My husband and I ate here because we were staying at the Argonaut hotel which is connected to the restaurant. We figured we'd give it a try. My water glass sat empty for quite a while. Our waiter was nowhere to be found. I had to get the attention of another waiter to get a water refill. I got the fish and chips - very greasy and lots of fish bones still in the fish. The garlic fries were really good. The crab and corn chowder was good but under-seasoned. My husband got the seafood trio - he said the best part of his dinner was the mashed potatoes. He was very disappointed with the actual seafood portion. Surprising, considering this restaurant is in Fisherman's Wharf. 

Upon checking out of the hotel, we noticed a $130 restaurant charge to our room on the hotel receipt. We had only eaten there once during our stay and paid with a credit card. The restaurant manager was hassling the hotel clerk about removing the erroneous charge. Oddly, the charge was dated for the same day we had eaten there but over double what we paid. My husband even provided proof of the charge to our credit card. The clerk had to convince the manager that it was an error, we paid with our card, we didn't eat twice in the same night, etc... It took a while but they finally removed the charge. What a hassle! If I visit San Francisco again, I definitely won't be eating here again.
author: Jessica M.

description: Recently returned for another meal- I enjoyed the house salad with herb vinaigrette.. almost like a very light pesto dressing.  This was really good. My New England clam chowder was a little watery this time around.. and the bread wasn't as fresh (we were there at 6pm). The calamari was spicy and had a great kick to it... but was too chewy. Marinara for dipping calamari was also delicious, which just added to the disappointment of the chewiness. Overall I am a little less enchanted with B.M. but I still recommend it highly for a 'wharf restaurant'.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I was here with a good friend about 8 months ago after having a "touristy" day at the Wharf and in the city. I wanted to go to a place with good food and not your typical expensive tourist trapand this place hit the spot. 

Great service, great food, great prices. 

Definitely a fan!
author: Treena F.

description: I honestly love clam chowder... but next time I will stick with Boudin's. Nice interior setting and they do have good drinks.
author: Olia M.

description: This place embarrasses me. I feel like I should apologize to all the out of towners who come here and think this is what fresh seafood in San Francisco is supposed to be.  I recently ordered the combination appetizer and with the exception of point Reyes oysters it was obvious the rest was frozen rubbery fishy slop probably from China. Service was lacking and the wine by the glass had been open for several days. So many better places,  skip this one for sure!
author: Mike H.

description: Worth the visit.  Food was fabulous.  We sat outside.  My 7-year-old daughter ordered salmon off the children's menu.  Love that they offer kids salmon.  My oldest son enjoyed a tuna b-l-t.  Service was great, place is clean, amidst the bustling Fisherman's wharf area.  Prices were reasonable.  Would definitely return.
author: Joanne H.

description:
The food is good, but the service is horrible! 

The waiter was not very friendly and awkward, it took 10 minutes of standing before anyone even acknowledged us at the front door. Our drink order didn't get taken first, we were just supposed to order drinks with our meal I guess... Then it took about 20 minutes until I had to ask about them before our drinks even came out.

They were very receptive to a big party last minute though, so that was a plus. I'd probably give them another shot.
author: Allen V.

description: Disappointing. Spouse and I had linguini with clams. Well, I did. Spouse got a plate of linguini piled with empty shells. Sauce was flavorless and needed salt. Oh, and it took 20 min for the waiter to bring this underwhelming meal to us. Not worth the price.
author: Santo C.

description: The bread bowl crab chowder wasn't that good at all. The bread was too doughy and didn't taste good. I was very disappointed since they had signs saying they had great chowder.
author: Mike N.

description:
Ok. Sorry. But this place is over priced and underwhelming. We had reservations and still had to wait while there were open tables. Then someone came up and asked us to wait in the lobby as if we were in the way. While understandable, It was very rude. The service was friendly but the food was mediocre.  

I got the seafood trio, Salmon, prawns, and crab cake. The salmon was dry and flavorless, the 'prawns' were small and overcooked, and the crab cake was - meh.  This 'famous' chowder was thin and watery. Not impressed. 

My husband got the steak and was likewise unimpressed.

Also, you can only get the half crab as an appetizer with no accompaniments. So we had to order an additional side for one of our party.  At MP you could throw in some french fries.  overall, just another overpriced tourist trap.
author: Michelle R.

description:
This is the best clam chowder I have ever had.  It's also the best crab and corn chowder I've ever had (it hurts to even write this because I'm craving it so badly!).  I can't say much for the food aside from the soups (though I did have a bite of the kids  grilled cheese and it was exceptional), but really do you need more?  Definitely try the 3 soup sampler!

If I go to The City and don't eat here, I usually leave a little heartbroken.
author: Jen E.

description: Waited for over ten minutes and still no service. Said something to waiter, still no service.This place blows.
author: glen f.

description: Food tasted good, but it was wayyy too salty. Fruit was a little too ripe for me. Disappointed that they also don't serve chowder until afternoon.
author: Liwei Y.

description:
This place is right in the heart of touristy restaurants and still delivers something special for this local. This place touts the award winning chowder - and it's true! Try the choice of 3 deal.The other food is excellent too. My friends loved the Cioppino, the Mahi with black rice is so tasty. The crab cakes are great too. The drinks are strong. The ambiance is loud - great for groups. Skip the Oysters - they are not worth the money.
The reason this doesn't get 5 stars is that I am a local and love their food, but the ambiance is touristy. I have been their 3 times and I never see the same server staff or patrons. If it had the local feel too - perfection!
author: Dusty S.

description: We stopped here after taking a VERY cold cable car ride and ran inside to have some chowder. We were NOT disappointed! As an appetizer we ordered the baked crab dip which was phenomenal! Our entrees included two chowder samplers, a bread bowl, and an order of fish and chips. We had the Crab and corn chowder, New England clam, sausage and mussel, and the California chowder. All were extremely delicious!
author: Kristen D.

description: The chowder is amazing!  A must, even on a warm sunny day.  Courteous and pleasant servers and don't forget the cocktails.  Sit outside with a Bloody Mary.  They do it right!
author: Candace S.

description: Went here for breakfast, service is excellent and the food is really good.
author: Leonard L.

description: Had a great time at the Blue Mermaid!  The area is touristy, but the food, drinks, and service here were excellent!  The soup sampler was a delicious way to avoid making decisions. The cocktails were unique and tasty. Also special thanks to our server, Stahl, who steered us in all the right directions with menu selections, and was a ton of fun!
author: Holly D.

description:
*3.5 stars*
Decided to drop in for their award winning chowder since I was in the area. I was going solo so I sat by the bar. The waitress/bartender was nice and provided prompt service. 

Of course, I had to order their New England chowder which came with a few clams in shells (uncommon from my experience). That was a nice touch. It came with delicious morsels of clams and potatoes however, I found the chowder a bit on the salty side. That was disappointing. Maybe I just chose the wrong chowder to have (they have a number of them available).
author: Tanya N.

description: We just had the mussels appetizer. It came with a mildly spicy tomato based broth and was very good. Service was cordial and swift.
author: Jim P.

description:
My #1 pet peeve-if you just brought me my appetizer 3 minutes ago, why in the hell are you bringing my entree?!? The wait staff needs to learn 'timing'. Ugh... 

It's so worth it just to come to the city to try the sampler. 3 different chowders for $12. I had the crab & corn chowder. I can see why they've won awards for it...amazing! I should have got a bowl to go. Also ordered the steamed mussels as an appetizer. Very fresh & great sauce. 

Now my entree was a little bit on the weak side. I had the salmon with mashed potatoes and veggies. Salmon was over cooked. Veggies tasted frozen & potatoes came out cold. In all fairness the manager overheard me and brought me some fresh ones. They weren't that much better.  

Bottom line...I will be returning but strictly for the chowder only! ~.~
author: Bree S.

description:
Good food but small portions.
The Manhattan clam chowder was delicious with a decent portion of clams and vegetables.
The crab was perfectly cooked.
author: G C.

description: Me and 3 other friends went there on a Friday night bcos we've heard that they have the best chowder in town. The place was busy when we got there around 9, our waiter(Parry) was nice and friendly and seemed very knowledgeable. Our food were great! I loved their fried calamari and the chowder was exquisite! We ordered the Trio, Mahi Mahi, Seabass and Cioppino. My main dish was great and perfect portion, fresh seafood and very tastie! Manager(Josh) came by our table to make sure our experience was great! Recommend!!
author: Tanasan S.

description:
Two years later and the Crab & Corn Chowder is still MONEY!!!!!!  The mussels were still delicious too!!

Goddamn, I love this place.  Wish I could have gotten two more bowls before I left the city!
author: Lindsey B.

description:
I work in the area around the hotel so have been to lunch here many times.  food is average but service is usually pretty good.
Last night I needed to have a quick meeting with a colleague from out of the area and suggested we meet at the the Blue Mermaid bar.  We arrived about 5:15 and all the seats at the bar were occupied.

We sat at a table and could not get anyone to serve us despite have many servers pass us by.  I finally flagged down a waitress who told us  we should stand at the bar to get a drink.

After getting a couple of drinks - and having a 30 minute discussion we were approached by the manager and told that we would have to leave as they reserved the tables for customers who are ordering food.  I looked around and half the tables were empty!  seriously.  

 this is San Francisco and the restaurant business is competitive.  find another place who actually values the customer - believe me there are LOTS of them.
author: Jill B.

description: Terrific bar and wonderful food. Try the crab and corn chowder.
author: Taci S.

description: The New England Clam Chowder bread bowel was delicious and the service was excellent.
author: Sarah R.

description:
This place was just OK. I got the three-in-one chowder sampler and all three weren't  that stellar. I went with some friends so we all tried the chowder on a chilly December night, and everyone had the same reaction - kinda forgettable. 

BUT, I do have to say their customer service was outstanding - they honored the yelp coupon, even though we didn't meet the minimum cost requirement for our meals. Also, a friend got some (white) wine spilled on him and the manager promptly came over to the table, apologized and gave him her card so that the restaurant would pay to have his pants dry-cleaned. Now THAT'S customer service.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Admittedly, I've never been inside the restaurant.  I live in San Francisco, so why would I go to Fisherman's Wharf to spend a small fortune (Fisherman's Wharf) for what's probably mediocre food (again, Fisherman's Wharf), most of which I can't even eat (being one of those no-meat sorts).  

So why 5 stars, you say?  Last night I was going on the beloved FW-as-a-ghost-town super late night walk with the dogs (and my gf and her brother) and as we walked by, lo and behold! they were blasting T. Rex's "20th Century Boy" through the speakers.  Now, it's a lovely late night walk, but not the place you expect to hear Marc Bolan come at you like a much welcomed ghost.  Dean Martin?  Sure.  The Doors?  Yeah, drunk tourists looking for an outdated SF love them.  But Bolan?!  

So, while I have no experience with the food or interior (snarkiness aside, it may be good - I really don't know), I can say their choice of music if phenomenal.  So if you're staying in the area and want to eat at a restaurant that may be great, and is surely as good as any in the dreaded Fisherman's Wharf, with some fantastic music for your dining enjoyment, try the Blue Mermaid.
author: Ces Gens-Là Z.

description: As a guest at the Argonaut Hotel, I found it convenient to check out this restaurant.  The Mermaid Chowder house was delightful.  The nautical décor was tastefully done (not kitschy), the service was perfect and my food was yummy.  Their house specialty is their Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder, so of course I had to try a cup.  It was yummy.  I followed my soup with fish and chips, sans the chips, since I substituted fries with a salad.  The waiter was glad to accommodate all of my special requests.  The restaurant was clean, and not overrun with noisy tourists so that was a bonus too.
author: Courtney K.

description:
While staying at the Argonaut Hotel for a wedding last fall, I had a craving for dungeness crab. Granted I'd already had the garlic crab two or three times on that vacation, but this time around I had a hankering for it in unadulterated steamed form. Since Blue Mermaid was connected to the hotel lobby, it was an easy decision to head there and quell my craving.

If there's anything I learned about San Francisco on that trip, it was that most places in the city that serve seafood do it so right. I suppose an argument can be made that it's hard to mess up steamed crab, but given how much crab I consume in a calendar year, I can tell you that there are certainly ways to screw it up. No crab I consumed in SF had that issue, and Blue Mermaid was no exception. In fact, they did it so right that I came back the next night and had the garlic crab, which was fantastic and very different from the garlic crab I'd had earlier on the trip. Their version was much less messy, as it wasn't in a garlic sauce but instead had actual garlic pieces cooked with it, a touch I really liked since I felt it showcased the crab better.

As for their other dishes, the award-winning Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder was really delicious: It had a home-style comfort-food feeling to it without being too heavy. Their Seafood Cioppino was a bit thicker than other cioppinos, and it had huge pieces of shellfish, which showcased the seafood without taking away from the depth of the broth. My experience with the service may be a little biased, as my boyfriend really hit it off with our waiter and ended up having a few beers with him after he got off shift. From what I could tell with the other waiters though, the service is decent.

Blue Mermaid follows the nautical feel of the Argonaut, and while the decor is appropriate it also rings as very touristy. I imagine that local SF-ers aren't too keen on ever stopping by this place, but if you're ever in the neighborhood and you like seafood, I think it's worth a stop. I will certainly recommend it to my friends who plan a trip to SF and staying in the Fisherman's Wharf area.
author: Leizl M.

description: The supposed award winning crab and corn chowder left me NOT wanting more. To top it all off, my fiance ordered the typical New England clam chowder, not only was it average but at the bottom of the bowl, she found a surprise...a long single strand of hair. Waitress asked if we found it in the soup...basically asking if we didn't put it in there ourselves. I whispered to the waitress because I didn't want to cause a scene, it happens...but in the end, she charge me for the bowl of New England that had in it. Why didn't I ask to get the bowl charge taken off? I took it out of her tip instead...so I guess we're even.
author: Kit T.

description: Delicious food!  Had the clam chowder in a bread bowl.  The service was fast and friendly.  The dining room was clean, spacious and quiet.  We could have sat outside, but it was 4th of July and a noisy band was playing across the street, otherwise their patio seating seemed very nice.
author: S B.

description: Crab and corn chowder is one of their signature items so I tried that. Might as well have been a decent corn and potato chowder, there wasn't much crab in there and it didn't taste like crab. Platters neighboring tables got looked like better options.
author: Dave C.

description: Came to San Francisco for the weekend and stumbled across this place for lunch. I really wish we kept on walking a bit further but our feet were tired and our mouths were thirsty. So that brings us to the blue mermaid. Sat outside for lunch and was set on some good old sourdough bread that never came to the table. Ordered a apple martini which they could not make so settled for a margarita. Should have walked across to the Mexican bar for that cuz this was a sad margarita that was served to me half full and all ice. After showing the waitress our drinks her remark was that's how the bartender makes them ok well for 14 bucks I better get a full glass. She does nothing. We ordered calamari to start I have had better. Then I get the clam chowder in bread bowl and a Cesar salad. The soup was ok the bread was stale and the salad was flavorless. For $104 bucks for lunch not including tip I should have had a much better experience. Keep on walking there is much better down the block. Sorry blue mermaid I really wanted to enjoy my time with you but didn't.
author: Michelle Z.

description: Went here based on previous reviews. Crab dip and corn clam chowder were amazing. Fish and chips were good but nothing memorable. Server was friendly but I felt neglected sitting outside. We weren't even given cutlery (I ended up taking them from another empty table). Also there was a person in the restaurant begging for money. All the waiters ignored him. Maybe this is a common occurrence here but it made for a less enjoyable meal.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
Rundown
- Chowda' Review below
- They have to-go's if you go to the bar
- California Chowder had a nice kick to it
- New England Chowder was a bit salty
- Bread bowl was ok

I had about an hour to kill in/near fisherman's warf while my friend was swimming in the aquatic park.  I really didn't want to sight see, so I decided to get some calm chowder in a bread bowl and watch the crazy people swim in the freezing water.  

I didn't want to walk far and I really wasn't in the mood for Boudin, so I headed to his place.  The reviews seemed decent and I went in to give it a try.  

I ordered the New England Clam Chowda while the other half ordered the California Chowda' in a bread bowl.  Both were decent.  The New England version was a bit too salty but was decent in flavor.  However, the California Chowder was much tastier and had a nice spicy flavor to it.  I wish I got that instead.  

I really could have passed on the bread bowl.  Stale, chewy and not very good.  

Would I come back?  Only if I had to wait for my friend at the aquatic park.  :)
author: Jenn S.

description: The corn & crab chowder has won an award... The best i've eaten. The crab cake is delicious too. But don't order the shrimps cocktail: 5 too cold shrimps with 2 leaves of lettuce is way too much expensive for what it is. Oh and I recommend the chocolate pot de crème for desert with an excellent whipped cream.
author: Aurélie S.

description: Now, I don't know what y'all that gave this place a bad review got, but what we got was absolutely incredible. We ordered the treasure chests, and each got the Dungeness & Corn Chowder and I had the Fish & Chips and the misses had the Clam Linguini. Completely fricking awesome. Just too good. We were there around 4 to 5 pm and our server was on target. I look forward to trying all of their food.
author: Steven H.

description: Staff was attentive, atmosphere was great. Ordered the whole garlic steamed crab and loved it.
author: Amanda C.

description: I had the albacore tuna melt which was excellent and my wife had the Dungeness crab and corn chowder and Asian salad with crab added which was also excellent.  Return stop for sure.
author: Mark M.

description:
Made the mistake of bringing my family here while they visited from out-of-town.

The food itself isn't horrible, but is far from remarkable. The real fault of the restaurant, however, is the horrendous service. Following our meal, I found myself apologizing for the experience and assuring my very easy-to-please parents that the service was not representative of a typical San Francisco experience.
author: andrew m.

description:
Really great popcorn shrimp appetizer.

Clam chowder was skimpy on the clam.

Salmon was amazing.

My drink, Captain's Quest was tasty but nothing totally amazing. My BFs was a mojito, first came out ultra sweet so we sent it back (it was $10!!!) and requested easy on the brown sugar. When it came back it was amazing!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Service was slow but chowder trio was well worth the wait.  Hands down blue crab and corn chowder was the best. A dish I would certainly make a return trip for.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Crab & corn chowder was delicious! Stopped for a midday snack, sat at at the bar. Bartender was nice & friendly. Anchor Stream beer perfect accompaniment.
author: Vici K.

description: Their bloody mary's are okay! That's all I can tell you.
author: Luke M.

description:
Clam Chowder Bread Bowl FTW!!

Wasn't too busy for the time of day.  Sitting at the bar didn't increase our service.  Maybe they were short staffed.

Thankfully the food was awesome.
author: Brooks S.

description: Stopped here for a quick seafood platter with complimentary wine on the house with my friend after walking the wharf. Seafood was pretty good, but I didn't think it was exceptionally spectacular. Service was prompt and very friendly. A good choice for a quick seafood snack I would say.
author: Hui L.

description:
This is in at Fishermen's Wharf the touristy part of SF, but since we were in the area and heard about their #1 award winning chowder we decided to try it.

They have a bar area and plenty of tables inside & outside.  We sat inside since it was raining and cold.

FREE bread w/ butter after ordering.  I thought the bread was cold & just ok, butter was ok too.

Dishes we tried:

Dungeness crab & corn chowder $8.50 a bowl.  I thought it tasted like it was from a can, too much corn & potatoes, and I didn't see or taste any Dungeness crab.  A bag of crackers given w/ the chowder.  I thought it tasted a bit stale.

Steamed mussels $10.95 - 2 toasted piece of bread were fine and lots of mussels in a salty broth w/ tomatoes, garlic, etc.  Pretty good.

French fries $5 - huge plate of garlic fries, hubby liked.

Our total $41.45 + $3.52 tax = $44.97 Before tip.

Separate bathrooms in the hotel next door.

If you're from out of town & you're in the area maybe try it.
author: Ann L.

description: A lesser noticed gem in the midst of overpriced tourist traps. Super delicious cioppino.
author: Jaimee J.

description: My mom is staying at the hotel connected to this chowder house and bar. The staff here is always friendly and attentive to any needs. Dungness crab and corn chowder is AMAZING!!!! My stepfather said this was the best clam chowder he has had yet in SF. Their crab cakes are also very delicious. The red pepper gives it great flavor. Salad that comes with it is nice and light vinagarette.
author: Melissa B.

description:
Found this place by accident as we walked down from Lombard Street...Found out the chef had won some chowders cook offs-so we tried.  

The waiter recommended the crab and corn chowder-and it did not disappoint.  I would recommend this chowder to all of my friends....plus a glass of Anchor Steam.

Service was quick and personable.
author: James P.

description:
Six of us went to Blue Mermaid in SF to get some crab. The cauldrons on Fisherman's Wharf were already closed, otherwise we'd be eyeball deep in buttery crabby goodness with a can of beer in a bag.

Much to our dismay, they were out of crab!! Disappointed.

However, the drinks were creative, good & strong.

4 of the 6 guys got the Seafood Cioppino which they all loved. I got the mussels, which were delish, and the last fella, who is just starting to eat seafood after a lifetime of loathing, got the salmon, which he truly enjoyed.

Most of us also got the California chowder, which was pretty good.

Can't say as I'd go back or go looking for the place upon a return visit, but it was a decent meal.
author: Jenn R.

description:
My favorite was the California Chowder.
My husband and I always go here twice
on our visits to our favorite city!  
Delish!  The Fish and Chips are great!
author: Robyn A.

description:
I came here with a few people since we'd used a wine-tasting certificate for the Winery Collective, down the block. I am a local, not a tourist. I was going to recommend someplace else to my group, but everyone seemed fine going here so I just went along. They had an outside table and it was a gorgeous day, so i was happy with that, alone. I was actually pleasantly surprised. The food we had was quite good. Granted, we went pretty simple. Two shared oysters to start and seemed very happy. Two had cracked crab (how do you mess that up?) and 2 of us had crab roll sandwiches. Again - pretty basic, but pretty yummy. Since it is not crab season here, they get the crabs from the Seattle area. We had trouble deciding on which wine to order and they kindly brought us a few to try, even though, since we'd just gone wine tasting, one friend and I were just planning to split a glass. I also checked in on 4 square, which got us a pretty good apple pie dessert. It was not the best I've ever had, but it did the trick.

Overall, I was impressed by their service - especially for a touristy place that does not rely on repeat business. And I would even go back for the food. Granted, I did not try anything that involved a lot of actual cooking, but I would consider it...
author: Dana L.

description: My Honey and kids treated me to lunch here for Mother's Day yesterday and I'm so glad they chose here! Food was super yummy, servings were huge, Bloody Mary's were GREAT, and the famous chowder was all it was expected to be and more. The service was excellent, the restaurant itself was comfortable and relaxed and the TVs at the bar were showing different sports channels that kept us entertained while we silently grubbed. The location is nice, too, because there's a parking garage right behind the restaurant, and it's at the end of the "strip", so once we finished eating, we took off walking the warf and were able to make a straight shot of it without missing anything. We'll definitely be going back!
author: Malissa D.

description: I wanted a clam chowder bowl all day being a tourist in san fransico. Saw people eating delicous bread bowls here in the window and decided to eat here. We got seated right away and ordered pretty quick. Crab cake app came out after about 7 minutes... decent. Then 45 minutes later waiter comes by saying I just missed the breadbowls by a few minutes and asked if I wanted a bowl of chowder with a slice of bread. Um no. I drove to s.f. wanted to eat this. Husband got swordfish. Was ok. So mad then manager came and said we will comp u if u want a bowl of chowder.  So mad I would have just walked to another restaurant but my husband just got his dinner. I got a cup of chowder. ..so mad and wont be back. They could have told us 45 minutes ago and we wouldnt have stayed. Manager wad decent though and gave us 50% off our meal.  I would have gave one star if not for the manager giving us the discount.
author: Sasha W.

description: Really good, but a little over priced...crab chowder is awesome. I would come back, but not going to be my go-to seafood place in Fisherman's Wharf
author: James G.

description: Excellent lunch! We had the Chowder Sampler (the crab and clam chowder is award-winning, and the sausage & mussel chowder was excellent as well, only the New England chowder was so-so); the Seafood Trio Sampler (amazing with a crab cake, salmon and shrimp skewer); the Cioppino (spicy with an huge amount of seafood including an enormous crab leg); and the Ahi Tuna BLT (our first foray of tuna with bacon, which we will definitely do again!).  Good service too.  I typically hate going to the wharf area as its usually a tourist trap with overpriced and underwhelming food.  But my parents were in town and this is where they wanted to go.  It was still expensive, but at least it was worth it!
author: Stephanie P.

description: An excellent place to revive and / or people watch and enjoy the weather and feeling you can only obtain in San Francisco.  There food is excellent.  I almost always have breakfast here.  Very good, down to earth excellent food and staff!
author: Anthony R.

description: I had the "famous crab and corn breadbowl" and being a chowder breadbowl fanatic, I was let down. The caesar sald was not very good and the chowder did not wow me. Also, as per the rest of the businesses in the area the service left much to be desired.
author: Michael B.

description:
Service was TERRIBLE.  We waited over 30 minutes to even get our drinks.  At this point heard another server apologizing for the wait because they "had to catch the end of the game."

The food was okay, but way overpriced.  Chowder was the way to go.
author: Mollie S.

description: A great happy hour at the bar and fun nautical decorations made this place a great spot to kick back after checking out touristy stops along the pier. The ginger/mint tea was so fabulous as was the herb dressing for the side salad! The server was sweet and accommodating to my food allergies. Loved getting a free glass of wine for checking in with Yelp. The entrees are pretty pricy, but the "Treasure Chest" deal came with a drink and salad or chowder making it less painful.
author: MacKensie G.

description:
This review has nothing to do with service or restaurant ambiance as I ordered my meal via hotel room service.

The Blue Mermaid's cab and corn chowder in a sourdough bread bowl is not to be missed! This was fantastic chowder with tons of crab, corn, potatoes, and even some asparagus! It was hearty, warm and filling - complete comfort food on a chilly night. Try to control yourself and not eat the entire bread bowl - you'll probably thank yourself later for holding back a bit. 

$10 if I recall right - maybe not such a deal but I'd do it again without hesitation - I'm not sure I've had better chowder anywhere.
author: Amy H.

description: When we first arrived it took a little long to get our drinks, but our waitress was excellent. Due to the accidental wait, we received for four people, clam chowder of our choice on her, as well as desert at the end of out meal. The cioppino was outstanding! The absolute best i have ever had. As was the crab and corn chowder. Overall great restaurant.
author: Adam H.

description: The food here was good, but a bit overpriced. Service was fair and the atmosphere was nice. Definitely get the award winning clam chowder and the garlic French fries. Those were delicious.
author: Taylor B.

description: Just had the Crab and Corn Chowder for dinner with a beer and it was the best meal I had all week.
author: Mike M.

description: Their crab and corn chowder was good.  That was all I got.  I wish I had a bit more, though.  I had the chowder in a bread bowl.  There wasn't much chowder in there.  Someone else got just the bowl and she had more soup than I did.  The regular bowl is cheaper, too.  Just something to think about!  They give you some sourdough bread to snack on as well.  I guess you could always dig your own hole into the sourdough bread and fill it up with chowder.  That's kind of weird, though.
author: Gary L.

description:
I can't believe I took so long to Yelp.  I made reservations for Father's day this past June and my fiance and I took my dad, and his mom and dad. I was expecting a great place!!  I know it was Father's Day and a busy day, but they screwed up so much, took so long, asked for condiments, had to walk to another table to get it, gave me the wrong bill and when I discovered this, I called when I got home and spoke with some guy "JOSH PORTER" who said they would refund my card $25. I called back a week later because they never honored the refund.  We spent over $170 here!!!

I left 2 messages and no one ever called. I only remembered to YELP because the receipt is STILL sitting on my desk!!! OMG!  I'm so upset with this place. The food was good, but the SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!!!!
author: Amanda R.

description: Ate here 3 times while staying at the Argonaut Hotel.. everything was awesome, affordable, and everyone was nice! The popcorn-shrimp appetizer was amazing... almost enough for a entree, red skin potatoes were awesome, shells and cheese as well.
author: Monica G.

description:
3.5 stars

Good service, good food. We had breakfast: crab omelet, Belgian waffle, two egg breakfast. It was all good, but nothing out of the ordinary. 

However it was expensive! I know is because not only it is a hotel restaurant but is San Francisco. Still, $11.00 for a regular size Belgian waffle with a little whipped cream and strawberries?? Yikes!
author: Yara V.

description: Far exceeded my expectations as the restaurant connected to the Argonaut. We ate here several times during our stay and each meal was very good. The servers were all helpful and breakfast, lunch and dinner were equally good.
author: Evan M.

description: I loved the New England clam chowder in a bread bowl! I've had clam chowder at basically every restaurant that served it, and this one is certainly a good choice. I also tasted a chicken bacon sandwich which was great. The apple cobbler dessert with ice cream was ok, but I wouldn't ever get it again. The service was a bit slow, but I would willingly come back here for some more clam chowder. Good stuff.
author: Justin W.

description:
All around awesome. We got there a little early from our reservation time, and asked for a booth. The host told us we could go to the wine bar in the next room and said he'd come get us when a booth opened up. Our waiter was super chill and fun to talk to. 

Everything we ordered was amazing. Chowder sampler, seafood platter, side of asparagus, and champagne oyster shooters because it was Valentine's Day. Berry cobbler for dessert, with rum tiramisu and cappuccinos to drink. All of that and a beer and soda came out to $100.

The only downside is they printed the Healthy San Francisco tax/fee on the receipt which marred an otherwise wonderful dinner. Keep politics off the receipt and just raise the prices of the menu instead.
author: Monica D.

description: While in San Fran for a short business trip we knew we had to meet up with some local friends. They said we should meet at this place, though they'd never tried but loved the name. We saw immediately what we wanted on the menu although we still had to wait for our friends to arrive.  We decided to share the Dungeness crab cakes with a red pepper aioli dressing and a bread bowl of their award winning Dungeness crab and corn chowder. They both came out looking amazing and the crab cakes were an absolute delight. Not too much breading and the aioli was a perfect additional twist to the dish. The crab and corn chowder bisque/soup is something I've been dreaming about since that night. Seriously cannot stop thinking about how amazing this was. Creamy but not too thick and bursting with crab and a delish green onion hint at the end, just writing about it is making my mouth water. We considered eating there at every other mealtime we had after that night but decided we should maybe try some new spots.  We tried severally other crab and corn chowders while there and none were as good as this place. Highly recommend. Service is fast and friendly and we loved the location inside the old dole fruit canning factory cool story! Check it out
author: Moe M.

description: We're staying at the Argonaut hotel. We've eaten here 3 out of 4 days. Good food, lots of options, friendly staff, great service, reasonably priced for the area. I had Steele cut oats and veggie quiche (I'm vegetarian), husband had eggs, bacon, potatoes, sausage, son had oatmeal, chocolate pastry, all very good.
author: K W.

description: Awesome food. The  crab & corn chowder was amazing, best ever! And Brian our waiter, was super accommodating!! Great time!!
author: Lisa R.

description: Calamari was great! It also had fried asparagus in it. The corn and crab was fantastic and the clam chowder was awesome! The service was wonderful.
author: Nancy S.

description: Stopped by on a whim, loved the apple pie said it was the best ever had.  I had 3 clam chowders and they were all different flavors, very impressed.  We didn't stay long or eat a lot, but service was great and I would recommend to anyone to stop by and try
author: Marc M.

description: Awesome food & service! Not the best fish and chips, but good still and the chowder was great!
author: Aliyah H.

description: Excellent staff and food. Had the Dungeness crab omlette, didn't skimp on the crab with big, flakey chunks that were not overly' flavorful' if you know what I mean. Hubby ordered the eggs Benedict and was very pleased. We arrived late Sunday morning and only had to await a short time for a table. Very pleased.
author: Lexi K.

description: After our wine tasting next door at the Winery Collective we decided to get some seafood grub to hold us over.  We did drink a lot so what did we get? Tons of fried food and bread...what every drunk girl needs.  We ordered popcorn shrimp, fries, oysters, and calamari.  All was gone within minutes...we were kinda floored how fast we ate..but did help us sober up fast.  One thing was that the place didn't seem to crowded that day and yet service (although wished my friend a happy bday and got us ice cream) was served in a downer kinda mood.  I'm not one to care for a smile with my order but don't pout either.  Nonetheless good quick bite to eat if you're in the area.
author: Kim D.

description:
With a name that incorporates the words Chowder House, you would think the chowder to just knock your socks off... but alas, it didn't. 

Okay, having lived in New England (the home of the chowder as we know it in America) for six years... and Seattle (the seafood capital of the lower 48) for four years, my bar may have been set abnormally high... but still... the chowder was watery and the shell fish lacking (which may have been a blessing since I'm actually allergic to shellfish, but that's a whole 'nother story). The point is, I was unimpressed. 

I had the Dungenness Crab and Corn... which is supposedly award winning, but didn't seem all that.... May be it's a fresh pot (chowders are always better at the end), but the veggies were hard and flavorless, and there wasn't much crab. I was equally unimpressed with Drew's New England chowder. However, the waiter was undeterred, and brought a small cup of the California Chowder over for us to test out. Yeah... it's better, but not so much that I'd come back. 

For dinner, I had the seafood trio... the shrimp was okay... a bit overcooked, the crabcake is nothing to write home to mom about, but the Salmon was pretty good. 

All and all a very mediocre food experience.... at least the service was good.
author: Charlie L.

description: There is a rare occasion that I would give a place negative stars if I could but this place? If I could, I would. TRY AT YOUR OWN RISK! Either the people doing these stellar reviews are friends of employees, or maybe they are locals who get treated well because they come again and again. Us? Oh, ya know, we are the tourists who walk in from the hotel and will tip you 20-25- or even 30% if you do a stellar job. Yep, you read that right. But the night we dined here was a night that was not even worthy of the tip we left, out of being nice people who are Catholic-guilted internally into tipping even for bad service. Our experience here from the word go was downright awful. It looks cute from the outside and we are chowder fans (still going back to Connie & Ted's many times over as a result), so after reading the five star reviews here, we thought this place was a must do since we were staying next door. Oh no, no... no... no! Do not do it. There are a bajillion restaurants in San Francisco and this is not one of the best, or even one of the mediocre ones. We walked in from the hotel side. A bar back, the person who we later learned was the manager (we think, she disappeared later too), and two waiters saw us... and still, we waited at least 5 minutes to just get greeted. Let's also explain now how DEAD the restaurant was. Five tables max, and no one at the bar. So we get seated beside someone having a birthday party. The manager tells us that our waiter will take our drink order after he is done cutting/serving the cake for the birthday party next to us. If she doesn't see him do it in a little while, she will be back. I am not kidding or making this up. That is what she said to us THE MOMENT WE SAT DOWN! Again, let's review: the restaurant was not packed. What was she doing that was so important that she couldn't take our drink order? Then there are the bussers: clearing tables, then immediately going to pick up new plates of food to serve without washing hands in-between. And when they serve you your food, you will be grimaced at, not smiled toward. They joked with each other, yacked it up in the bar area and smiled a lot to each other - but not to any guests. Why do we know this, you may ask? Because we had plenty of time to watch them while waiting for our drinks, food, check, every little thing. Our waiter finally arrives (no luck on getting drinks from the manager because she disappeared along with our waiter), and is sweating all over us/the table/everywhere. We try to make small talk because his hand was all bandaged... to which we got _____ (insert crickets here). So we ordered drinks and food all in one go. Who knows when we would ever see someone again! This is a poor excuse for a restaurant, let alone a Kimpton-tied restaurant. They need to clean house (yes, I'm suggesting firing everyone) and start over. It is clear the management couldn't care less and that trickles down to all staff.
