Drink glasses were dirty so we asked for new ones - insert another 5-7 minute wait here. Bussers take away our plates from the appetizers (the chowder is not as good as Connie & Ted's - go there for real chowder), and consequently we have no silverware for our main course. Don't think of asking for it because when we asked the busser, I thought he was gonna haul off and hit me or my guy. Seriously, this is how angry he looked. WTH is going on at this place? Finally, we got cold food (I ordered some kind of seafood pasta dish - forgettable especially because I barely touched it due to it being cold and sticky). Yelp world, I hear you - I HEAR YOU! I would have complained, but to whom, and when?!? Manager was nowhere to be found, our waiter was also MIA, and the bussers were hostile at best by this point because we dared to ask for water refills and fresh silverware. So we waited, pondered about going to the front desk to ask for our check since no one was visibly working (bar was empty too). After even more waiting, our waiter reappeared and had the gall to ask if I wanted a to go box.... We paid, and almost ran out to get dessert at another place down the street. The Kimpton management either needs to disassociate the hotel from this place or seriously bring in their ranger team to fix it from top to bottom. Stop having your pals post good reviews and start paying attention to actual customers. When we told the front desk person the next morning about our experience, she asked why we didn't complain to the manager and, again, we told her, "to whom? How and when? No one was around!" Try at your own risk - if at all. Better yet, do yourself a favor and try one of the other amongst the thousands of restaurants in the city. You will be glad you did.
author: Jen V.

description:
We are locals but we spent the night in the city to do the tourist thing with some friends.  We picked this place for breakfast.  I was very skeptical because it is dead center of the tourist area.  Without exageration, we all had the best breakfast we have ever had.  All of us had different things on the menu from an omlette to huevos rancheros and we were still talking about our breakfast at dinner!   

Its been over a month since we visited Blue Mermaid and my mouth still waters when I think about my huevos rancheros breakfast.

Do yourself a big favor and make a reservation as much in advance as you can.  Having to stand outside of this place to wait while smelling the food will make you crazy!!!
author: Welldone F.

description:
I had the pleasure of dining at this fine establishment for the 4th of july celebration. Being that it was a holiday, I find it to be a perfect time to review this restaurant especially after having such a wonderful experience during one of the busiest days of the year. 

Blue Mermaid is located conveniently within the Pier 39 area. The appearance is that of a modern swanky type, enjoyable by all types of crowds. Its different from many Pier restaurants in that it does not have that  old "by the bay" restaurant feel like Bubba Gumps and Crab Shack. 

My first impression of this place was the quick service. It was obvious that we came in during rush hour, however the hostess wasted no time in finding us a seat outside the restaurant. The weather was great in the bay this day so we did not mind being seated outside. 

For dinner, I ordered the Seafood large platter. AMAZING. Sheer perfection in terms of fresh seafood. The platter came with over a dozen mussel prawns, a dozen oysters, some shrimp, and a large crab. Words cannot describe how delicious and fresh each item on the platter was. Suffice it to say, that we were quite happy with our main entree selection. I must also add, that this platter is more than enough for two people. 

My one complaint, which actually is quite minimal in regards to the meal as a whole, is in the cocktail sauce. I have never really heard of many places doing this, but this particular restaurant puts wasabi sauce on top of its cocktail sauce. Not a bad idea, however the Wasabi overtakes the cocktail sauce with impeccable force. The first dip into this mix sends you into a world of pain, as the wasabi penetrates the sense and opens up every airway possible. The experience was by far horribly uncomfortable. 

Overall, I am a fan of this place. One  small detail, did not ruin my experience.

The price for the meal is perfect, and the service was great....... I recommend.
author: J A.

description: Slow service, food was overpriced. It took 15 minutes for our server to acknowledge our existence. 20 mins to take our dinner order after that. Then he refused to split up the bill for our table, very inconsiderate. Spend your money elsewhere.
author: Brandon G.

description:
Nice tour bar.

Happy Hour prices for drinks and appetizers were inexpensive.

2/23/11: Beer tap not working    :(
author: Harry S.

description: LOVE the Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder!!! My favorite chowder in the SF bay.
author: Kathryn M.

description: mmmmm bread bowl! This was a great little refuge from the cold and rain on my recent visit. We mainly came here for the clam chowder bread bowl and were not disappointed. I had the Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder and absolutely LOVED it. The staff was nice and it was pretty quiet when we stopped by. To quote Arnold: "I will be back"
author: Dana S.

description:
Great chowder house. Lots of variety with the chowders (actually 6) they serve. They have your usual New England and Manhattan, but mix it up with Mussel/Sausage, crab/corn, California clam, and shrimp/red pepper chowders. The menu is typical of a seafood restaurant.

I decided to order the Treasure Chest. It came with choice of chowder or salad, choice of crab cakes or salmon, and choice of chardonnay or beer. I went with the mussel/sausage chowder (a tomato based soup) with the salmon and chardonnay. Everything was very tasty. The mussel/sausage chowder had a surprising spiciness. The salmon was flaky and the fresh lemon wedge provided that right amount of citrus. The chardonnay was approachable and unoffensive (a very drinkable wine).

The prices are what I'd expect. I'd go back again the next time in town. The best part was sitting outside on the patio. We got free entertainment from an acoustic guitar singer performing in Del Monte square. It made for a very relaxing evening.
author: Gina Q.

description:
We went in with semi-high expectations but we were really underwhelmed.

I had the fish and chips. It was decent, but hard to mess it up.

My wife had the New England clam chowder in a bread bowl. She said it tasted more like onion soup, it had way too many onions in it. She ended up having a stomach ache most of the evening from the chowder.

My wife also ordered a glass of wine, as they were offering a free glass for a check-in deal. Unfortunatly someone must have told all the gnats about the wine, as within 5 minutes of getting the glass there were 2 gnats already in her wine glass.

We noticed lots of other gnats, and the waiter said it's because they had the windows open earlier in the day. Makes me wonder how many we ate with our dinner....
author: Bryan R.

description: Our second trip to the Blue Mermaid, this time with my mother in law.  We both had the chowder, and we both can honestly say, the BEST chowder in San Francisco.  I  had the Dungeness Crab roll and could not finish it... tons of crab meat.  Excellent.  I would recommend any of the chowders, the New England and California Chowder were my favorites.  Def. will be coming back again soon.
author: Bob B.

description:
First the good.  Happy Hour until 6 had $3.00 Anchor Steam Drafts.  Succatash was good.  Red/Manhattan Chowder and Oysters Rockefeller marginal.

Corn and crab chowder good.

The main reason it gets a 2 star is the service is poor.  Servers walk by and don't look at you.  Had to wave my hands to get their attention.  Never saw anybody who looked like a manager.
author: Esper G.

description:
Love their chowder sampler!
Typical pricey, tourist spot but the food is good.  We were in San Francisco for the Chocolate Festival and decided to avoid the large crowds at Ghirardelli Square.  Surprisingly, it was really easy for us to get seats and service was great.  I didn't try much else on the menu since their chowders are so popular, so I can't review on anything else.  Just go for the chowder!
author: Maryrose S.

description:
Good clam chowder and decent calamari. Worst Crab Eggs Benedict I've had in a long long time - dry overcooked eggs, dry tasteless sauce, dry overfried crab chunks. I was hungry so ate it all, but won't order it again.

Been to this place a few times since. Standard "touristy" dishes are very decent. Don't expect any masterpieces though.

My wife and I just had breakfast there.  I had huevos rancheros and she had a quiche.  Major disappointment.  The food was on the order of a Denny's!  While that is not necessarily bad, for the price it was!
author: Stephen S.

description: Spent 2 days in the city with a 5 year old grandkid and needed a kid-friendly restaurant in the wharf area. This was a great choice. The adults had cocktails and enjoyed the chowder and fresh salad. Entrees were adequate for a wharf restaurant. The kid had a blast. Good kid's menu. Fun nautical-themed decor with a great mermaid-themed restroom. Kept her happy and busy with crayons and a coloring placemat. Not the best servce in the world, but friendly, so we were all happy at the end of the day and only a few blocks from dessert at Ghiaradelli's.
author: Jude M.

description: Cioppino and dungeness roll were generous with seafood portions but cioppino broth was a litttle too salty and just tasted like tomato soup and roll crab meat was not too flavorful. Service was great.
author: Sheila W.

description:
I lived in New England for 6 years so I know good fish when I eat it. 

We got 2 chowder assortments (to try everything) AND a huge bowl of the crab and corn. Everything was delicious. Fresh seafood, well balanced flavors. I love it when a seafood chowder has some bacon in it, it's a very good combo. Some of these definitely did and none of them had tough or old seafood in them. The shrimp were tender and delicate, the mussels also melted in the mouth, the crab was very fresh and there were big chunks of meat in the soup. 

We also got the Fisherman's Basket - fried cod, clams, shrimp and calamari. Again, everything here was perfectly cooked. There was the thinnest coating of breading on the seafood, no nasty thick batter, and everything was melt-in-the-mouth tender, no overcooked fish here. I hate tough seafood. Plus, everything was also piping hot and crisp. The fry seafood well here. 

For one of the best bargains ever I'd get the Seafood Cioppino. I got a mountain of mussels, baby clams, pieces of salmon, shrimp, crab legs, and calamari swimming in a bath of tangy creamy tomato sauce. I was in heaven. Again, everything was perfectly cooked and tender, no rubbery fish. For $21, it's the bargain of the wharf. It was a mountain I tell you! 

The one thing that was not so good was the Fried Golden Shrimp entreee. For $19 you got 6 medium sized shrimp and a little portion of fries and a similarly little portion of cole-slaw. Eh. The shrimp were only OK. The kitchen has a lot of skill in frying, but 6 shrimp for $19 when I got a mountain of similarly sized seafood for $21?! Odd. 

Go for the chowders, the cioppino and the excellent attentive service. You'll have a lovely wharf dinner! =)
author: Lila G.

description: Loved the crab and the crab/corn chowder! Great vibe in the whole Argonaut Hotel and the sailor shirts are adorable ;)
author: MaryKate M.

description: The food was delicious, especially the chowder and the parmesian garlic french fries. I had the fish and chips. The fish was ok, but the fries were outstanding. The wait staff was fantastic. I got seated right away and my waiter was great. I think what impressed me most is that he was honest about the crab.  It's at the end of crab season and he admitted that the crab isn't as fresh as the other seafood on the menu. This told me that he wasn't there just to sell the highest priced items, he was there to make my meal the best it could be. Impressive!
author: Mary J.

description: Lobster roll sandwich was pretty good, and the muscle chowder was good as well.  Our server could have been a little more attentive, though.
author: Kurt K.

description:
Oysters- salty
Fried Calamari- good, not chewy. 
Sourdough bread- needed to be cut all the way through, but butter was good, creamy, rich. 
Ahi Tuna- - about an inch thick, and seemed stringy- got better in the middle, but still I'm skeptical, especially about the wasabi aioli . Green beans firm, with fresh basil. 
Chowder- Recommend it.
author: E. T.

description:
Despite being worried that this was going to be an overpriced tourist trap with awful food, we ended up at the Blue Mermaid on one of our evenings touring the city.  Fortunately, although it's in a very tourist filled parcel of land, the Blue Mermaid manages to serve up good food at a decent price.   The restaurant was almost empty when we arrived and we were seated outside without any hesitation.  Our waiter was very friendly and soon arrived with water and sourdough bread.  

We chose to sample the award winning Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder, the California Clam Chowder, the half Dungeness Crab, and the Fish and Chips.  Both of the chowders very stellar; creamy and smooth without being too thick or fishy.  They showcased the seafood beautifully (as well as coming in delicious bread bowls).  The Dungeness crab was lightly steamed and accompanied by lemon and butter; a very basic dish, but delicious in it's simplicity.  The fish and chips very crisp and rich without being oily; the garlic chunks were a nice complement to the fries. Overall, it was a lovely place to spend and evening, and a chance to sample some delicious seafood.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
The Blue Mermaid was place my boyfriend and I just happened to stumble upon our first time acting touristy at Fisherman's Wharf since we had moved into the city. I knew that we had to stop for a bread bowl of chowda before going home so we ducked into the closest place. BEST ACCIDENT EVER! They just so happen to have one of the best award winning chowders. The crab and corn chowder is so good, I still wake up from dreams about it. Their crab cakes and other food is delicious too, don't get me wrong, however I always find myself getting the same bread bowl of liquid gold.

The service can be so so at times. We have had slow service despite there being very few customers. I find this to be a necessary evil in my addict like need for good old fashioned chowda! Also, there is a Ben and Jerry's right down the block so if you feel like dessert I'd recommend dropping by there and eating it on the pack benches over looking the bay. Yum!
author: Taylor M.

description:
Omg...omg...omg...I want to rub the clam chowder all over my body! It is so amazing. 

Ok...let me catch my breath for a second. Phew. So, first we ordered the bloody mary. I remembered and dreamed about it in the time I was not there and my anticipation was high. It was perfect. From the garnish (scallions, olives, red and yellow peppers, lime, and a shrimp) to the consistency to the color to the taste. If I could drink this at any time, I would throw Mountain Dew and energy drink to the side while giving them the middle finger. http://www.flickr.com/photos/nrg7photography/4134151746/


Next, a bowl of clam chowder each. Mommy daddy, how could this experience get any better? I didn't think that it could. The chowder was also perfect, and totally worth the 9 bucks. It was was perfectly creamy, not grainy and separating. The clam taste was there, but did not overpower your mouth with a fish aftertaste. The corn added a nice hint of sweetness. And the pesto/oil drizzle added great color to the presentation as well as taste. See it as the cherry to your ice cream sundae. http://www.flickr.com/photos/nrg7photography/4133390331/

We were stuffed at this point, but greed kept us going. So we ordered the crab cakes. I had no idea what I would have been missing. A crab cake that consists of crab and not just mayo and breading? That's what I am talking about! The crab was fresh, the consistency was amazing, the seasoning and additions (such as minced yellow and red peppers) were perfect, all encased by the perfect amount of bread while all along avoiding to be greasy. DELISH!

By now you probably think I am either weird, crazy and obsessed. You might be right. But try these items and you will likely act the same. 

Downsides: Service is a bit slow at times.

Food: A+
Drinks: A+
Ambiance: A
Service: B
Price: B+
Overall: A
author: Jana S.

description: This place kicks ass! The crab and corn chowder is awesome, and so is the seafood bar. Grab yourself an anchor steam and enjoy!
author: Glen G.

description: Walked in, got seated, waited 15 min, went to talk to the waiter, no urgency or apology for the wait, the place was maybe 25% full... Two waiters looked at me, and moved on, so we left without trying the chowder. Service gets an F!
author: Raymond H.

description:
A friend and I went here last Saturday and were seated right away on a busy touristy day. We had great, but slow service. 

Now let's get to the important part. The onion rings. They were fantastic! If I was a size 2 I would have eaten the whole basket. My friend and I split the crab sandwich, which was delicious and fresh... yadda yadda. The onion rings were pipping hot and fried with a buttermilk batter that was smooth and flavorful without a greasiness. What I loved is that they were simply served with ranch and no other trendy useless sauces. When it comes to the onion ring, no other sauce will do. Just bring the ranch without having to ask. 

P.S. the hotel looked very luxurious to stay at.
author: Lauren D.

description: This is a great breakfast spot. A spicey bloody mary and a piece of their quiche is a perfect start of the day
author: Jason R.

description: Best chowder in town. We tried the sampler and loved it. So delicious. And the mermaid margarita was the best I've ever had.
author: Lisa R.

description: I've seen this place a lot, and yet only recently gone in with some out-of-towners. I was hella skeptical because most places near/along the Wharf/Pier 39 areas are pretty crap, as hungry tourists will literally eat anything after a day of walking SF hills. I was pleasantly surprised by the food and the staff was really nice/great. The chowder is obviously good and the mains were also tasty. It's probably the best food I've had near Fisherman's Wharf (save for the fresh seafood sold from those stalls). Hurrah for beating mediocrity!
author: Amy S.

description: The best crab & corn chowder my wife and I have ever had. The bread bowl was ok, but the soup was greatness. They had a really nice bar with some delicious beers on tap and plenty of peaceful outdoor seating. They had a really friendly staff as we'll.
author: Sour D.

description:
If you don't mind waiting a long time to get a few bowls of soup and 2 sandwiches while the manager and staff watch football this is the place to go.  When I interrupted the staff crowed around the television to ask about our order the manager became very defensive.  The manager delivered our food stating that the food just came up in a very angry voice.  Well the soup was warm and the fries cold so it had not just come up.  There was no apology, which a simple "I am sorry" would have gone a long way.  

Upon leaving I asked the manager for her card and was given a generic card for the restaurant and told that I was an abusive customer and not to come back.  Appalled at the reply from an unprofessional, disrespectful manager, I sent an email to the general manager to which I have received no correspondence.

The hotel is terrific but the restaurant is run by a different management staff that becomes obvious.
author: Terri L.

description:
About 3 weeks ago we had  dinner at the Blue Mermaid.The scallops were cooked just right. The service was excellent, even though they were very busy. Today, I had  orderd the same thing,  they not busy at all. The service was poor.The scallops were over done and hard.
T think the time to go there is when they are busy and in the evening.I give it one and a half stars for  lunch.


Bernie
author: Bernard K.

description: I had lunch here on the recommendation of a san fran foodie.  Yum!  Their crab and corn chowder was incredible!  I wish I had paid more attention to the menu because I would have ordered the sampler.  It was really hard to narrow my chowder choice to one, they all sounded delicious.  I thought the decor was charming.  I love the vintage advertisements on the walls. The prices were very reasonable, especially being in the wharf area
author: Lynnette M.

description:
The chowder is great.
The burger was really good.
The fries are great.
The patio in Del Monte Square rocks when weather is nice.
The service (not necessarily our waiter's fault) was slooowww.
author: Justin B.

description:
What a nice surprise to find this great chowder house across from the bustle of Fisherman's Wharf.  I stopped in for lunch after a hard day of site seeing.  It was a chilly 59 degrees and a bowl of chowder hit the spot.  
They have several chowders on the menu, I had the corn and crab chowder.  It was served with a swirl of cilantro and green onion that looked like a swoop of kelp, pretty cool.  Nice little kick to the chowder, not too spicy.  Served with fresh, warm bread and butter.

Service was excellent, no complaints.

I liked the little touches of rope wrapped around the support poles, deck chairs in the lobby on the way to the ladies, with porthole mirrors and cool looking tile walls and floors.  

Have already recommended this place to friends who will be visiting the city soon.
author: Mona H.

description: Absolutely LOVE this place. Crab and corn chowder in a bread bowl makes every trip here worth it! The oyster rockafeller and the fish and chips are good too. Good bloody marys and beer.
author: Andrew C.

description: Had a nice lunch while waiting for second part of a day tour. I had the clams with linguine & my bf had the 3 fish entree. Very tasty!
author: Lia E.

description: Cool location..... The food was a little on the depressing side. Clam chowder was lacking the star of the soup, there were maybe 2 pieces of clam in the entire bowl... It did have a whole mess of celery, do if you like that then SCORE for you. If anything stop by for a free glass of two buck chuck. Enjoy!!
author: Steve M.

description:
Very good food when it finally arrived.  The crab and corn chowder was pretty good.  something nice that they don't really tell you is you can get a replace the side you get to choose from with a cup of soup for $2 extra.  It was nice to me because i didn't want all that food, but i still wanted to try the soup.  I actually got an extra cup because i had them bring it early as an appetizer, then they brought one with the meal as well.  Bonus.  

The service was a bit lacking.  We walked in and walked passed the "Please wait to be seated" sign to actually get someone to seat us.  The food we order took over 30 minutes to get to us after we order, which we were basically the only people there at 11 in the morning.  We had to ask for bread, which may be something you have to do around here since it is such good bread, it isn't something i am used to.

3 stars due to how good the food was, easily a strong 4 if we got better service, which i chalked up to being early.
author: Lance L.

description: Our server was James and he was extremely good! It was our first time and we happened to just pick the place. It turned out to be a wise choice. James asked us questions about our food preferences and made recommendations based on that. A nice change from the usual"push" this or that. I had the crab and corn chowder. It was very good, not the best, but then I live in Virginia. The Oysters Rockefeller was equally very good, not the best. I would order both again. The pina colada was too pricey, but good. I make the best one and being my favorite drink...I've had them everywhere so not a fair comparison. My husband had fish and chips, delicious!  Overall, the restaurant was above average. James was a gem!
author: Debby K.

description: I like this place, atmosphere is fun, have only been for brunch tho twice. Great beers on taps, bloody mary's, ramos fizz, the works, excellent brunch entrees, outside seating, tv's to watch the games, amazing chowders and shellfish entrees, great shrimp cocktails, crab cakes, crab sandwiches, the works.
author: Adam U.

description:
On our honeymoon we stopped in here for breakfast after catching a cable car down to fisherman's wharf.

We were happy with the service and enjoyed the atmosphere. 

I had the Bacon Quiche, which also had cheese and spinach and was delighted with it. I find quiche too often to be over or undercooked but it was just perfect. 

I believe my husband had the belgian waffle plate and was satisfied with it.

Prices were not bad. Only complaint is the menu is not that extensive, but I imagine their specialty is not breakfast.
author: Amanda N.

description: I had visited before a few years ago and I remember trying my mom's chowder and it being amazing. Now, I decided to take my significant other and try this place again. Firstly I recommend making a reservation but we only had to wait less than half an hour. We ordered the calamari appetizers and two orders of the corn and chowder bowls. The chowder had a lot of flavor and was also on the spicy side, but not too spicy for this wussy tongue. It was also very creme and rich. The calamari was fresh and the plate had a variety of asparagus and onions, deep fried. The atmosphere was a bit noisy, but a nice decor and friendly staff.
author: Nicole M.

description:
Seafood is good, everything else is terrible. Burger was tasteless.
Service was 1 star. Half of the dishes came out cold and had to be sent back.

Check in and get a free dessert.
author: Victor S.

description:
Okay, I had to struggle between 2 and 3 stars. I would do 2.5 stars but you can't 1/2.  stars. My hubby ordered clam and corn chowder and a dungenous crab sandwich. I ordered sea bass. Hubby did not like his clam chowder because of the corn. It was his first time trying it with corn, so I can't penalize the restaurant. However he said there was not even a single clam in it. Just one small piece of fish. His sandwich was "okay" and he remarked the one he got from an earlier trip to the place across the street was better. 

I had the sea bass which was definitely over cooked and with a ton of pepper on one side of it. There was a delicious orange sauce but it was only on a small part of the fish. I could have used more sauce because of how overcooked the fish was. They cooked it like trout and it was rubbery. I actually had to use a knife to cut it. It was on a bed of mashed potatoes and veggies. There was hardly any mashed potatoes. 

While our meal was edible, we do not plan to ever go back. I give 2 stars for how quickly we were seated, how wonderful our service was and how quickly our food came. Lunch, with tip, came to $60.
author: Christina G.

description: I will give this place the credit it is due. The chowder was good and the cheesecake was decent. Everything else was so gross, I had the linguine with clams and the "sauce" was watery, bland and gross tasting. Two people from our group had food poisoning after eating at this place. I don't get why people rave about this place, do yourself a favor and stay away.
author: Cass R.

description: Overall, pretty good! I had a glass of wine, crab and corn chowder (beware it has bacon in it!), and the salmon with brussels sprouts. They can make the salmon dish without bacon if you ask. The bread was good but I would have liked it warmed up. The salmon dish was quite spicy in a weird way. I suddenly recalled the red jalapeno in the description. FYI, they also honor the yelp check in deal for a  glass of wine or dessert. The bread pudding was pretty tasty. It was ok, but there are probably better options close by.
author: Amanda R.

description:
A decent glass of wine, a decent piece of mahi mahi, a nice looking steak, decent service. . . . I just can't see it being memorable.  It's a nice hotel restaurant, with good, expensive food, in the touristy-ist (it is too a word) spot in SF.
So, if you're a tourist in SF, it's a solid option.  If you're a local, visiting with tourists in SF, it's a solid option, but don't drive down there.  Parking in the area is an absolute freaking nightmare.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
New Englanders will surely declare war on me for saying so, but I feel San Francisco has the best clam chowder, period.  And in San Francisco, the Blue Mermaid's clam chowder is king.

I think a lot of tourists walk right past this place while ambling up and down the Wharf.  You'd be wise not to.  The food and drink here are both fantastic, and you can avoid some of the ridiculous lines you'd get at other eateries closer to Pier 39's tourist hub.

Prior to your meal, they offer you warm sourdough bread to snack on.  This gets you in the mood for whatever you have coming, especially if you ordered the chowder.  If you did, you'll notice a bit of spice (and some celery) that Boudin's doesn't seem to use in theirs.  That little touch sends it over the top.  The bread bowl I got was a bit smaller than the one I had at Boudin's, but neither I nor anyone around me finished it anyway.

The menu is simple, by that I mean there aren't seven pages of things that are difficult to pronounce and even more difficult to afford.  The lunch menu I was handed was one sheet, front and back.  All the favorites were on it, dominated (as expected) by chowder and other seafood.

Take special note of their mixed drinks.  The adult beverage selection is fairly robust, and they have some interesting combinations that may interest you.  I highly recommend the rum-and-ginger-beer concoction.  Prices are fairly high for what you get, but I suppose one shouldn't expect anything less from one of the most expensive cities in the United States.
author: Dan W.

description:
It was okay - nothing to scream about. I got the chowder sampler which was okay - very rich in flavor. My daughter got the chower bowl which she enjoyed followed by the molten cake which was definitely good...hello, chocolate! 

The setting was cute and the service was good - but the company I was with was unbeatable! It's in the Argonaunt Hotel which is really cool, I hope to stay there next time :)
author: Stacey A.

description: This place is just not worth it.  The food was bland, expensive and nothing to write home about. In a city of fantastic seafood options, do not waste your time here.  The only highlight was the California Clam Chowder. I can't complain about the service.  They were fast and efficient.  It's not their fault they have to sling crummy food.
author: Kara W.

description:
New England has tha' BEST chowdah eva', right?!   
Wrong.

Originally from New England, it's hard for me to admit.  But even the critics on the East Coast had to agree when our local Fisherman's Wharf fave, Blue Mermaid, won the Newport (RI) Great Chowder Cook-Off three times in a row. And that's saying a lot in a seafood mecca like Cape Cod & Newport. 

Being the true skeptic I am, I just had to taste it for myself.  I plopped my incredulous butt down on the patio w/ a fellow New England'er and ordered the Crab & Corn Chowder to disprove once and for all this crazy nonsense.  Pfft. 

Uh. Well. Uh. Maybe it was the comfy chair. Or the sunshine was affecting my brain. But. Uh. Well. WOW!!  

This was by far the best chowder I've ever had. Hands down. 

Sorry Mom.  I may be banned for writing this review, but at least I know I can walk to Blue Mermaid and have some of the best chowder -  without the flight.
author: Lauren C.

description:
The Award Winning Chowder that they so proudly tout should truly be tried. It lived up to its reputation and more. Our waiter was genuinely one of the nicest people I have ever met.

The only downside that I saw to the place was the price of their drinks. They had great happy hour deals, but unfortunately we went when it wasn't happy hour. Even though it was good, $12 for a margarita is a bit much.
author: Chris M.

description:
Restaurant connected to the Argonaut Hotel. Went there for breakfast. Expensive for breakfast. Not sure for lunch or dinner though.

Breakfast on first day had Eggs Benedict. Was ok but saltier than I like. Hubby had American breakfast and liked it a lot. My daughter had the Belgian waffles which was as close as we could get to pancakes.

Second morning I switched to the egg scramble with avocado and Jack cheese. I really liked this dish much better. Hubby and daughter did a repeat of the previous day. Again.. Expensive... But convenient.
author: Sheree E.

description:
Great wharf experience!
Food was unbelievable food, great prices and service was great! ExChef was on tv for their 1st place  crab & corn chowder. Must for oyster lovers!
author: Rochelle D.

description: Excellent food and reasonably priced for the Warf. We had the see food trio and organic chicken. Got a free dessert for yelp check in. Service was good too.
author: Dan C.

description: I never thought I would like anything having to do with the wharf until the food and wine festival, when these guys were ladling out big bowls of soup. I also think I even said the same day that SF isn't really a hot-bed of chowda. I still hate the wharf, but if you're going to go, go here and order two bowls of the crab and corn chowder (I know - corn is evil, but here it's worth it). It's so fantastic. Creamy, meaty, tasty. Wow.
author: Andrew K.

description: WOW, the corn and crab chowder is some of the BEST I have ever eat'n.  Just amazing.
author: Mike M.

description: Stopped in on latest trip to San Fran and the crab corn chowder was a delicious as I remembered.  Service always friendly and helpful.
author: Jill N.

description:
best clam chowder I have ever had!
The only negative is that it's a bit pricey, but service + food was awesome.
Definitely will go there again
author: Jessica M.

description:
First time there.  Atmosphere was pleasant.  It was a late Sunday morning in the Cannery.

The food was exceptional, the service was ok except for keeping the glasses full.  We had to ask to get refills.

The wife had the Fish and Chips and a salad.  I had a cup of New England Clam Chowder and the Linguini with Clams.

Salad:  The one thing that ruins a salad is wet greens.  The greens were very fresh, very clean and dry as a bone.  No word on the vinigrette.

Fish and Chips:  Best she's eaten in a long, long time.  Not oily, fish cooked perfectly.  Chips were so-so....there's room for improvement in the potatoes.  They were very thin, although there were a lot on the plate.  It may be a matter of taste, but the chips should be more substantial; there doesn't have to be so many on the plate as long as they're good.

New England Clam Chowder:  zOMG!  Very complex taste, just the right creaminess and plenty of very tender clams.  No room for improvement.  Next time, I'm going to try the sampler (you choose 3 from several variations of chowders)

Linguini with clams:  Perfect.  More than enough fresh, tender clams (served in-shell), perfectly cooked pasta and the garlic!  Wow!  Fantastic flavors.  And most notibly, no sand.  Not one grain.  I usually get at least one little "crunch" but not this time.  That was the most surprising thing, yet it seems like most places forget to thoroughly clean their clams.

I've already recommended this place to co-workers and we will be back to try something else soon.
author: Brian M.

description: This place is da bomb!  The food is good! This is one of the places that I usually go to when I come to the bay area. The staff is good. Friendly and attentive. The prices are good and the food is good too.  They have one of the best clam chowders that I have had.  I have had some good clam chowder in L.A. but this place in the S.F. is the best that I have had so far.  Sometimes I wonder if I come up to the bay just to hang out with my friends and eat the clam chowder from this place.  What an expense bowl of clam chowder huh?  I  fly a couple of hundred miles just for an awesome bowl of clam chowder. Luckily, I am not that insane.  But again, this place does have great clam chowder and fresh oysters!
author: James Y.

description: Chowder was good, liquor selection was ok, but not great (ate at the bar). Slow - but visited during the off-season. Was ok - but don't think I'd do it again.
author: Jason S.

description: Very disappointing visit today for breakfast. Our waiter was not attentive at all, the food came out cold twice , incorrect and at that point we gave up! Sat on the patio and regretted going to the Blue Mermaid
author: Ron O.

description:
We came here for a bowl of the crab and corn chowder. My friend went to a food festival, and this was his favorite dish. At $9 for a bowl, it isn't cheap, but it's a lot better than the garbage that Legal Sea Foods called chowder.

One of the people in our party didn't really like the chowder. She mentioned it to the hostess after our meal. The hostess promptly came back with three samples of the new england clam chowder, which was possibly better than the crab and corn. We all left happy - these people know customer service.

The decor is unpretentious. Perfectly suited to the food. If I'm in town with tourist friends/relatives, I would bring them here.
author: Dana L.

description:
Decent.  Not *too* touristy, but still touristy.  Good clam chowder, surly and slow service.  It wasn't even a busy night!  

Nice outdoor seating, decent bloody marys.
author: Alex J.

description:
On my trip to San Francisco, I stayed at the Argonaut Hotel which is connected to a homey little chowder house called the Blue Mermaid. On my second day in the city, I tried it for lunch. 

I can't even begin to describe how much I ate. It started with an innocent cup of New England chowder and a plate of Oysters Rockefeller. The service was quick and on time. And then the food came. it's been a long, long time since I had baked oysters as good as these. The original "ocean" flavor and texture of the oysters were preserved, but were served baked with a mouth-melting dill-based cover that basically screamed thoughts of the sea. My chowder came next--speaking from someone who has tried New England chowder in Cape Cod--this chowder was definitely up to par.

But I didn't stop there, oh no sir. My friend had ordered a Dungeness crab sandwich, and it came with a heaping plate of lightly browned and thin french fries garnished with pieces of garlic and shavings of parmesan. Being a fry nerd, I had to try it. Within ten minutes all of his fries were gone, eaten by me.

Speaking honestly, I've never had fries that good.

Waitstaff was young, enthusiastic, and awesome. The outdoor seating is located in a quaint little alley with street performers and lots of life. On a gorgeous spring afternoon in San Francisco, eating outside at this place simply cannot be beat.

I can't recommend this place highly enough...
author: Matt P.

description: Ok Corn Chowder loved the calamari. My Wife loved her Steak.
author: Brian P.

description: I took my Mom to The City for her 60th birthday. We wanted to eat somewhere casual but someplace unique to SF. A friend suggested The Blue Mermaid. We were seated immediately. Our server greeted us soon after. She recommended some delicious wine. I had the scallops and Mom had the Fish and Chips. The food was delicious!!! The service was excellent! I highly recommend and I will be returning soon!!
author: Julianne B.

description:
My bf and I came here on a last minute decision to find something to eat around the Fisherman's Wharf area. He wanted to have sundaes at Ghirardelli so I suggested this place since it was close by. After looking at the menu, I hoped that the expensive prices would match up to the quality and taste of their food. Of course they were charging $28 bucks for a bowl of chowder and 2 crab cakes....this is freakin Fisherman's Wharf, i thought. Luckily we weren't extremely hungry so we decided to share that. Surprisingly it was very filling. We also shared an appetizer tray of fried calamari. The chowder was just okay to me. I couldn't believe it was "award-winning". Maybe I have to give this place another shot.....but very unlikely. 

Note: It's located inside the Argonaut Hotel
author: Anne E.

description:
We ordered their award winning #1 dunganese crab and corn chowder. We had to fish for for the crab, i found one piece in my bowl, my wife couldn't find any in hers. Their special organic salad was just horrible.
This place is not worth the $50 for two bowls of chowder with questionable ingredients and some crappy salad.
author: Zahir A.

description: I moved to Fisherman's Warft a few months ago and have been here for the chowder a few times.  The chowder is pretty good, not the best, but good.  I went today for brunch.  $19+ for an eggs benedict with crab.  The eggs were cooked like a hardboiled egg, the crab had no taste and was all bread and the english muffins were old.  I mentioned something to them about just the eggs being way over cooked and they did nothing. Bad food and bad service = loss of my business.  They got two stars because the chowder is OK.
author: Chel P.

description: The crab cakes were the best I have ever eaten.   The crab and corn chowder was very good.   Service was good also.
author: Susan K.

description: Horrible service... expensive food... order a seafood trio plate cost about $25. Comes in with a $5 worth of scrap.. if you are in sf but want to waste time and money... do visit this place. Total cost for 3 plate of food plus soup - $89!!!
author: Ron Z.

description: On one of my first trips to california as an adult in my life at the present moment, I went on tour of this area fisherman's wharf and I was very impressed by the blue mermaid chowder house. We loved the atmosphere, they had the celtics game going on and I'm from boston so it was great. The waiter that came over introduced himself in a positive manner -  talked to us and recommended all sorts of dishes based on our tastes and selections. I had such a great experience given the service, the food was amazing. We had crab, seafood gumbo, oysters, the oysters were super delicious and well prepped - I am a fan of oysters so maybe there wasn't anything rather special abou tit. The drinks were good, no complaints there. We ended up being really full and had a great night. I would love to go there again.
author: Johnny S.

description: Went here just because In N Out was packed. The pirate ship ambiance was tolerable but, as my cousin said, the waitstaff's uniform is a bit degrading. That's probably why they don't appear proud of their job? I gave 3 stars for the tasty crab corn chowder. It was a little too salty for my taste though. The flavored fries included in the fish and chips was better than the actual deep fried entree.  My main concern is the lack of consistent quality service.  I watched our waiter refill the drink of the guy next to us several times while my empty glass sat unnoticed.  It was not a busy shift and we were not too shabbily dressed.  I would have given them 2 stars but the washroom was very clean.
author: Rey Q.

description:
Crab and corn chowder: excellent.

Sea bass: a bit over cooked.

Oatmeal: average.

Waitstaff uniforms: free-credit-report-dot-com-tastic.
author: Reid C.

description: average meal.  had crB cakes Nd beer.  crab cakes were pretty good but beer tasted old.  I usually like almost any beer, but this one seemed like the lines were not very good.  had breakfast next morning and food was cold.  potatoes were not good at all.
author: Sean B.

description: Came here for the Clam Chowder only and it was much better than Boudin's. The chowder is less chowdery and more watery than most but the taste and seafood was pretty good.
author: Heidi C.

description:
While the chowder was good. I had an issue with the service.
We were seated and waited a while and a server came up to the table behind us that had just been seated and asked for their order and completely ignored our table.
Another server came by and I asked him if he was our server and he said he was not and proceeded to ask the original server Hector if he was ours. The server named Hector complete ignored all of us and walked away. 
We all were taken aback and made a comment. At that point another server Lester came out and was very accommodating. However when the drinks were brought to the table they were brought by the rude server Hector and it appeared that there was spit in my Chardonnay. I asked Lester to take that and pour the glass directly in front of me. I believe that Hector had spit in my wine because we had called him out on his rude inhospitable behavior. I would not recommend this place at all ever.
author: Michele M.

description: We sat at the bar and had the crab and corn chowder bread bowl. It was delicious and the service was awesome. It is at the end of the Wharf where you can hop on the trolley.
author: Irissa N.

description:
Best restaurant at the Fisherman's Wharf by far!!!  During our week stay in SF, we tried Scoma's and Fisherman's Grotto and were not impressed.  As we were checking out of our hotel, The Argonaut, we decided to check out the restaurant there.  

Their award winning Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder really is the best!  Had a bit of a kick to it - spicy just like I like it.  We also tried their Oysters Rockefeller which were 5 enormous oysters beautifully displayed and extremely delicious.

We'll definitely avoid the other Fisherman' Wharf tourist-trap restaurants and stick with The Blue Mermaid.
author: Mirabella G.

description:
First of all, what a great staff. Everyone I encountered smiled at us and gave us eye contact. It was as if they all loved working there.

The atmosphere was pleasant, not overpowering, like a TGIFridays. The music was at the perfect level and played fun old songs mostly from the 70s. 

Each time I'm served sourdough bread, I'm reminded that I don't like sourdough bread! I asked them to warm it up, as it was served cold, and it was better warm. Their butter is right out of the fridge, so it was too cold and hard to spread. I like my butter to be room temp.

The service was top notch. The calamari was a bit bland and arrived less that perfectly hot. The popcorn shrimp, on the other hand was nice and hot, and very good, even a little larger than most popcorn shrimp.

I had the special; swordfish steak with mash and green beans. The fish was pleasant, not the best, but enjoyable. The beans could have been cooked a little more. Wonderful mashed potatoes.

My guest had the Mahi Mahi. She said it could have been fresher and she didn't care for the Hawaiian relish on top (fresh fruit and such) but she loved the cole slaw.

I loved that they had creme brulee on the menu, however, I was left wishing I had tried the chocolate bread pudding. The brulee was decent, a little heavy, flavorful and perfect carmalization on top. It was served with a dusting of powdered sugar and a shortbread cookie, which was too lemony for my tastes.

Lunch for 2 with no drinks, 2 apps and a shared desert came to under $90. Nice location, near the hot spots of the Fisherman's Wharf area, but there are no views. I would eat here again, but I'd prolly try their chowder instead of an app, and I'd try their sandwiches instead of fish; or give the fish and chips a try, but I with the calamari, I didn't want more fried food.

Bonus points for using biodegradable flatware for to go items/doggie bags.
author: Penguin S.

description:
this is really just about the chowda....i got the sampler one....New England, shrimp and red pepper, and the crab and corn chowder.  they were all excellent.  the shrimp and red pepper had this nice little bite to it.  i could dip several loaves of bread into each one and be very, very happy.

the mac 'n cheez was average.  

this is one of my most boring reviews ever...what's wrong with me?
author: Miss P.

description:
The start of our Saturday Morning visiting San Francisco was wondering around site seeing, when we realized we wanted to grab some breakfast.  We walked around and found the Blue Mermaid Chowder House.  We had the option to sit in or outside, and since is was such a nice day, we decided we had to sit outside! It was in a nice little courtyard, so it wasn't too noisy or crowded.  Since it was a chowder house, and we were visiting San Fran, I decided I would have clam chowder for bfast.  Nope, they don't have it before 11:30.  We were there at 11, but it was still too early.  I decided to go with oatmeal, decided to be on the healthier side, since I had fish and chips the night before.  It was decent.  Its kind of hard to mess up on oatmeal after all.  It came with a little brown sugar, apples, and raisins.  The perfect things in oatmeal.  My cousin had an almond croissant, which she thought was good.  I can not remember what my aunt ordered, but I remember she liked her meal.  The waiter was very friendly, making sure we had water, and that we were doing okay.  He shared some jokes, which boosted the experience.  I would recommend this place for breakfast.  I guess they are owned by the hotel, as the waiter was telling us to stay there next time.  

Pros:
good food
good service
nice courtyard

Cons:
no clam chowder before 11:30
author: Zac B.

description: Loved it!!! I took my two sister's, brother-in-law and my 16 year old Nephew here, before the Daniel Tosh Comedy Central  taping. The service way awesome and the food was great. We sat on the patio and listened to this chick that sounded just like Jewel. Great experience and will most def be back :)
author: Seraphine W.

description:
No need to say more than...  Clam Chowder in Bread Bowl  and Pirate Shirts on the Waiters...

This place is like the Free Credit Report.com commercial
author: Jim R.

description: Recommended to me by a work colleague. We made it for happy hour after a very long walk along the Bay. Great chowder sampler (we got the crab/corn, shrimp and California clam) and all were scrumptious and $3 Anchor Steams. Great place to stop if you're having several small bites throughout the day.
author: Christine H.

description:
DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACEEE!!!

1. ordered the red pepper seafood chower, it was toooo cheesey and too salty. 
2. ordered the mahi mahi with fresh fruit: the salmon was way too dry
3. had a side of complementary bread: it was way too dry and tasted like it was aged and been kept out for days
4. the service was horrible For a table for 2 people. I was in there for 2 hours; waiting to get served, eat and getting the bill. It was one of the worst service I had. I did not go there on a special occasion day, but a normal afternoon for lunch.
5. This is one of the places i will NEVER go to again. 

I would give it a 0 star, but i can't..so 1 star
author: Kelly L.

description:
I cannot attest to the quality of the food here.  I can, however, attest to the weird-ass freaks who work here.

Sunday afternoon, my hunny and I wander in because occasionally we like to go around San Francisco pretending to be tourists.  It's a game my sister and I started back in high school, when we'd go up to Fisherman's Wharf and other tourist destinations and give ourselves fake names and fake accents and do cheesy tourist things because we were bored teenagers who loved clam chowder in a bread bowl.

It is because of clam chowder that we ended up at Blue Mermaid.  The hunny and I decided to check it out after the robot lady voice on our GoCar GPS system told us that Blue Mermaid won an award for its chowder.  And by "won an award," they actually mean, "Blue Mermaid gave us money to make you go to their restaurant."  But for 20% off our entire bill, we figured what the hey, it's worth a shot.

We walk in and we're waiting for a table and the "host" tells us we're going to have to wait another 10 minutes for a table.  "Why is that?  The restaurant's half empty."  "Well, because I have to let my waiters catch up!"  I look at my gf and we're like, nah, we don't want to wait 10 minutes for food-- we're starving and cold.  So we decide not to wait and as we're leaving, the host snaps his hip at us, rolls his eyes and gives us a "forget you, then" look.

Look, you bitchy *ss queen.  We live in the Castro and we're surrounded by da gay all the time, so don't give me your flamer diva attitude when you're the one who doesn't know how to host.  What the fuck do you mean you have to "let your waiters catch up?"  I have a suggestion.  How about you hire another waiter for your busy weekends or seat people with a glass of water and let them wait over a basket of bread?  Otherwise, don't take it personally when your customers don't want to wait unnecessarily for a seat at your half empty restaurant.  Really, it's not ABOUT you.  

Service at Nick's Lighthouse was better, except that I was trapped by strollers in a corner booth.  Is this is the kind of service that tourists get when they come to visit San Francisco?  Man, I feel sorry for them.  

Pretending to be tourists isn't as fun a game when you're older and more entitled and less willing to take other people's shit.
author: Diana Y.

description: Came here, got a tummy ache the next morning. Food was good and so was the service, but I doubt I'll have food here again.
author: Alex S.

description: Always go with your gut. Our waiter said the crab corn chowder was by far the best and that the Shrimp chowder was definitely not as good. One of us got the corn crab chowder one got the sampler (corn/shrimp/new England) I got new england. Out of her sampler my sister raved about the shrimp chowder. I tried it. It was the best. My new England clam chowder was fantastic too. My wedge salad was huge. Enough to split for sure. They don't skimp on the blue cheese crumbles either. Love that this nautical place is connected to the argonaut hotel. So cute. Lots of great photo ops in their lobby!!!!
author: T S.

description: The crab and corn chowder was excellent. Unfortunately, the fried seafood sampler appetizer was not good at all. Very geasy, and no flavor. Also the appetizer was supposed to come with popcorn shrimp, but they were out of it. I would go back only for the chowder.
author: Greg S.

description:
Since we found parking on this side of the wharf, we decided to give blue mermaid a shot.

I liked their "award winning" crab and corn chowder but only the first few bites.  The soup seemed to disappeared into the bread bowl soon after and I was left with chunks of potato and stuff.  

3 stars is really going to the crab cake which had SO much crab meat in it.  No fillers, just crab meat complimented with just a touch of flavor.  It's not fried but baked with a nicely breaded topping.  The plate was about $22 but I thought it was worth every penny.
author: Lily L.

description: This has been my favorite spot in San Francisco for about 10 years.  I always get the cold seafood platter for 2 which comes with crab, shrimp, mussels, clams, and a delicious horse-radish/red dipping sauce - the dish is served cold over ice, and my favorite thing to pair it with actually is the garlic french fries - it kind of helps to get down the all-seafood-platter I think :)  The service is great, the architecture of the brick building is beautiful, the outside patio is relaxing and lovely, and you'll love your food, I promise. I'll keep coming back here again and again, LOVE this place!
author: Jamie G.

description: We ordered the corn and crab chowder in the bread bowl and the calamari.    My husband insisted that he did not like chowder until he tried mine.  We both LOVED it!   The fried calamari was also delicious.  The restaurant is beautifully decorated and was very relaxing on a sunday afternoon at 1pm.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
We went to FW to get chowder and it was such chaos, dirty, just SO MANY people and so much food, it was hard to decide. 
The Blue Mermaid won out because of their happy hour (3.00 beer, wine and an assortment of small appetizers), and we thought we would try some of their New England chowder.

Ok, there is chowder that is made with cream and clam juice and herbs and fresh clams, and there is clam chowder made from a lot of thickeners, potatoes, and not so fresh clams. 
The Blue Mermaid sells one of the THE BEST NE clam chowders I've had to date, and I have tried quite a few. Thinner than some, but O so tasty, and the ingredients really stand out here as high quality. They'll give you a nice hunk of fresh and chewy sourdough to go with it, and some perfectly fresh cold butter to slather on it. 
If you want heaven, put some butter on that bread and then dip it into your steaming soup. Repeat. SO so good.

We also had some hot wings (five for 3.00, pretty typical pricing at .50 or so cents each) and fried calamari.

The Wings were good, meaty, standard. Could have been spicier, and I usually ask for tabasco but I didn't bother. I was having a good time escaping the chaos outside and enjoying the good atmosphere, beer and soup. If I'd stayed longer, or was hungrier, I might have placed another order and asked for Tabasco or extra wing sauce.

Calamari-a small portion, but good and fresh. Tender, not too much breading, very tasty. Enough for two people to nibble, as long as you order something to go with it.

They were very attentive and they kept our icy fresh glasses of water full.

I'll go for quality over quantity most days, and I'm glad we decided to give this place a try. There is no doubt that I would go back here on my next trip.

PS-I liked the Anchor Steam beer better than the Hef.
author: Shindy P.

description: I have to say this place reputation really exceeds its actual quality. Calomori were over batter and hard. Full crab was gutted out leaving no flavor and very litte to eat, steak was over cook and small(not even a quality cut from ranches like harrison), and seafood platter was mostly cold raw shell fish( absolutely over price with no taste). I would avoid this place and try something else like scomas next door or try the open market down the street.
author: Van S.

description:
I went here last night with my family to celebrate my mom's birthday. She wanted to do something different and so on suggestion from my sister, we ended up here. I wish I could find something to bitch about, since it was very pricey, but I really could not. The food was great and the waiter was awesome. I've never had Dungeness Crab Cakes before, but those were awesome, nevermind the price. My family enjoyed their dishes as well. It wasn't at all crowded when we got there at 6:30 on a Friday.

I probably wouldn't come here every time I'm in Fisherman's Wharf, but if I wanted to splurge and someone suggested seafood, I'd come again.
author: Chris S.

description: After three years of occasionally coming here with colleagues I never had a wow experience. It always seems to be their first week open and no one knows what is going on. The food is mediocre at best and I've had my order screwed up twice ( I don't ask for anything out of the norm). No May no Onions, please...!
author: Dee C.

description:
dropped by for some crab and corn chowder.

award winning?

i don't know about that.

very very salty soup.   what about the crab?  not really any in sight.  corn?  really none of that either.

seemed like just a lot of cream, and a lot of mushy onion bits.

it's $9 for a serving.  $11 with a bread bowl.  for that price i expect something great, yet they failed to deliver something even enjoyable.

the service was good though, and very courteous and attentive.
author: Danni J.

description: Try the chowder sampler. Our waiter was a nice guy. Didn't care for my salmon though; it was a bit dry.
author: Dee N.

description: We came here for breakfast because we were staying at the Argonaut hotel. I contacted the hotel a week before coming via an online chat with one of their representatives. I wanted to know if there was a restaurant at the hotel and whether or not they could accommodate my allergies. In addition to having celiac I also cannot have soy or lactose. The rep assured me that the chef would be able to have something for me and that they would make sure to get some bread so that I could have toast in the morning. So with that all set I figured no problem- right? We arrived at the hotel and they had put out a plate of veggies and hummus in our room with a note that said " let us know if you need any help in finding GF restaurants." I thought great- they got the message! The next morning we went in for breakfast and I felt like we had entered the land of NO. I explained that I had made previous contact and the waiter said they knew nothing about this. Any bread? No. Ok so I would order eggs and potatoes. He said the potatoes had spice on them that had gluten so I could not have that either. Needless to say I was not happy. Afterwards the manager came over and apologized. We talked and he said that really they don't get a lot of requests for GF. Really? Then why are they listed as having GF on other sites? Is it such a big deal to keep some GF bread in the freezer for those of us who eat breakfast there? The manager was very apologetic, but not much he could do about it. If you have allergies and are celiac, find somewhere else to go!
author: S S.

description: Great crab and corn chowder!  Went great w house Chardonnay!  Caesar salad so-so...
author: Diane T.

description: I loved their Crab and Corn Chowder in a bread bowl!!!! Yummy! Had it twice on our trip, I know why they've won awards for it! Had their calamari and was a bit chewy--so a disappointed on that.  But otherwise I would highly recommend trying thier chowder...they have a $12 speical where you can try all three! I'm going to try that next time--just couldn't pull myself away from the crab and corn :)
author: Beth B.

description: Can't really comment on the food because despite a number of empty tables they would not push a couple of tables together to accommodate 2 adults and 9 teenagers. Ten minutes later when a couple of girls came out of the restroom all the tables were still empty. Really an unfriendly place.
author: Lisa W.

description: Returned here after a great visit 2 years ago. Unlike Cabernet this place hasn't improved with age. The first thing you noticed was a distinct burnt food smell. It was prominent for the entire visit. The food was still 4 star...try the crab and corn chowder and the wedge salad. The service was barely 2 star. Very slow....it took 20 minutes to get 6 oysters. At one point 2 servers were sitting at the bar for 5 minutes while only one person was working. Oh yeah the place was only half full. Needs some work.
author: Rick C.

description: The Food was ok, but the server we had its the worst, ether he was high on something or didn't get enough sleep.
author: George M.

description:
CHOWDA!!!!   is what I scream while shaking fists in the air and knees dropping to the floor...saddened that it died in this tourist trap restaurant.

Since this place opened, I've wanted to try their award winning chowder.  I was sadly dissappointed when I visited this place.  First off, the service is horrible.  I waited in the entryway for quite some time before I was even acknowledged.  The bar didn't have a bartender for over 10 mins and when he did show up, he just got what I needed and left the bar again.  When I finally was seated, the waitress rushed me into ordering.  It was as if I was bothering her while she was working...rolling eyes, shortness with responses, and saying why don't you just get this.  It was so hard to get their attention for a glass of water.  The dishes sat at the table, uncleared, until someone else brought the food.  Staff basically ignores you unless you have to pay.

SO now onto the food...
I ordered the manila clams for an appetizer.  It was a descent size plate.  Too bad it didn't taste good.  Everyone I know can't wait to dip bread into the broth that clams/mussels are cooked in.  I couldn't even bring myself to do that.  It was so watery and bland...UGH!  Next came the "award winning chowder".  I thought to myself..how the hell did this win an award?  It was so watery, and the pesto stuff they put on top made it oily and watery.  AND it tasted like bacon...not dungeoness crab and corn.  I love bacon, but I wasn't expecting it to be the main flavor in my chowder.  So so sad.  I also tried the crab sandwich.  It was nothing spectacular.  I could've made it myself with a big heap of canned crab...probably better tasting and much cheaper.  That is what it tasted like.  

I'm not going back and won't recommend anyone to visit it.
author: Miss T.

description:
My standards that night were low.  I'd just riden 20+ miles on a bike towing 50lbs of dogs and trailer and I really just wanted to feed the beast that was my belly.  I learned about this place from visiting tourists that I met on the Ferry ride back from Tiburon.  They (the Tennessee Tourists) raved about the clam chowder and seeing the outdoor seating and the heat lamps, I stuffed 2 dogs under the table and made myself comfortable!  

The 4 of us dining that night ordered a wealth of appetizers: chicken wings, popcorn chicken and mussels before we each got a bowl of the famed clam chowder. They had a bunch to choose from - the classic, the Californian plus at least 5-6 others.  They even offered a sampler as a menu choice (your choice of 3). I was most delighted with the mussels and found them to be excellent.  The chicken wings were pretty standard and the popcorn chicken was okay as well.  I wouldn't have been able to notice a difference if they'd just ordered a bunch from KFC.  The chowder itself (I got the classic) was pretty good - lots of flavor, but I probably could have gotten similar for $5 less from a stand on the street.  You'll most likely be pretty partial to whatever chowder you end up ordering.  My friend loved the Californian one, but I found it rather bland ... and she thought the classic I had was overwhelming in flavor ... I think it's just that we both got used to our own food.  

The waiter that served us that night was super.  Very helpful, very friendly and very tolerant of us sitting around for at least 30 minutes before ordering food cause we were waiting for our 4th.  All in all, it was a great way to end a long day.  Decent food, sitting outside under heat lamps, bottle of wine and great conversation.  All thanks to those Tennessee Tourists.
author: Kathleen W.

description: Perfect spot for lunch, especially if you're on the go and need something quick! Between two people, I was able to load up on some bread, eat some delicious steamed mussels, have a bowl of the New England Clam Chowda with lots and lots of nicely sized cut clams (as well as two still in their shell), and I was able to eat some of the fantastic corn and crab chowda. With beer, it was a satisfying lunch for just the right price. The service was excellent, too. I am definitely coming back! Didn't think a cool spot like this would exist in the touristy part of town, but it was a pleasant surprise.
author: Caroline L.

description:
I've been here about three times. I had a friend come in from out of town recently who really wanted clam chowder. I remembered this place & figured I'd be able to find parking and also, I remember it not to be overly busy. It was on a Sunday night in January.

I really stay away from a bread bowl. I think the concept is cool for a tourist, but as an SF native, I think dunkin' the sourdough bread or eating it to the side of the soup, is just fine with me.

My stomach can't take much cream, so I ate some of the crab and corn chowder & it was good. My friend had the sampler and not really sure if it filled him up. I had a side salad with this as well, and it filled me up. 

If you are hungry and want just chowder, you may want to get the sampler (pick off what your friend doesn't eat in their bowl) & some dessert. That's exactly what he did. Sitting up a the bar was cool and comfortable.
author: M M.

description: Very cool place and location, I went January 2010. Great for a late afternoon beer and some tasty clam chowder.  Take a walk down the nearby municipal pier afterward for a beautiful bay view to see the bay bridge and golden gate from one vista.
author: Eva B.

description: Another seafood lunch/snack stop with the fam. The decor is a little cheesy nautical but hey. Our waiter was a little strange but friendly. I ended up having a bloody mary, half a dozen oysters and the New England clam chowder. The chowder didn't really have many clams in it which was a bummer but it still tasted good, just wish they used less filler.
author: Sascha M.

description: Stopped by Easter Sunday for a late lunch. A gorgeous day to sit outside. Our waiter was excellent, very attentive and friendly. The food was delicious. Hubs had the award winning crab and corn chowder and he really liked it. I had the popcorn shrimp...cooked to perfection (shrimp is often overcooked, but not this time) and the spicy coating was delicious. Definitely recommend!
author: Melanie P.

description:
The Wife and I escaped to San Francisco to escape the gloom of another Seattle weekend and we got lucky with some fine weather. What better way to enjoy some sunshine than to enjoy the outdoor patio at Blue Mermaid? 

I ordered the Dungeness Salad Sandwich while The Wife had a house salad and a cup of the Dungeness and Corn Chowder. My sandwich was a pleasant combination of grilled sourdough and crab salad with a side of fries tossed with garlic and parsley. 

I got a taste of The Wife's salad and chowder. The salad was quite large but overly dressed with a tart vinaigrette (why do restaurants do this every time?) but the chowder was an extreme hit! That combination of flavors with the basil (?) oil floating on top was memorable and I will make it a point to come here for a bowl on my next visit! 

The service was efficient and friendly. There was a guitarist playing at the other end of the courtyard providing a perfect compliment to the entire experience.
author: Joe B.

description: I've come to eat clam chowder here every time I'm in town. Sometimes, my main purpose for going to the wharf is just to eat chowder. Haha. I LOVE this place. The service is great and the food is fantastic! I definitely tell all my friends to try this place out whenever they go to SF.
author: Jukers M.

description: Tried the award winning crab and corn chowder.  My goodness, it was the saltiest chowder I have ever eaten.  It took three glasses of water to get it down.  The crab cakes were ok at best.  $60 for two chowders and two appetizers.  Never again.
author: Anne D.

description:
My family and I visited this restaurant last night. So many things to talk about!
1. When we walked in I tried going to the host station as we had made reservations for 6. The host met us halfway with two menus in hand. I told him that we have reservations for 6 at 7p. He didn't even ask for my name or anything and just seated us. I had made some special requests as it was our two year anniversary and my mother's birthday. We got married at The Argonaut hotel 2 years ago. The host wouldn't have known this as he didn't check us in.
2. After he has seated us he says very quietly (the restaurant was loud) that a server would be with us soon. For once my husband and I were early for dinner and my parents late. No one had spoken to us until well after my parents arrived. No water, no bread, not even a drink! 
3. My folks sat down and we all began looking at the menu. We finally get some water and the waiter walks away. Five or so minutes later he arrives with bread and asks us if we want anything to drink. We order a bottle of wine and look over the menu some more. At least 10 minutes goes by after the wine has been served and the waiter takes our order. The food comes pretty quickly; 3 salads and 2 soups. No one asks if we want pepper on our food so we notice the pepper mill close to the table and help ourselves... Thus far I am not impressed by the service. Oh! I forgot to mention that when my parents did walk in the host tried to seat them at a completely different table. Again, he did not check them in either or they would have been sent to the right table. FAIL!
4. At least half way through our starters did we finish our bottle of wine. No one had been to our table since the starters had been served. No one asked if everything tasted okay or anything. My father had dropped his fork and could not flag down our waiter or anyone else for that matter. He got up and found someone and had a fork brought to the table. As I said, no one had been by to check on us or to find out if we needed anything.
5. The entrees had arrived, but not all our plates had been cleared. Some fumbling with the dishes, but everyone's food looked great. The waiter left the table, but had a helper to bring all the entrees at once. My father then asked if we could order another bottle of wine. The other server/waiter said that he would inform our waiter of our request. We have not seen our waiter and were wondering if the other waiter had told him about the wine. My father was getting annoyed by this point as he likes to eat his meal hot and with wine. Finally the waiter comes over and says that we drank the last bottle of the wine we previously ordered. He brought another bottle with him and it was fine of course. We're not picky wine drinkers. My father is a known asshole when it comes to things not being right at restaurants. 
6. He says to the waiter in the most douchebag of tones, "Look, I like to have my meal hot whilst I drink my wine. I couldn't find you to order sooner, but you have not been very available all evening so far. I've read on yelp that the reviews suck and this is why." SO EMBARRASSING! He goes on and on to the waiter and the waiter says nothing. Yes, he hasn't been available for most of the evening, but there is a time and place to mention those things. Like after dinner!!! The tone is also how he makes people feel bad. He's a little aspy, but that is no excuse to treat someone that way. 
7. I told my father he was being an asshole and he says to me, "If I'm going to be paying this much money for food I want damn good service!" I told him that I completely agree, but he's embarrassed us all and pretty much ruined the evening. I felt bad for the waiter and went up to him and apologized for my raging asshole of a father. He said it's okay, I should have been more available. I said be that as it may, there are ways to treat people, a time and a place, and also tone. The waiter was very sweet.
8. We had planned on walking through the lobby of the hotel to remember the good times, but I was too annoyed and went to fetch the car.
Overall, the service was not great and the food was good. We may or may not be coming back here... Certainly not with my father.
author: Melissa B.

description: Funny thing was that my friend and I were craving some clam chowder to which he says, "OMG I have to take you here." And so we went. We split the Smoked Salmon Scrambled which is part of the brunch menu and is so tasty. Seriously, it's delicious. Then we each had a small Dungeness Crab and Corn Chowder which is so good. The meal was fantastic but really you should go for that chowder because it's so worth it.
author: Shauna S.

description:
We've had lunch here a few times and each time it was delicious. They have several different kinds of chowder but the crab and corn chowder is so amazing I haven't ever got past it to try any others. It is buttery, sweet, creamy a little salty and topped with a yummy swirl of a pesto oil that just brings it all together perfectly. They have a rustic indoor cafe and a patio that opens up into the Cannery area where you can often eat and listen to live music on the weekends. The crab sandwich on fresh sourdough is also tasty. Slightly grilled with cheese, tomatoes and stuffed with sweet fresh crab.  It came with garlic/parsley fries. Nice thin, crispy fries and just enough garlic for flavor not drowning in garlic oil like alot of restaurants seem to do.
The drinks are a little pricey but then again it's at the Wharf so your gonna pay more. I've always had good service, they are very friendly and knowledgeable.
author: Ang x.

description: Charming restaurant right on Fisherman's Wharf area. The sticker shock of menu items was abated after we realized the actually have a lot of favorites for $8-$12, especially their 5 chowders. We had 2 of them (California and Crab & Corn) and they were great: yummy with lots of fresh tasting ingredients. The service and ambiance are top flight. And the location can't be beat. We'll be back!
author: Ray M.

description: Great chowder but a little on the spendy side. I had the new england clam chowder and my parents had the crab and corn chowder. The bill was a little over $50.
author: Leanne S.

description: Delicious New England clam chowder. Atmosphere is nice and waitresses have great customer service.
author: Antoinette C.

description:
My bf and I were out strolling fisherman's wharf and on the hunt for some chowder. We walked past this place a few times before deciding to just go inside and sit down.

It a little restaurant off a hotel, and all the waiters were stripped shirts that I think make them look like "waldo". But the chowder.... oh the chowder was just awesome. I ordered the crab and corn chowder, and my boyfriend had the california chowder, both in bread bowls of course! We liked the chowder so much that we planned to come back for more.... sadly this was new years day the chowder house was closed :(   But I guarantee we'll be back for more the next time we come to town.
author: Danielle C.

description: Had breakfast here twice during a stay at the Argonaut Hotel. The service was quick and friendly, the food was fresh and tasty, loved the striped sailor shirts - I would definitely eat here again.
author: Lorry P.

description:
The dining room had only one other full table but the pigeon walking around picking up scraps from the dining room floor should have given me a clue that all may not be right...This proved to true with bad service and bad food! 

One exception was the crab and corn chowder - amazing!  It was good enough to bring me back another night and get a cup to go.

My ahi fish was an unappetizing gray, obviously not grilled and raw in the center, even though I had ordered well done.  The restaurant appeared to have plenty of help but our waiter was disinterested and absent for much of the meal.  I had to flag a busboy to have my food recooked.  When he brought the recooked fish our waiter looked pained, but no apology - nothing.

Another server wished us 'good evening' as we left.  When I commented that the meal was a disappointment and I would not recommend the restaurant, his reply was simply 'good night'.  That says a lot about customer service for a restaurant associated with the upscale and first-class Hotel Argonaut.
author: Janed B.
