description: Not good quality. The ingredients in the chowders (we tried 2--the shrimp and pepper, and the corn and crab) did not seem fresh and local...in fact we kept trading, because we weren't sure if we'd each received the right ones. The penne with shrimp and scallops was very disappointing---both the shrimp and bay scallops were small and not appetizing...they looked shriveled and frozen from a bag.  Hubby's salmon was very overcooked and tasteless. Especially in San Francisco, we expect better from seafood. Service was spotty at best (though friendly), and we noticed apologies for confusion and slowness to many tables around us. The waiter, sensing our disappointment and seeing my still full plate, discounted our meal at his discretion, not any complaint from us. I have been to many many Kimptons and always enjoy the attached restaurants. The Kimpton should push for better quality from this restaurant, as it brings their image down.
author: Karen B.

description:
eh.

Crab's in season, so I went with the crab louie salad....not much crab.  The butter lettuce had some dark edges.  They put a whole egg on there.  I like that.  Good dressing.

Only 4 beers on tap.  I need at least 10.  Or 12.  I like the options.

Dad liked his crab sandwich.  

eh.
author: Holly F.

description: The place is pretty cool. Nice atmosphere and good food. The presentation was nice. The server, Brian, was REALLY on top of things. We had reservations and ran late because of bridge traffic, but still got seated right away. I would come back but wouldn't make it my regular stop.
author: Eric W.

description: Went there w/ a friend this past Saturday for lunch while walking around Fishermans wharf...long story short it was "ok".  The clam chowder bowl had tasty bread but the chowder was just "ok" and then i had the dungenous crab sandwish which really wasnt that good compared to what i'm used to in a seafood salad style sandwich.  They did however give us a complimentary order of pop corn shrimp which i couldnt stop eating and the wait staff was super cool...so that helped make it a good lunch stop.  Don't believe I'd go back if i was visiting again however.
author: Sean W.

description:
2 1/2 stars. I got the crab and corn chowder because it has won awards (says so on the menu and I'm pretty sure I saw it on the Food Network). I should have known by the waiter laughing at that notion. Anyway, it was nothing I'd order again, and I love a good clam chowder. I had the crab louie with it. Again, OK, but I expected better in San Francisco.

My daughter had fish and chips served in a little bucket with the tartar sauce in a shovel. Cute, but also $8.00, which is high for a kiddie meal.
author: Erin O.

description:
Was pleasantly surprised with this place.  Wasn't expecting much as we thought it was just a tourist trap but we really wanted some chowder and crack some seafood and dip it in butter, cocktail, tarter sauce, etc., etc.....  

So we just decided to just try it and we had a great meal.  Tasty chowder, fresh seafood, flavorful beer.....  Damn, that is the life!  

And it was not so terribly expensive that we felt we were like tourists getting ripped the hell off.  

I mean, this is definitely better than most of the crab stands we have tried for sure.......
author: Mark W.

description: A Steady ....Pretty good. Not bad but not amazing. Polite wait staff. Nice to get away from the touristy crowds.
author: Jeannine C.

description: One of my favorite places to re-visit when in SF.  Chowder is delicious and not heavy with meaty clams.  Raw bar selection was ample and fresh.  Location in the Wharf area is a bonus.
author: Kevin L.

description: In a city where there are sooo many restaurants to choose from, it's unusual for me to return to a place, but The Blue Mermaid made that short list. Casual (good for kids), decently priced, GREAT chowder (which is what I come for).  I've had the chowder sampler each time I visited, but will go for a full bowl of the California Chowder the next time I'm here. Filled with clams, potatoes and green beans and topped with a drizzle of cilantro oil, it's like no other chowder I've ever had!
author: Barbara K.

description: Crab cakes were the best we have ever had. Popcorn shrimp as an appetizer was both generous and delicious. Ironically, the chowder was good but not memorable. Would recommend, especially given the convenient location.
author: Conrad S.

description:
Blue Mermaid was on our list of places to check out while visiting San Francisco. Nice sunny day - sat outside and did a bit of people watch. We had the housemade chowder sampler (New England Chowda', Manhattan Chowda' and California Clam Chowder) and they were pretty tasty! New England Chowda' was the best!! 

We're visiting San Francisco again in October and a stop at Blue Mermaid for some housemade chowders is a MUST!
author: Niki V.

description: California Chowder was excellent!!! Shrimp Cocktail was great in presentation but lacking the key component " flavor ". It may have been the beer "Blue Moon" throwing my taste buds off.  I'll come back because everything can't be perfect all the time. Or can it?
author: James H.

description:
My wife and I like this place.  It has a nice, warm feeling at the bar which is especially good when the wharf gets cold and foggy.  Get a couple of bowls of chowder, a basket of popcorn shrimp, and a side of fries.  Throw in a couple of beers and some white wine, and you've got a nice dinner for two.

Those shirts the bartenders wear crack me up.  Everyone who says Free Credit Report.com is spot on!  Staff is friendly, though, and seems to be happy.
author: David S.

description: Be sure to try the California Clam chowder. A hint of roasted red pepper purée, baby asparagus and some corn in a creamy base with clams.
author: Matt P.

description: After walking along the wharf looking for a place to have a bread bowl we stopped to look at the menu outside Blue Mermaid and liked what we saw. Our waitress was very nice and friendly although I can't remember her name. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer and that was very good! We each had our bread bowl: Jason had the shrimp and red pepper chowder and I had the Dungeness crab and corn chowder. They were both perfect for us and very filling! I actually had a side order of succotash and that was interesting since I've never had that before. I would have been filled with the bread bowl alone but I wanted to try something new. Unfortunately I was not able to finish everything and we both left the restaurant with food on our plates. There wasn't anything we could complain about. The location was convenient, our server was terrific, the price was reasonable, and the restaurant was clean. I honestly would go back and/or recommend this place to friends. I only gave it 4 stars out of 5 because I've had bread bowls at other places around the area and although the Blue Mermaid makes a delicious bread bowl it wasn't THE best thing I've had. But as I've said, I would go back because of the level of service and the good food.
author: Jensen B.

description: I had the popcorn shrimp and it was great.  I was very disappointed with the New England clam chowder because it had way too much celery and too little clams in it. Overall, it was a nice facility, the staff was a bit overwhelmed (slow) but very friendly.
author: Tony C.

description: Food is not bad. The sevice was just fine. This place is pricey, but what do u expect. It's pier 39. Overall not a bad place since weve been there a couple of times.
author: Russell T.

description: We came here for my sister's birthday last week.  Although it was on the Embarcadero, it was a nice blend of trendy with "pier-like" ambiance that made for a festive atomosphere.  The crab and corn chowder was everything that it was touted to be and the seafood platter was enough to share among 8 people.  Overall, it was a great experience and a good place to have dinner with a large group.
author: Love P.

description: I'd have given this place 5 stars if the service had been a little better. Waiter was not on point and dropped the ball on a few of our orders. Excellent varieties of chowder, I recommend the crab and corn.
author: DJ. M.

description:
Even though this place is a bit touristy, it was in our neighborhood, so it fell in our dining radius.  I've only sat on the patio, the interior seems a little too Long John Silvers for me.

The macaroni and cheese id wonderful here, as well as the green beans. The chowders are hit and miss, some being more palatable to varying tastes. The drinks are a bit spendy, but a decent pour.

Its definitely catered towards touristas, but on the weeknights you can listen to live performances in the del monte plaza and sit under the stars... ahem... fog.
author: Inga R.

description:
I am sorry to say my experience is more like Nina Q's below.  Although I cannot comment on the food, I certainly was not impressed with the service.

I had heard this place had good clam chowder.  My boyfriend and I were in town for the Fourth of July, so after the fireworks, we decided to wait out the traffic by getting a bowl of soup.  The host/manager who seated us was very pleasant and we were seated right away.  And then we waited... and waited... and waited.  

No less than two waiters, three busboys and a manager walked by our table in the time we were there and did not greet us or ask if we had been helped.  But, we were tired and just happy to have a place to rest before heading back to our hotel.  After about ten minutes, I was curious to know how long it would take before we got service.  Well, after no less than 30 (THIRTY) minutes, we weren't tired any more and we decided to leave.

And yes, we could have flagged someone down, but one of the six employees who passed our table should have taken the initiative to greet us.

I informed the hostess/manager on my way out that no one had been to our table.  She didn't seem very surprised but did offer a "I'm sorry, they need to work on that."  

This place could have the best clam chowder in the entire world, but it  is not worth the terrible service.
author: Caroline H.

description: They literally had no vegetarian options last time I was here. The kitchen had to make pasta with butter so I could at least eat something.
author: Jenny U.

description: We tried their sampler of chowders and we all liked the crab and corn chowder.  We ordered more of that soup for each of us.  The server was friendly and helped us by suggesting the sampler so we could decide which soup we wanted.
author: Terri S.

description:
Finally had a chance to check this place out.  I'm glad I did for the clam chowder.  It was great.  Thick but not too thick, loads of flavor and even a few full claims on top.  Could have used a few crackers but that's my fault as I was eating the chowder too fast.  :)  

Rest of the meal was average tourist quality.  I prob wouldn't go back for the regular menu, but I will be going back for the chowder.  It beats all the bread bowl chowder out on the streets of Fisherman's Wharf.   We had linguini & shrimp that was marginal.  We had popcorn shrimp that were pretty good.  The garlic bread was burnt and cold.  Burnt is bad enough, but cold too?  Not sure how a cook could send it out like that.  

Good, friendly service.  It was a bit odd how we had two different menus at the same table.   Didn't know which one to order off of.  :)  

In the end the name says it all:  Chowder House.   

Bar with the game on looked nice but I had the little people in tow so I couldn't exercise my right to drink.  Next time it'll be chowder and adult beverages for sure.
author: LeftCoast Y.

description: Had breakfast here while staying at the attached hotel. First cup of coffee was burnt, like it was brewing from the day before. My wife had the quiche which was ice cold on the inside, took 15 minutes to flag down our waiter to get it fully heated. I had the eggs benedict with crab meat, it was pretty good but not memorable. Nearly every (cloth) seat in the place was dirty and stained. Only ate one meal here in our 3 night stay.
author: J G.

description: Great value for Fisherman's Wharf. Two blocks down from the Hyde and Powell Cable Car. Excellent clam and corn chowder, oysters rockefeller and $3 H/Hour beer and wine from 3pm-6pm. $3 app's fried clams and calamare were great! Steve and Chris behind the bar were very entertaining and sociable. We went there 3 times last week due to the local atmosphere and the good customer service.
author: Bob G.

description: Had buffet style breakfast and lunch. Food was ok. Not a huge assortment of food. The chowder wasn't impressive. Wouldn't recommend the place when there's plenty of other establishments around.
author: Alex T.

description: Do you like soups and food from the sea?!  Then you must come here because this is THE place to be to try out their famous California clam chowder!  I love soups and could drink this all day.  It's creamy but not too think and flavorful but not too salty.  Order the cup instead of the bread bowl to save room for their other good eats like their other seafood selection or the comfort taste of fish and chips.  However, if you're a big fan of soup like me and dont care for carbs, get the clam chowder in the bread bowl.  Heck, get two of them....hahaha
author: ben c.

description: I really liked this place. We chose it after looking @the menu next door and getting a surly "you'll pay twice as much for the exact same thing over there" from the guy sitting outside the door to that dank, dark looking place. Hey, if that's what it takes to get a menu that is NOT smudged with sticky, greasy residues I guess that's just what you have to do. It was certainly a touch touristy in terms of decor and ambience, but not cheesily so. I was comfortable, clean, bright. Their coffee is really good, juice appeared to be fresh squeezed. Food was also very good. My only complaint is that my omelet was supposed to have avocado on it, but didn't. However, it was so good anyway that I didn't realize that until an hour or two after we left and it randomly crossed my mind. Service was attentive, but we were also not rushed at all, so that was definitely A+! Good spot for Fishermans Wharf if you want something that's got a little tourist charm factor w/o all the bustle and homogeneity of a lot of the other places in that area.
author: Abby D.

description: When you go, be sure to try the Crab and Corn Chowder- out of this world good! The staff was very friendly and the prices very reasonable! We will be going back for sure.
author: Cindy T.

description:
Try the Corn/Clam Chowder....fantastic! 
It is topped off with a drizzle of olive oil.
Every time we go there...it's our first stop. 

I have eaten Chowder all along the west coast (from Seattle to San Diego) and this is the best.
author: monica p.

description: We dont often venture down to this area or eat in restaurants here but in this case, we're glad we did.  We have now eaten at the Blue Mermaid twice and both times, the crab and corn chowder was absolutely delicious.  Growing up here, I've eaten dungeness crab in just about every way imaginable. The chowder here is flavorful and creamy and showcases the flavor of the crab.  Served in a San Francisco sourdough bread bowl, it's local comfort food at its best.  We're even willing to brave the tourists to come and eat here again!
author: Lynn S.

description: The fish tacos were good but the salad was on the boring side.
author: Alan B.

description:
The interior was a little dark, but it offered that cozy vibe while dining. My group and I ate there during lunch. The service was excellent! The restaurant wasn't remotely busy, so that allowed our waiter, Steve to be very attentive to our table. 

I tried the sampler: Dungeness Crab and Corn, Manhattan, and Shrimp and Red Pepper. Of all the three, the Dungeness was my favorite. I'm used to having creamy, thick chowder and the ones I tried were a little more watery than what I'm used to. 

It's not the best Chowder House, but I did like the fact they offered six different types of chowder. I would recommend to give the restaurant a try. I would recommend to try it there at lunch time- the price isn't as expensive.
author: regina c.

description: Maybe it was the rainy weekend, but I loved my visit here.  I tried the chowder sampler along with a glass of white wine and I was as happy as a clam (sorry, bad pun).  It was cold, gray, and foggy outside, but it was warm and happy inside.
author: Marnie S.

description: Hate the warf but love this place! Best happy hour in the warf, 3 bucks for everything, awesome crab n corn chowder. Omar is the friendliest bartender ever born and Mike has a magical wink that comes with every order that'll turn you into a die hard fan of this place for life. Order up squidward!!!!
author: Mike S.

description: We were enjoying playing tourist for the day and decided that we wanted some clam chowder.  A short walk from Fisherman's Wharf and just slightly off the beaten tourist path Blue Mermaid fit the bill nicely.  I was surprised that there weren't more people in there for lunch, especially since this restaurant is attached to a hotel.  I ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl and it was absolutely fantastic.  My soup was  rich, creamy, not too thick, and filled with tons of clams...I was loving my lunch.  Everyone else seemed to be enjoying their lunches too.  Service could have been more attentive, it took several attempts to get refills on our drinks and the bill took forever to arrive.  Overall it was a great lunch enjoyed with great friends.  Next time I'm sitting at their outdoor patio, it should be really nice on a warm SF day.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Stick with the chowder as the restaurant name implies. Otherwise, we
started with crab appetizer served in a soup bowl with a dollop of seafood sauce which had been topped with a dollop of horseradish which meant the first bite of the crab cleans out your sinus. It was too bad the server didn't mention it would be hot or that the kitchen didn't mix the two better~ $17.00. Should have had the chowder sampler for $10 which I asked the next door diners about and they raved about it. The calamari was sent back as being overcooked. Replaced offering was less cooked and the breading was mealy because of that. The calamari was rubbery and greasy ~$13.00. Special of the day was $24.00 swordfish smothered in a cheesey topping which rendered the fish flavor undetectable. The tilapia was a huge portion set upon chive/garlic mashed potatoes, but the fish was indistiguishable in taste from cod or snapper unfortunately, $24.00. Hoping to score with dessert we were disappointed with Pot de creme which can only be described as hospital cafeteria quality chocolate pudding. The service was constant and friendly, but the product was sorely inadequate. Unexpected for a restaurant with a nautical motif.
author: Simon B.

description: This is one of my favorite places to have an amazing cheeseburger or the best crab and corn chowder I have ever tasted. It is located right next to the Argonaut Hotel and very convenient for me because I work on Fisherman's Wharf. The staff have always been amazing and very helpfull with anything I needed. Thanks to all my servers over the last 5 years. You all Rock.
author: Jimmy A.

description: Five stars for the Crab and Corn Chowder, it is truly to DIE FOR!!! highly recommended! Shout out to Dillion the waitstaff for friendliness and dinner suggestions.
author: VidanoVa R.

description:
What a disappointment!  I was looking forward to a great Mother's Day brunch, but Blue Mermaid didn't even come close to par.  The only good food I had was the New England Chowda.  (I'll give them the benefit of the doubt & assume that all their chowdas are good.)  I had the crab sandwich which was mediocre  and a Caesar salad without the dressing tossed.  Not to be complicated, but I find it hard to toss dressing on a salad that's on a plate.  
I also tasted their beer battered fish which tasted too bitter!  My daughter had the grilled cheese, but the cheese was barely melted!  Not to mention they forgot to give her drink.  
As my husband asked how their cioppino is prepared, our server explains to us what cioppino is.  Note to servers:  if you don't know how a food is made, just honestly say so.  No harm done.  The cioppino came in with hearty portions of meat but tasted smoky.  
It was such a horrible dining experience that I didn't even bother trying their desserts.  


P.S.
FYI-Parking is horrible around this area.  You still need to feed the meters on Sunday.
author: Jo B.

description: Good calamrie. Chowder good but not sure why people are so attrracted to this area.
author: Rey T.

description: We went to the Blue Mermaid on Sunday night for dinner.  We were there around 8pm and waited about 40 minutes for a table.  We enjoyed a drink at the bar while we were waiting.  The drinks are good, fast service and bar tender was nice.  Once seated we did wait about 10 minutes before service, which made us wonder if we should have just eaten at the bar.  But once we had first contact, the waiter was there prompt the rest of the time (and we did not say anything about the wait).  We had the Dungeness Crab & Corn Chowder, Popcorn shrimp, 1/2 Dungeness Crab and  Garlic-Parmesan Fries.   The Chowder was good, we liked that it had bacon in it, but were bummed that there was not much crab in it.  The popcorn shrimp was really good, very fresh and not chewy at all.  I wish I got the full Dungeness Crab as I could have kept eating that, it was sooooo good.  We could have done without the fries because they were too salty.   Its a casual restaurant, good with kids.  It was very clean and the staff were very friendly.  I wish I could go back and try more items off of there menu.  Overall a good experience.
author: Christine T.

description: Very good cracked crab. Not "watery" like some places. Outstanding Cioppino. The chowders are good, but over-rated on sites. (Then again, I am from the East Coast---it's tough to compete with that.) Service a little haphazard. Overall, excellent food and one of the best choices in the touristy fisherman's wharf.
author: Bryan S.

description: My family and I had a great dinner at the Mermaid. We tried a number of items including the Crab and Corb chowder and NE Chowder. Both were fantastic. My boys ordered the popcorn shrimp and the very generous order was more than there very large appetites could finish. My son said he even loved the lettuce garnish!  We had the Cioppino and the Mahi with the Pineapple salsa. The Cioppino was loaded with dungeness crab, calamari, clams, shrimp, tuna, mussels in a spicy red sauce.  Mussels were marginal but the crab was sweet. The Mahi was excellent but too much pineapple. And they ran out of Anchor Steam. Food was a 4, service was very friendly, but I was looking forward to that beer (3).
author: Gregory C.

description: We had a large party of 20 for a birthday celebration last week. The food and service were excellent.  Our waiter was very attentive and always answered with "absolutely."  All of us ordered the chowder and we all thought it was delicious, hot and very tasty. Everyone enjoyed the appetizers and meals.  We would all come back again.
author: Lori L.

description: We were very pleasantly surprised by the Blue Mermaid. We happened to be in the area, and like most San Franciscans, we avoid Fisherman's Wharf as much as possible, but we decided to give it a try.  The place was almost empty on a Friday night, which didn't bode well. However, our waiter was perfect combination of professionalism and friendliness, and the food was really fresh and excellent.  We had the calimari, cobb salad and ciopino.  All fresh, tasty and not overly seasoned. The drinks were great too; my wife had a perfect non-alcholic mojito.  If you're in the area, Blue Mermaid is worth a try.
author: D D.

description: This is my all time favorite place to eat.  Everything is good.  If you go, try the Parmesan Encrusted Scallops...Incredible.  Never much of a wait and the service has always been awesome.
author: Laurenda H.

description: Went for the Clam Chowder, and it did not disappoint.  Without question, the Best Chowder in the Bay Area.
author: Topher C.

description:
My husband and I stayed at Argonaut hotel this weekend for our anniversary.  We decided to eat there Sat night since we were leaving that night and our bags were right next door at the hotel baggage check.  We had been walking around all day and we actually had shared a Boudin clam chowder in a bread bowl AND a crab cocktail, so we were not super hungry, but decided to try the Blue Mermaid anyway because of the "award winning" crab and corn chowder.

It actually was really good.  It's not your typical super gooey chowder, it had a lighter consistency with some smokiness and spiciness to it.  It was definitely interesting and unique.  One of the typical NE clam chowder ingredients is some bacon bits, and in the case of this chowder, it felt like the crab bits were rendered until slightly crispy and then added into broth.

We also shared the mahi mahi with mango salsa and asked for veggies and fries (garlic parmesan).  We were afraid we were going to explode (well, I actually had eaten almost all the bread bowl from Boudin) but when the food came, it was so tasty and fresh we didn't mind chowing down.  Unfortunately my Mahi Mahi had come in a bit undercooked, which was a big deal for a pregnant lady (me), so they took it to re-cook.  I'm actually glad they did not refire a new one but I'm sure they would have if I asked.  

As we waited for them to cook the Mahi, we started on the veggies and fries and those were VERY VERY YUMMY.  The veggies were french string beans with some cooked tomato.  They were crisp without having that super vegetably taste and some of the mango salsa from the fish had mixed with the string beans giving it a really fresh flavor.  The fries SMELLED AWESOME and tasted even more awesome.  They were about the size of the string beans (skinny too) and were very garlicky and flavorful, yet amazingly I couldn't actually SEE the garlic bits, which means the garlic was infused into the fries.  Seriously, they were delicious, perfectly crisp and did not get soggy throughout the night amazingly.

So as we finished devouring our large portion of sides, our waiter brought our now-thoroughly-cooked Mahi Mahi with a plate full of veggies and fries!! dejavu.  The Mahi Mahi still had the great grill marks, fresh taste and the slightly smoky flavor.  The grilled lemon that accompanied the dish helped keep the fish warm when squirting on the lemon and gave it an extra smokiness as well.  Mm.... it was like eating really good grilled chicken in a way.  It surprised us how good this food was considering how simple and plain to see the ingredients were.

By that time we were stuffed, so we took half the fish and the rest of the dish to go.  We microwaved it the next day and everything still smelled fresh and tasted great, even for my mom who wasn't even there to taste the original.  I would definitely go back just to eat the fries and try all the chowders!

- Food was of very high quality, seasoned just right and seafood was incredibly fresh
- Crab and corn chowder is definitely worth a try as it's very unique
- Server was attentive
- Garlic-Parmesan Fries were also very good
author: Windy C.

description: The chowder is tres yummy (try the corn and crab variant), the drinks are generous, and the staff is great. Good spot if you're staying in north beach or near the wharf
author: Marco H.

description: The tomato-based chowder was excellent, the atmosphere very comfortable and relaxed and the wait staff was fantastic.  My only complaint was that the prices were a bit high for the food, but then again, it's a touristy area of the city.
author: Juliana W.

description: excellent chowder . . . great service.    in a beautiful place.     what more could ye ask for ?
author: Jean H.

description: Came here for happy hour....$3 drinks and appetizers how can you say no....We had buffalo wings, calamari, clam strips, fried mushrooms and a bowl of their crab and corn chowder.....everything was ok.  the best part was the mushrooms and the chowder....the mushrooms were so yum....i felt bad cuz the mushrooms were so good i didnt realized i ate most of the mushrooms and left only one for my bf to try.  haha...the whole time i was like....damn i better eat them first before my bf gets to them....it wasnt till the ride home when my bf said...we are going to have to go back for the mushrooms cuz you ate it all...hahah......overall...good experience....bartender was nice, food was served quick and food was good.
author: Sheryll D.

description: Decided on a whim to walk the wharf and happened upon this lil gem. We took a seat at the bar and ordered a few appetizers. We had the famous Corn and Crab chowder. Although it was light on the crab (maybe it dissintegrated while cooking? ) but there were clams, potatoes, celeries and the consistency was just right. Pretty tasty and what you'd expect from a chowder house. =D We also ordered the steamed mussels, which was in a wine and garlic-y sauce with tomatoes. Totally worth it for $11. The place has nice decor and staff and other customers are very friendly. Would definitely go back to try more goodies!
author: Patrick M.

description: Fast service, great local microbrew and delicious food - what more could you ask for as a tourist? He had the cioppino and I the award-winning Dungeness crab and corn chowder. Mine was light, creamy and filled with huge chunks of fresh, tasty crab. His was the best example of the local crazy seafood soup that we've had, and at not too bad a price. Have paid more for less before! Overall, it was hard to walk past this place on the second night without going back in, but we really should try something else!
author: Erika L.

description: I was having a bowl of clam chowder at work the other day, and for some reason, I was reminded of my Blue Mermaid experience. Their chowder is the perfect treat for a cold foggy San Francisco Day.
author: Sue L.

description: Yep i like touristy stuff and this place rates ;)  fun for people watching, sipping a bloody mary, a beer, munching on some fried shrimp & a salad...haven't tried anything else- but my friend had the clam chowder and liked it.
author: Julia W.

description: Come here during crab season and I swear to God you can have the most scrumptous seafood dishes you've ever tasted.  This restaurant is located on the ground floor of a hotel and strolling through the lobby is fun because it's decorated like the deck of a ship.  Very cool.  The seating is a little werid.  I like sitting in a booth, damnit.  Our service was good, the wine was wonderful and choosing one entree on the menu was like pulling teeth. Difficult.  The fried calamari was up there on my list and definitely try the chowder sampler!
author: Amy M.

description: so honestly I wavered between a 3 and 4 on this one but decided to go with 4. Hubby and I had the crab/corn chowder which was pretty good. It has all sorts of things besides crab and corn in it, potato, ham or bacon?, green onions, maybe a little red pepper? I liked it but I think perhaps i'm a purist and would rather have a little bit thicker chowder and just corn, crab and maybe a little green onion or red pepper.... son had new england clam chowder in the bowl and ate the whole thing... daughter had the chicken club sandwich (which comes with avocado although they don't mention that on the menu--as someone who is highly allergic to avocado, this is an issue, fortunately daughter is not) the sandwich was freaking huge. seriously gigantic. they drank root beer (bottles) and I had ice tea. our bill was around $66 for lunch which at Fisherman's Wharf is not a bad deal.
author: lisa h.

description: Kinda touristy but all in all not a bad experience. I came on a Friday night with my new roommates for a last minute dinner and we sat outside and listened to the live music playing in the courtyard. I have to admit the steamed mussels I had for dinner were some of the best I've ever had. The prices seemed a little steep for this kind of restaurant, but I'm guessing that's probably a result of the location. Service was slightly quirky, for lack of a better word.
author: Lindsey S.

description: Good crab and corn chowder. Cute outdoor patio. French fries are soggy. Fish and chips were okay. Not sure if I'd go back but was a cute spot to try.
author: Kimi O.

description: I pretty much came in here looking for some chowder and alcohol-mai tai. The chowder bowl was kind of small but tasted good. The restaurant is connected to the Argonaut hotel so people wander over from that money pit. Service was strange as I seemed to have three different waiters. Bizarre..I thought the pirate shirts were ugly.
author: Jason W.

description: 3.5 stars really. Went here for a quick late lunch on Saturday. Had a nice alfresco table, which was perfect on such a sunny day. It wasn't too crowded with tourists either, but this was at 2PM. I had their famous Dungeness crab & corn chowder, which won the Annual Schweppes Great Chowder Cook-off in 2004 and 2005, which is the largest national chowder competition. It was indeed yummy, I had it in the sourdough bread bowl. Not bad for $8.95. Had to park in the nearby Anchorage parking garage, which was $5 for the one hour we were there.
author: Hao L.

description: One of the few places at the Wharf worth spending your time and money on. The decor is eh but the food is delicious, generously portioned without being onset-obesity gross, and completely reasonably priced. I had the Dungeoness crab sandwich, which was just so yum and tasted fresh, while my boy had the caesar salad and New England chowder, proclaiming them both really good. We licked our plates clean. Our waitress was attentive and friendly.
author: Ayelet I.

description: I had one decent experience here which prompted me to bring my friend who was visiting from out of town.  The first time around, the sampler chowder was superb (I picked Dungenness Crab & Corn, California Chowder, Shrimp & Red Pepper).  However, the second time, the chowder was watery.  The crab in the crab sandwich was also watery.  And the battered cod sandwich was lacking taste.  Overall,  a horrible second time experience, especially since the waitress didn't provide good service (nowhere to be found, didn't clear our plates away).  The prices are the same as any other chowder place in the area so they must make their money by watering down their food.  The only plus was the Oysters Rockerfeller.  Otherwise, do not go here.
author: La A.

description: Parmesan crusted scallops ($22)  were good, nice and big pieces with good taste added by the crust. Ice tea supposedly sweetened with lemonade but it made the ice tea a little bit sour. Interesting. My gf had the linguini with clams, friend had a cheeseburger and other friend had shrimp scampi. Shrimp scampi looked really good. Service was prompt, as the waiter would quickly refill drinks. Good place to take your friends as a casual eat. Has a bar with TV for sports also.
author: David N.

description: We were staying at the adjacent hotel, and went for breakfast.  Hostess seated us right away, but we waited a while to be asked if we wanted coffee. I ordered the bacon quiche, and at 8:30 am on a Saturday, they didn't have any?!?  Settled for the veggie quiche instead. Nice and hot and even tasty.  Seemed to have a few too many large carrot chunks as filler though. Hubby said his potatoes were cold, and coffee refills were S.L.O.W.  The waiter brought the bill folio WITH the food, and stood it right in the middle of the table between us. Seemed odd.  I was not impressed, and the bill for a breakfast for two seemed a little overpriced for what we got.  OK, but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend, at least not for breakfast!
author: Lynnette C.

description: I have fond memories of this place.  I came here when I was just visiting San Francisco, so it's always fun to be a tourist.  Anyhow, the chowder was really delicious.  They had several types to choose from.  This place is a wonderful place to warm up, have a beer and a bowl of chowder on a cold San Francisco day.
author: Sarah F.

description:
clam chowder  -  B
customer service - D
restaurant's cleanliness - C
kid's menu - D (complete garbage)
author: adrian s.

description: right on jefferson street which is the main drag at the wharf. came in later in the evening for a drink. have had breakfast there before. we had the mojitos. they were fabulous. you could smell the freshly muddled mint from ten feet away. staff was super friendly and attention. if there was one drawback it would be at $12 a piece it's expensive to tank up there.
author: scott c.

description: Why isn't there a grade BELOW 1 star???? We live in San Jose, but we decided to spend 4 days in San Francisco to play tourist, get away from San Jose, and eat as much fresh Dungeness crab as possible. Where we eat is defined by where we are allowed to eat with our little Yorkie. That means patio or sidewalk dining & it means being made to feel welcome. The Blue Mermaid Chowder House was on our list of places we had to go back to. We last ate there in August when we took my parents and a lot of other members of our family. The service in August was great, our Yorkie was welcomed by the Wait staff and they even gave her a bowl of water, the food was good, but the crab & corn chowder was awesome. So this past Monday, before leaving our hotel for the walk to the Blue Mermaid, we called ahead to see if we needed reservations or not for patio dining. (I am disabled so it was important to know that before we made the long walk.) We told the young lady that there was 5 of us plus our Yorkie so we needed the outside seating. She assured us that there was plenty of seating on the patio at that time so we gave our name and said we would be there in 20 minutes. When  we arrived, there was an older, red haired woman in a purple dress who told us that she could seat us, but our dog would not be allowed on the patio with us. My wife told her that we had just called and we were assured that dining with our dog would not be a problem. This lady very snootily stated that she didn't know who said that but they were wrong. I asked her why? She stated that it was against health code. I asked her when this occurred. She stated about one year ago. I told her we just ate there in August and we had no problem then. She stated that the City passed new health codes right after that. Well, she was changing her story so fast that I figured she was either a real crappy liar or simply someone with a real crappy attitude. So I asked why other restaurants in San Francisco allow dogs. She responded that the law only applied to the Fisherman's Wharf section of San Francisco. Huh? The City cracked down only on a part of the City that brings in huge revenues from tourists? I pointed out that I could clearly smell cigarette and cigar smoke, so why is that allowed? And pigeons are all over the patio and on empty tables, crapping everywhere, so how is that not a health code violation? She simply got snootier. I told my wife that we should go eat somewhere else and I turned to walk away. My wife though had her heart set on the crab & corn chowder so she said that if we get a table by the fence, she could keep our Yorkie right next to us, though technically it would not be within the patio. My wife got the lady to seat us, who then threw the menus down on the table, and walked away from us. That left my wife & I and our three daughters all sitting there in stunned silence! By this point, we were very insulted & upset and I made a comment that I thought the lady was lying, because this was San Francisco, the most liberal City in the world where even dope smokers smoke openly and animals have more rights than humans. Our waiter was serving the kids at the time and overheard me talking, so my wife asked the waiter if it is really against the law to disallow dogs on the patio in San Francisco? He laughed and said 'of course not'! That was the manager's rule. We ordered our lunch and periodically the lady manager would do something rude near us like once she loudly 'dropped' a chair right next to our table for no apparent reason and made no effort to apologize. We also watched as she argued with other customers and we watched several potential customers walk away after receiving a confrontation from the manager. I don't know what this lady's problem is, but if I was determined to destroy my business or my business's reputation, I would hire her. Since YELP is a public forum, I will describe this lady as nicely as I possibly can by saying she is 110% BIATCH! By the way, her name is Lorraine or Larraine, not sure which. Her last name might be Skank. There are many good places you can go in San Francisco to play tourist, get a decent meal, and spend a lot of money in the process. No one needs to go to this place just so you can be treated like crap while you dump a lot of money into her pockets. We will NEVER go back to this dump and we will inform everyone we can to avoid this dump too! Maybe the health department should check this place out. I think the manager is a walking health code violation! Avoid this dump!
author: Dwight M.

description: Chowder is fair, the rest expensive and ordinary.
author: Colin Y.

description: I had my wedding at the Argonaut Hotel a few weeks ago. The Blue Mermaid was wonderfully accommodating about helping us organize a brunch for family the following morning. The food was delicious and reasonably priced.
author: Margaret C.

description: MAN. This will be  toughie.  All I really wanted was some clam chowder, and after seeing a sign for "Best Chowder" I was hooked.  There was a bit of a wait, which was expected since this is smack dab in the middle of Fisherman's Wharf and tourists, but the hostess was extremely friendly and accomodating (funny how I note that even though that's probably a requirement at most establishments and often isn't the case...).  The Mister and I finally sat and ordered, respectively, the New England Clam Chowder and the Dungenness Crab and Corn Chowder, both in bread bowls of course.  We also ordered a side of garlic parmesan fries.  The chowders came out, and yes they were quite delicious, but I don't know if they're the BEST ever. It was probably our mistake to get it in a bread bowl (how can you resist really), but we've quickly realized that you don't get much soup when you get it in the bread bowl.  The bread soaks it up and there's not much substance left except what's in the chowder.  So yes, the taste was great, the portions were okay (again probably our fault for the bread bowl situation) and the service was great too.  The fries were pretty good.  Very thinly sliced/ordered, seasoned well and fried to a good crisp texture.  We probably won't go back, but it's worth trying!
author: Jen T.

description: Thanks to Sarah and NoName in the morning I decided to give this place a try. Its tucked down in the updated Cannery, attached to the Argonaut Hotel, they have decent patio seating, although on Friday and Saturdays you have to deal with the Farmer's Market till noon. Inside is rustic, with bench style seating, open brick faced walls, and huge overhead beams. Its perfect for a quick lunch on a sunny day while strolling the wharf district. But be careful you will have to brave the tourists on the weekends. My last visit was punctuated with a musical treat by a pretty good Sax player who jammed in the centre of the plaza. These guys have eight different yummy chowder styles including one that supposedly won first place at some huge contest back east. I haven't tried the other seafood items on the menu so I can't say for sure if they put as much love into them.  I know its in a touristy spot, but you should definitely give it a chance if you get caught playing tour guide to your outta town visitors. I can honestly say that they do come close to beating out the Swan Oyster Depot in the New England Clam Chowder category, according to my roomie, who happens to be from Boston. I tend to go for the award winning Crab and Corn chowder...mmmmm
author: Manny V.

description: I just moved here, but I've been told that San Franciscans have sacrificed the Wharf area completely to tourists and nobody really goes down there.  I don't pay attention to all that.  Fortunately, the wharf is just a hop, skip, and a jump away from me, so after battling parking on Hyde street (where I took out at least two people's bumpers) I ventured down to the wharf area, to see what I could find to eat.  The Chowder House bar offered a chowder sampler which was right up my alley.  $8.95 and I get to try 3 out of the 6 or 7 chowders offered.  Score!  Each chowder came in a little bowl which was a bit dissapointing, but I guess I couldn't complain because it's only a SAMPLE.  The award winning crab and corn was good and a bit spicy but not too hot.  The regular new england clam chowder was the second best chowder I've ever tasted.  A bit different, as the broth was a bit thinner than I'm used to, but definitely packed with a lot of flavor.  The 1st best chowder I'ver ever tasted was a bowl I had in Boston if you're curious.  The 3rd sample was a shrimp and red pepper chowder which wasn't that great, so I ended up picking the shrimp out of it and calling it a day.  The sampler tided me over for a while, but I definitely wasn't full.  It's more of a lunch time item. The sourdough bread was tasty, the waitress was friendly, and I kept smelling really good things being cooked/grilled in the back kitchen.  I'm looking forward to going back some time soon.
author: LaSha G.

description: Ate at Blue Mermaid while on a recent business trip in San Francisco. The staff were friendly and the service was excellent. They had the best clam chowder I've ever had (and I've had my share), but my dinner of breaded scallops, while good, wasn't fantastic. As a former Californian, I did appreciate the Anchor Steam on tap. I will definitely return when I'm back in town!
author: Scott B.

description: I went to Blue Mermaid with a coworker as it seemed to have one of the better sit-down menus around the Wharf. We both ordered the crab corn chowder and thought it was tasty. Our drinks were strong, which is always a plus. We split french fries = gross. The outdoor patio was awesome and our server was really attentive.
author: kathleen m.

description: Delicious crab sandwich - good sourdough bread, fresh tasty crab, what more could you want?
author: Kevin F.

description: this review was only for some late nite drinks and chowder, but what we did have was great! i really thought the chowder was some of the best ive had in san francisco.  it was different since it wasn't the really thick kind, but it had a really nice taste to it.  the service was also very friendly and attentive.  i don't know if i would order anythign else besides the chowder though.  the other food seemed kind of unspectacular and overpriced since its in fishermans wharf.
author: Molly C.

description: I got the corn and crab chower, which was good. My bf got the burger, which wasn't impressive and was overpriced. Our server was good, although really intense and said the word "perfect" maybe 25 times during our meal. Our food came out quickly and the beer was ice cold. We were staying at the hotel connected to it, so it was ok for one night, but I wasn't dying to go back again.
author: Allison M.

description: do you like bleu cheese dressing? if so, do not walk, RUN to the blue mermaid and order the wedge salad. tell them you live in SF and you'll get a discount. however, i agree with dianasaurus...the staff is full of freaks. but that doesn't really bother me too much. what bothers me is when the service is so slow that my stomach starts eating itself. oh, and it's kinda pricey for a salad with chicken. but again, if you like bleu cheese...
author: stephanie g.

description: Loved the crab and corn chowder.  Good popcorn shrimp.  Light & tasty.  Very kid friendly.
author: John A.

description: Great clam chowder. Try the sampler and get a taste of a few different chowders. Also, getting the chowder in the bread bowl is the way to go.
author: Ron F.
